loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 42 years old and married with six children, four of whom are in school. Imelda works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like noodles, coffee, milk, etc. to sell.

Imelda has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Imelda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like noodles, coffee, milk, etc. to sell

loans.name: Vanney

texts.en:
In the picture, Vanney, 49, (right) with her husband, Sok, 50, (left) live in the community of Takeo province. The couple has only one child who is currently in school. Vanney is a weaver and earns, on average, USD 4 per day. So far, she has been in this career for more than 20 years. 

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy-and-sell rice business.

Gemma has been in this business for eight years. Gemma earns more income from a general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina works hard to support her family. Gina is married and has a business buying and selling used clothes in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of used clothes to sell.

Gina has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from buying and selling frozen products.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

In the future, Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Jharna

texts.en:
Jharna is from a small village of Falakata, West Bengal, India. She is 26 years old and lives with her husband and one toddler son. She has attended school until grade four.

Jharna's husband is a farmer. Cultivation and vending is the primary source of livelihood for the family. Jharna's husband manages this business together with Jharna. They grow different crops on their farmland and sell the harvest products to the wholesale traders of the nearby market and sometimes in a retail outlet.

The income from this is insufficient to meet the day-to-day expenses of the family as well as the farm expenses. To diversify the income and to earn better, they now like to grow paddies. Being a staple food, paddy has a very good acceptability in the local market. So, Jharna wants to expand their business by taking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).

She will use it to buy high-quality seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides for paddy cultivation. Jharna expects a good return from her business by expanding her cultivation. She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Honeylee

texts.en:
Honeylee is 51 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school. Honeylee works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, soap, chips, coffee, etc.

Honeylee has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Honeylee would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, soap, chips, coffee, etc

loans.name: Shyamali

texts.en:
Shyamali is an active lady of 26 years. She lives with her husband and two children in the small village of Dakshin Parengerpar in Falakata. She was deprived of education in her childhood due to her family’s financial problem. Now she is a homemaker and raising her children (a daughter and a son). Her children read in the local village school.

Shyamali's husband has been engaged with farming activities. He cultivates different crops on their own plot of land. Though Shyamali is a housewife, she helps her husband in the farming work. Together, the couple has been working hard, since this is their sole source of income. They have been selling the produce in the local town market. However, a major part of the harvest is sold to the wholesale dealers in the market.

Now they want to expand their business by cultivating paddies, as paddy is a staple food of the region and the demand for it has always been good. Shyamali wants a good and abundant harvest so that the rest of the year they don't have to face any financial problems. For that, they need good-quality seeds and other farm supplies. To achieve the same, the couple needs some capital.

So, Shyamali has taken a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase good-quality paddy seeds, fertilizers, and other agricultural inputs to grow paddies. She hopes this loan will help them to have smooth cultivation of the crops.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other necessary farm resources for cultivating paddies.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny works hard to support her family. Jenny is a widow and has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

Jenny has been in this business for 36 years now.

In the future, Jenny would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is 49 years old and married with five children.  With one child in school, Bernadeth works very hard to provide for them.

Bernadeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Bernadeth has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Bernadeth would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jenil

texts.en:
Jenil is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children, one of whom is in school.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, biscuits, chips, soft drinks, coffee, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming sugarcane.

Jenil dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, biscuits, chips, soft drinks, coffee, etc

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. Jocelyn is married and has a business buying and selling shrimp in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of shrimp to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 28 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of shrimp to sell

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en: Ma. Luz is a hardworking entrepreneur with two children who earns a living by buying and selling gasoline in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan from NWTF to buy additional gasoline to sell. Ma. Luz supplements her income through other business ventures, including a general store. She has successfully repaid a previous loan and and is committed to further build her businesses. She dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to send her children to college

loans.use: to buy additional gasoline to sell

loans.name: Bina

texts.en:
Bina is 30 years old. She is married and a housewife. She lives in a small village, Birpara in Alipurduar district, with her husband, Bablu, and two children (a son and a daughter). She has completed her education up to grade 9. Her children are reading in grades 7 and 2, respectively. 

Bina is a homemaker who looks after her children and solely manages household chores. Her husband is an auto driver by profession. He offers transportation service in the village and nearby villages using his three-wheeled auto rickshaw in order to make a living. He carries peoples from one place to another. He has been involved in this business for many years. Now the auto needs repair because it has been damaged from overuse. He wants to repair it as soon as possible, as it is the main income-generating source for their family.

As a responsible wife, Bina decided to help her husband and applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to cover the cost of repairing the auto rickshaw. Bina hopes that with the help of this loan, her husband can repair the auto and can provide better transport facilities to the village people, and thus, can earn a lucrative income. 

Her dream is to provide a better education to her children. Bina is thankful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to pay for the repair cost of her husband’s auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in bricks, cement, sand, gravel, and iron to build a sewer system for his house.

loans.name: Crestita

texts.en:
Crestita is 69 years old and married with six children. Crestita works very hard to provide for them.

Crestita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Crestita has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Crestita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 44 years old and married with six children. With two children in school, Gloria works very hard to provide for them.

Gloria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care, condiments, and other groceries.

Gloria has been in this business for six years. 

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care, condiments, and other groceries

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 42 years old and married. She has four children who are in school.

Dolores is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Dolores has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Dolores would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a 30-year-old woman with five children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Maricel has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell.

Maricel has been in this business for two years. In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 52 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like rice, soft drinks, sardines, etc. to sell.

Josephine has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like rice, soft drinks, sardines, etc. to sell

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 40 years old and married and has two children who are still in school.

Irene is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Irene requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Irene has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a 42-year-old married woman with seven children, six of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Patricia has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. Patricia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell.

Patricia has been in this business for three years. In the future, Patricia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Segundo Matias

texts.es:
Segundo Matias cuenta con 30 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, vive con su familia en este mismo distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo, Región Lambayeque, Costa norte del Perú.

Él se desempeña como mototaxista, con más de 5 años de experiencia en este servicio, sus servicios los brinda dentro la zona, solicita préstamo para mejoramiento de infraestructura donde guarda su mototaxi, dicha inversión le servirá para conservar en mejores condiciones su vehiculo motor, para poder seguir satisfaciendo de la mejor manera la demanda de dicho servicio en la zona, así aumentar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus condiciones de vida y de su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo Matias is 30 years old. He is single, without children. He lives with his family in this same district of Oyotún, in a rural zone that belongs to the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

He works as a motorcycle taxi driver, with more than 5 years of experience in this service. He offers his services within the zone. He is applying for the loan to improve the infrastructure of the place where he keeps his motorcycle taxi. This investment will serve him to keep his motor vehicle in better conditions so that he will be able to continue satisfying the demand for this service in the zone in the best way, thus increasing his income, which will allow him to improve his living conditions and those of his family.

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure of the place where he keeps his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Dipa

texts.en:
Dipa is a 45-year-old widowed woman from a small village, Harinathpur in Falakata. She is a mother of two children (a daughter and a son). Her son is a mason by occupation and her daughter has gotten married. She was deprived of education in her childhood due to her family's financial issues and can sign her name only. Unfortunately, she lost her husband a few years ago, and she had to take all the responsibilities of the family. 

Dipa, being a housewife, now runs her own animal husbandry. She owns milking cows, and she sells milk to her local villagers and neighbors. She earns barely enough to cover all the household expenses. To cope with the growing demand of her customers and rising prices of daily essential commodities, she wants to expand her business. So Dipa applied for a loan from BJS (a Kiva partner) to purchase a dairy cow. 

With this, she hopes she can sell more milk as per her customers’ demand so that she can increase her income and thereby increase her savings also, which is very much essential for future emergencies. It will also help to expand her business for her family’s well-being.   

Dipa extends her deep gratitude to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Lilanie

texts.en:
Lilanie is a married woman, 52 years old with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Lilanie has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Lilanie requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

Lilanie has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is a 47-year-old married woman with eight children, five of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Raquel has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish net and bamboo, gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business.

Raquel has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish net and bamboo, gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is 47 years old, married, and the mother of twelve children, four of whom are in school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 from NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her livestock. Patricia has been in her current line of work for 10 years, and has taken out two prior loans from NWTF. Her goal for the future is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 67 years old and married with five children. With one child in school, Vicenta works very hard to provide for them.

Vicenta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like snack foods, canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Vicenta has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Vicenta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like snack foods, canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 65 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Alicia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like personal care products, home care products, and other groceries.

Alicia has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Alicia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like personal care products, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She supplements this income with earnings from selling fish.

Betty is now borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Betty dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en:
Living in a remote area of the Kampong Cham province, Sorn is 48 years old. She has six children, and only one of them is in school.

The sources of her family’s income are from working rice fields and working as a construction worker for thirty years. She can earn around 34,500 KHR per day for supporting her family. She has been with VisionFund for two cycles already and completely paid back the loan.

Sorn is now leading a group of five to take this new Kiva loan via VisionFund. Through this loan, she will buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She expects that her farming will gain more yields than the previous year.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Sokha is 45 years old, married with five children and lives in Kandal province, Cambodia. She has grown rice since 1995. Her husband is 46 years old and makes copper objects. Two of her children work in construction and three others are in school. Sokha’s family can earn around $26 a day, but she lacks the money to buy rice seeds for her farm and gas for her water pump, and pay her workers. That is why she has requested a loan to help her grow her crop and better support her family. In the future, she wants to add a ground-floor room to her home and help her children earn high school diplomas.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and gas for her water pump, and to pay her workers.

loans.name: Nancy Giovanna

texts.es: Nancy Giovanna  tiene la edad  de 29 años, está casada, vive con el esposo  y tres hijos  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Élla no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Nancy Giovanna is 29 years old. She is married. She lives with her husband and three children, who are her greatest priority. With her loan, she plans to make the purchase of fertilizers and fungicides, and, in addition, buy some nursery plants in order to make a replanting at the beginning of the rains, with the goal of increasing the density of plants by area. 

With these improvements in her plantings, she hopes to obtain some earnings and thus improve the living conditions of her family. This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has not had other previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies and seedlings

loans.name: Yorn's Group

texts.en: Yorn is a 52-year-old farmer who lives in Battambang province. She is the mother of five children, one of whom is in school. She earns about 75,600 KHR per day by growing rice for sale. She has been with VisionFund for three prior loans that she successfully paid back. She now leads a group of three lenders and will use her portion of this loan to buy rice seeds and pay a plowing fee. In the future, she hopes to buy additional farmland.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 35 years old and has five children. Angelita is married and three of her children are in school.

Angelita is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Angelita requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Angelita has been in this business for three years now, and she has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Angelita would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan de 57 años de de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace 6 años, comercializa sus productos cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar,  el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, herbicidas etc. y así tener mejores ingresos económicos  para una mejora calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan is 57 years old and lives in a house that he owns with his family. Juan makes a living growing corn and beans. He has done this work for six years. Juan sells his crops near his home and supports his family with his earnings. 

He is requesting this loan in order to buy compost, fertilizers, seeds, weedkiller, etc. In this way, he will obtain higher profits to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizer, seeds, weedkiller, etc.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Beatriz works hard to support her family.

Beatriz has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store. Beatriz is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable vending business.

Beatriz has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is a married woman and 29 years old. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Bernadette has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Bernadette requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy fruit to sell.

Bernadette has been in this business for two years. In the future, Bernadette would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza  tiene la edad  de 41 años, está casada, vive con el esposo y un hijo actualmente. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café y con estas condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café con esto espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Élla no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Maritza is 41 years old. She is married and now lives  with her husband and a son. With her loan, she plans to make the purchase of fertilizers and fungicides and pay for labor to help her with work on the coffee [planting]. With these conditions of climate and others that favor raising coffee, she hopes to obtain some earnings and thus improve the living conditions of her family and also accomplish some goals.

This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has not had any other previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cristina is 44 years old and three of her children are in school.

Cristina has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Cristina requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fruit to sell.

Cristina has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Cristina would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en: Cristy is a woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cristy is 31 years old and has two children who are in school. She has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines, which she has been operating for two years. Cristy requested a 7000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy more items for her business. In the future, Cristy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items for her manicure and pedicure business.

loans.name: Kandi

texts.en:
Kandi is a 34-year-old woman. She lives with her husband and two sons; both of them are students of different grades. Her husband, Paritosh, is a farmer. They live at Dalimpur, a remote village in Falakata, Alipurduar district. Kandi and her husband both are illiterate and can sign their names only.

Kandi's husband cultivates vegetables in their farmland. He harvests and sells different seasonal crops in the local markets with the help of Kandi. Now they want to grow paddy (rice). Being the staple food for the people of their locality, paddy has good demand in the market. They have a very good relationship with their customers, as they supply quality products at cheaper rates and on time. But due to shortage of funds, they are unable to fulfill their new idea of cultivating paddy on a large scale. 

As such, Kandi is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase seeds and fertilizers for paddy cultivation.

She hopes she will earn more from this business to improve their living conditions and provide good education to her sons. In the future, she dreams to buy more farmland with the generated profit for more cultivation.

She is very grateful to Kiva and BJS for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Anjali

texts.en:
Anjali is a 41-year-old, rural woman. She lives in a small village in Falakata, West Bengal. She is a mother of three daughters; all of them are married. Anjali is a very active and energetic lady. She had no opportunity in her childhood to study, so she is illiterate and only can sign her name.  

Her husband is a vegetable grower. He grows vegetables that are widely consumed by the local people, and the major part of the harvest is sold to the wholesale dealers. Anjali helps her husband by going to the nearest villages for doorstep vending. Presently, the family earnings are barely enough to manage their family expenses and savings for the future. So, for future development, they have decided to diversify their business with cultivation of cucumber on a large scale, which is a profitable crop. 

Anjali has applied for a loan from BJS (a field partner of Kiva) to purchase necessary farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for cucumber cultivation. 

She hopes this will help her in increasing her family income to run her family better. With the generated profit, she has a long-cherished desire to purchase another piece of farmland for more cultivation in the future.

She is very much thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase farm resources for cucumber cultivation.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Flora is 45 years old and has four children who are in school. She has a motorcycle spare parts business in the Philippines, which she has been operating for 16 years. Flora requested a 15,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy additional inventory of spare parts to offer for sale. In the future, Flora would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for her motorcycle spare parts store.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: As a parent of six children, Evangeline works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from running a general store. Evangeline is borrowing 7000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food vending business. Evangeline has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 57 years old and has 5 children. She is married, and 2 of her children are in school.

Gloria is in the agriculture business, farming bananas in the Philippines. She has requested a 14,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy fertilizers and other pesticides for her farm.

Gloria has been farming bananas for 20 years now, and she has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of 3 children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

Evelyn has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from providing manicure and pedicure services.  

Evelyn is borrowing 7,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more coconut wine for her coconut wine vending business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business so she can secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Phal's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in Battambang province, Phal is 42 years old. She is a mother of three children; one of them is in school. 

For her living, Phal grows cassava as the main source of her income. She also raises piglets and works another farm for a fee to earn extra income. She can earn around 148,000 KHR per day via her business. 

Phal is now leading a group of two to take her first Kiva loan via VisionFund. She will spend her entire loan portion to pay for seeds and the ploughing fee to support her cassava growing. 

She hopes that she can earn more income to buy more farmland to expand her farming area.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and the ploughing fee to support her cassava growing

loans.name: Dipali

texts.en:
Dipali is a rural woman hailing from a small village, Palashbari in the district of Alipurduar, West Bengal. She is married and the mother of a son. 

Enterprising Dipali runs her own sewing micro-enterprise. Her son now works for a private company. Now at 56, she is continually giving her tireless efforts to grow up her business for the family's welfare. 

Her husband, being an elderly person, does nothing, so Dipali is the primary earning member for the family. She takes orders from local customers and sews ladies’ dresses, blouses, frocks and dresses for kids and men. She lives in such an area where there are few such tailors and so there is never a shortage of orders. Seeing the potential for growth, she wants to buy a better professional sewing machine. The upgraded machine will help her increase her productivity. The only thing stopping her now is a lack of funds to invest in the new sewing machine. 

This is why Dipali is seeking a business loan from BJS (a Kiva partner) to grow her own small micro-enterprise. The loan will help Dipali take a crucial step toward realizing her business potential and goals for her family. 

She is grateful to her lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy a better sewing machine and increase the productivity and profits of her small sewing business.

loans.name: Betty Alicia

texts.es:
Betty Alicia tiene 45 años de edad, casada tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en el Distrito de Oyotún, una zona rural que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, huevos, menestras;desde hace más 10 años en el negocio, ella ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa que le permitirá comprar mayor variedad de productos esto le servirá para incrementar sus ventas; Betty Alicia piensa tener mayor stock de productos para poder atender las diversas necesidades, requerimientos y gustos de los clientes de la zona, y generar mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Betty Alicia is 45 years old, married, and has two children. He lives with his family in the Oyotún district, a rural zone where people make a living in agriculture, trade, and raising livestock. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, which is in the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Perú. 

Betty Alicia makes a living selling groceries such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, eggs, and soups. She has run her store for over 10 years. Betty Alicia is requesting this loan through Edpyme Alternativa to allow her to buy a bigger variety of products. This will help her increase her sales. Betty Alicia thinks that having a larger stock of products will help her supply items for the diverse needs and tastes of her customers and increase her profits so that she can improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products and make her store grow.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Jose de 36 años de edad  vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace 3 años comercializa sus productos  en los pueblos aledaños y ya tiene clientes establecidos, Jose está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas etc. y así poder  continuar con sus cosechas y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jose is 36 years old and lives in his own house with his life companion. He has been growing corn and beans for three years. He sells his product in the neighboring towns and has established customers. Jose is requesting a loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, herbicides, etc. so he can continue with his crops and enjoy a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Jose De La Paz

texts.es:
José, de 53 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos y  a la elaboración de matatas, tienen dos hijos, los cuales ya son adolescentes y todavía están estudiando.

José, desde muy joven su padre le ayudo a trabajar la tierra, ya que el era el primogénito y luego que su padre muriera, él tuvo que ayudarle a su madre a sacar adelante a sus hermanos menores.- Actualmente, compra y vende madera y también, siembra granos básicos.

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar abono, fertilizantes y pagar el alquiler del terreno donde sembrará.

El sueño de José, es para seguir trabajando y enseñarles a sus hijos a trabajar.
texts.en: José is 53 years old and studied up to Grade 4. He is in a relationship, his partner does housework and makes canvas bags. He has two sons who are adolescents now and still are studying. José from a young age helped his father work the land as he was the oldest. When his father died he had to help his mother raise his younger siblings. Today he buys and sells wood and grows basic grains. He will use the loan to buy manure, fertilizer and pay rent on the land he cultivates. José's dream is to continue to work and teach his children how to work.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer and pay rent on the land he cultivates.

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es:
Cruz se encuentra muy satisfecho por el apoyo brindado pues gracias al crédito él pudo comprar su terreno que en ese entonces le asía mucha falta y ahora ya cuenta con un terreno donde puede cultivar, Cruz cuenta que antes él no contaba con el apoyo de ninguna institución pero ahora gracias a ADICLA y KIVA ha logrado superarse, él ahora solicita un  nuevo préstamo para poder aprovechar una gran oportunidad que es adquirir otra cuerda de terreno para seguir incrementado su cultivo, Cruz tiene las esperanzas de contar nuevamente con su apoyo para seguir prosperando.
El sueño de este humilde  hombre es construir su casa de block, y darle  a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Cruz is very satisfied with the support he has been offered. Thanks to his previous loan, he was able to buy land that he needed. Now he has a plot of land on which to sow his crops. Cruz reports that, previously, he did not have the support of any institution. Now, thanks to ADICLA and KIVA, Cruz has been able to succeed. 

Cruz is requesting another loan to be able to take advantage of the great opportunity of acquiring another plot of land in order to keep increasing his crops. He hopes to have your support again so that he can keep prospering. This humble man's dream is to build a house made of concrete and improve his family's circumstances.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land to cultivate.

loans.name: Pritika

texts.en:
Pritika is a 39- year-old married woman from Chuakhola village in Falakata. She lives there with her husband and a son. Pritika studied up to grade four and her husband is illiterate. But the couple has a great desire to provide a good education to their only son. Their son reads in grade five in the local school.

Pritika’s husband is running a small grocery shop. Being a hardworking lady, Pritika helps her husband after managing her household work.  They sell food items like spices, rice, pulses, sugar, salt, oil, bread, eggs, biscuits, etc. and daily essential commodities to her villagers. Now the couple wants to grow the business to satisfy the demands of their customers. Thus, Pritika is taking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase more varieties of grocery items in bulk to increase the stock of her grocery shop.

With the expansion of her business, she hopes to have a better income, which will help her to develop the financial condition of her family. She wants to save the resulting profit for her child’s future and to renovate her grocery shop with a variety of items.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his corn crop

loans.name: Anibal Antonio

texts.es: Don Anibal de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, se dedica a esta actividad desde que era un niño ya que su padre le enseño ese trabajo, por eso tiene mucha experiencia en las siembras y gracias a eso es como ha podido salir adelante, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de herbicidas, semillas, abonos, fertilizantes y demás insumos agrícolas para poder obtener mejores ganancias y asid arel a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Don Anibal, who is 50 years old, lives in his own house with his family group. He raises corn and beans. He has been doing this work since he was a boy, since his father taught him this work. For this reason, he has a lot of experience with planting, and thanks to this, this is how he has been able to get ahead. 

He is applying for a loan for the purchase of herbicides, seeds, compost, fertilizers, and other agricultural supplies in order to be able to obtain better earnings and thus give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, seeds, compost, fertilizers, and other agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: Maria de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijoles desde hace varios años inicio con capital propio a causa de que su esposo se fuera para estados unidos, con esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante con sus hijos, hoy ha decidido solicitar un crédito para comprar los insumos necesarios como fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. para poder aumentar la cosecha y asi poder tener mejores ingresos para darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria, who is 42 years old, lives in her own house with her four children. She has been raising corn and beans for a number of years. She began with her own capital because her husband left for the United States. With effort, she has managed to advance with her children. Today she has decided to apply for a loan to purchase the necessary supplies such as fertilizers, compost, pest controls, etc., in order to be able to increase the harvest and thus be able to have better income to give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy the necessary supplies such as fertilizers, compost, pest controls, etc.

loans.name: Kalyani

texts.en:
Kalyani is a rural and energetic woman from Falakata. She is 49 years old and blessed with one daughter who is already married. She lives with her family in Barodoba village in Falakata with her husband Satish. Kalyani is a homemaker who looks after her family and does all the household work. 

Satish (Kalyani’s husband) is a cycle van puller and rents the cycle van from a local owner. Like a rickshaw and an auto, a cycle van is also one kind of transport, which carries people and goods from one place to another, especially in remote areas. Satish’s income is consistent enough to meet all the household expenses. From the beginning, he faced many problems running the family's expenses. Then Kalyani came to learn about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and applied for a loan to purchase a cycle van of their own. 

Now Kalyani hopes her husband’s income will increase. She hopes their family's condition will improve from the earlier situation and that she can give her best to her family for a good lifestyle.
 
Her dream is to purchase a Toto van (a kind of transport) in the future. 

Kalyani thanks her lenders for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle van for more income.

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
Jayanti is a married woman, 29 years old, and a mother of two school-going daughters. She lives in a small village in the Alipurduar district of West Bengal. She is a housewife.  Her daughters are reading in grade six and five, respectively.  Jayanti and her husband both studied until grade five.

Jayanti's husband Manik earns for the family by running a clothing business and to earn independently, Jayanti is engaged in cattle breeding. She has a dairy farm. She supplies milk to the local people and to the tea stalls of a nearby town.  As the family expenses are increasing day by day, their income is barely enough to run the family well.    

So to earn an extra income for the smooth maintenance of the family, she is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She will use the loan to purchase a milking cow to enhance her business.  She is a hardworking woman with positive thinking who wants to give her family a standard living. She hopes that this investment will help her to gain additional income to fulfill her dream of giving a higher education to her daughters.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in brick, cement, sand, gravel and steel to build a restroom in her home.

loans.name: Dipalirani

texts.en:
Forty-six-year-old Dipalirani is an illiterate woman (she can only sign her name). She lives with her husband and one son. They have a semi-concrete house in a village small village in the Alipurduar district.  

Dipalirani's husband Sujit handles his own business selling fruit. Dipali and her son assist him in this business. He sells fruit like bananas, mangoes, watermelon, oranges, apples and other seasonal fruit. He purchases fruit in bulk from wholesale markets and sells in his neighborhood. He began his business many years ago with his own funds and with the goal of helping with the expenses of his household. Today, it is the only source of income for his household.

One of his dreams is to be able to increase the inventory in his business. The current income from the business is hardly sufficient to cover all the expenses. So Dipalirani is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BJS. The purpose of this financing is to invest in working capital by buying more fruit for their business. She hopes the loan will help the business to be a profitable one, will earn more income for the well-being of the family, and will strengthen their economic condition.

Dipalirani and her husband are thankful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more stock of fruit to expand her fruit-selling business.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es: Ramón tiene la edad  de 62 años, está casado, vive con la esposa que es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Ramon is 62 years old. He is married. He lives with his wife, who is his greatest priority. With his loan, he plans to buy some seedlings to do some replanting at the beginning of the rains, with the goal of increasing the density of plants by area, in addition to taking advantage of the good fertility of the soil and the climate conditions and other conditions that favor raising coffee. With these improvements in his plantings, he hopes to obtain some earnings and thus improve the living conditions of his family, also invest a little more in the planting area, and also accomplish some goals. 

This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had any other previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy seedlings.

loans.name: Witer

texts.en:
Witer is 26 years old, married to Jane and supports a family of 1 child. 

He has been practicing farming for the last 5 years earning KES 7,000 per month. 

Witer has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to supply more milk for more income gain. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to extend his dairy farming. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply more milk for more income gain

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 67 years old and married with five children. Sarah works very hard to provide for them.

Sarah runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Sarah has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, detergent soap, rock salt, cooking oil, etc. 

In the future, Sarah would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Aileen is 37 years old and has five children who are in school.

Aileen has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. Aileen requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell for her business.

Aileen has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Aileen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell for her business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 42 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Susan is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Susan has been in this business for 3 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Warlita is 50 years old and has one child who is in school.

Warlita has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Warlita requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell.

Warlita has been in this business for two years. In the future, Warlita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Nenita

texts.en:
Ma. Nenita is 43 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Ma. Nenita has been running a general store in the Philippines for five years and also earns an income from food vending and raising livestock.

She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more grocery stock to sell.

Ma. Nenita aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery stock to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose used her previous loan to buy fresh foods like tomatoes to sell. She still sells fresh foods and at the same time does farming. Rose is faced with the challenge of low capital which hinders the progress of her business. However, she has future hopes of having a well established business. Rose has asked for a loan to buy more fresh foods like tomatoes and matooke (bananas) to sell.

loans.use: to buy more fresh foods like tomatoes and matooke (bananas) to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw embroidery materials and a wooden frame so she can knit embroidered dresses to sell.

loans.name: Anwer

texts.en:
Anwer is responsible mother of 3 children and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 10 years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family. Her husband needs to make maintenance of his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good it requires more maintenance charges on daily basis. 

Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to make maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Anwer has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.
With the help of this loan Anwer's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide the better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Anwer  also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.
Anwer is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Sampa

texts.en:
Sampa is a 35-year-old married woman and mother of two children (a son and a daughter). Her elder child reads in grade 10 and the younger one is a toddler. She is from the rural village of Birpara in the district of Alipurduar.  She studied until grade 10, and after that she got married.

Sampa's husband Pradip is a vegetable vender by profession. Sampa is an optimistic and entrepreneurial lady. She decided to help her family financially with her earnings. For this purpose, she started her business of selling clothing. She sells mainly saris (a traditional ladies dress of India); she also sells many types of ready-made garments according to the seasonal demands of her customers.

Sampa started and manages her business from her house. Now she wants to develop her business, but money is the main problem. So she is taking the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy different varieties of saris and other garments from the wholesale market to fulfill the demands of her customers. Her neighbors, relatives and friends are her main customers. Now she is playing an important role by giving financial support to her family. She is a successful entrepreneur. She expects a boost in her earnings with this loan and her plans are to use the profit of her business for the betterment of her family members and her children’s education. Her future dream is to open a clothing shop of her own.

She thanks her lenders for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase stocks for her existing clothing business.

loans.name: Khacharan

texts.en:
Forty-nine-year-old Khacharan is a married woman and a mother of four children. Her elder daughter is married. The younger daughter reads in grade 10, and her two sons are involved with some income-generating work. She lives with her husband and their one daughter and two sons in the remote village of Chuakhola in Falakata.  

Khacharan's husband is a farmer who has agricultural land where he grows different types of crops and vegetables. He plants and grows good quality crops. He has many years of experience in this line of work. He has very good personal references for his moral character and behavior and he sells good quality crops at a cheaper price compared to other sellers. That's why his customers like him.  Khacharan, though a housewife, helps her husband in his agricultural activities. Now they want to cultivate paddy because the climate and soil are perfectly suitable for paddy cultivation. 

Khacharan applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to invest in this business. She wants to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies to grow good quality paddy so that their products will be the best quality, and therefore they can sell the products to their valued customers. This will enable them to generate more income and better profits so that they can improve the quality of life for their family.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new tires and some engine maintenance for her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 45 years old, married to Sophia and supports a family of 6 children. 

He has been practicing dairy farming for the last 17 years earning KES 18,000 per month.

Peter has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to supply more milk for more income gain. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to open a retail shop in the area. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply more milk for more income gain

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy wood for energy production so as to prepare bricks for sale for more income gain.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 47 years old and he supports 5 children. 

He has been a farmer for the last 20 year and the business earns him KES 11,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing his crops so as to get a better harvest and meet client needs.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. 

His hope is to be financially stable and expand his agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing his crops so as to get a better harvest and meet client needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs and tools for high production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Amelia is 49 years old and has four children who are in school.

Amelia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Amelia requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Amelia has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Amelia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy works hard to support her family. Lucy is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Lucy requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lucy has been in this business for 3 years now.

Lucy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell rice.  Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell for her coconut wine vending business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina is 40 years old and has five children. She is married and has four children who are in school.

Edwina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Edwina requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Edwina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Flora

texts.en:
Ma. Flora is 51 years old and has one child. Ma. Flora is married and has one child who is in school.

Ma. Flora is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Ma. Flora requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional piglets, feeds and vitamins for her business.

Ma. Flora has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 24 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Ma. Flora would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feeds and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 36 years old and all of her children are attend in school.

Jocelyn has a vegetables vending business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of spices and vegetables to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of spices and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is 46 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rosanna has a frozen foods vending business in the Philippines. Rosanna requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell.

Rosanna has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Rosanna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Ashima

texts.en:
Ashima is a 40-year-old rural housewife and a mother of one daughter. She lives with her husband and daughter in Alipurduar. Her daughter is in grade three. Ashima has completed her secondary standard education. Besides being an adept homemaker and a lovely mother, she is an entrepreneur. She runs her own small home-based sewing business. 

Ashima's husband makes furniture such as beds, chairs, shelves, tables, and wardrobes per customers' orders. In order to construct the furniture, he requires materials such as logs of wood, nails, paint, glue and good modern tools. So Ashima wants to invest money to buy all the required materials for enhancing the carpentry work.

With the hope of improving their present economic situation, Ashima is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to give her husband the possibility of buying raw materials such as wood, glue, nails etc. This will allow him to handle the larger requests from his clients and supply the orders on time.  She also hopes that this business will generate enough income to offer them a better quality of life and new opportunities to get ahead. Her dream is to provide a quality education to her daughter for her future.

She expresses her gratitude to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase necessary resources for her husband's carpentry business.

loans.name: Noe Alexander

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo,  se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene 3 años de experiencia en el rubro y comercializa sus productos en los mercados que están cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en su hogar con los gastos, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas, controles de plagas entre otros  y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos para seguir ayudando en su hogar.
texts.en:
This young man's face has been hidden because he is 23 years old and lives in a high-risk area.

He has three years of experience growing corn and beans, and sells his products in the markets near his house. With the earnings he is able to help out with the costs at home, where he lives with his family.

He is asking for a loan to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, herbicides, pest control and other things so that he can increase his income and continue helping out his household.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, herbicides and insecticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fuel for her milling machine so as to offer her services fully to clients.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 29 years old, married to Patrick and supports a family 4 children. 

She has been operating in her posho mill center for the last 2 years earning KES 7,000 per month.
 
Gladys has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy spare parts for servicing and maintainability of her posho mill.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to start a retail shop. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for servicing and maintainability of her posho mill

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to advertise and build inventory for his music and fashion apparel business

loans.name: Kristy

texts.en: In 1995, Kristy decided to open an insurance company including auto, home, farm, life, and health coverage. Previously an accounting specialist for many years, she felt strongly about opening this as a family business with the goal to provide a very necessary service to the members of her community. She currently supports her two children and her hope is to grow the business so one day they can have the opportunity to take it over. She will use this loan to work on expanding and advancing the company. She plans to hire a full-time employee who will be critical in helping with marketing and updating systems and software.

loans.use: to hire a full-time employee for her insurance company

loans.name: Callen

texts.en:
Callen is 40 years old and she supports 4 children.  She has been a farmer for the last 14 year and the business earns her KES 10,000 per month. 
She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase fertilizer for top dressing her crops for a better harvest for sale in the market so as to meet client and family needs.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. 
Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for top dressing her crops for a better harvest for sale in the market so as to meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Meldred

texts.en:
Meldred is 36 years old and has four children. She is married and all four children are attending school.

Meldred is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Meldred requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Meldred has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Meldred would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Jinkee

texts.en:
Jinkee is 24 years old and married with one child. Jinkee works very hard to provide for them.

Jinkee runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home product care and other groceries.

Jinkee has been in this business for 1 year and sells a variety of items such as, canned goods, beverages, soy sauce, toiletries and other groceries. 

In the future, Jinkee would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. Gina is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 41 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Alma is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Alma has been raising pigs for 6 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling broom sticks.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 45 years old and married with five children. With four children in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

For 5 years, Evelyn has run a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, beverages, home product care and other groceries.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to restock her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy new seating and a salon equipment “hair steamer machine” for her husband's barber shop.

loans.name: Lực

texts.en:
Mr. Lực works in agriculture, farming food.

Lực is 46 years old and he is married with two children. He lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.

This is Lực's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Lực has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Lực faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

With his business profit, Lực hopes to maintain a successful business, for his business to do well, and for his family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Billgate Group

texts.en:
Kitike, who is in her early 40s is married with three children who are still in school.  She has been selling charcoal and firewood for ten years now.  She works from 8am to 6pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Kitike's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to start selling charcoal and to increase on the firewood stock and has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to increase  on firewood stock and to buy sacks of charcoal to meet her customers' demand.  She dreams of starting selling clothes.

Kitike will share this loan with her lot group BILLGATE GROUP which consist of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on firewood stocks and to buy sacks of charcoal to meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified seeds and farm input for use for high production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is 39 years old, married to Kenya and supports a family 7 children. 

She has been practicing farming for the last 8 years earning KES 8,000 per month. 

Evaline has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for more milk production and supplies for income gain.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to start a retail shop. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for more milk production and supplies for income gain

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 43 years old and she supports 5 children. 

She has been a shopkeeper for the last 18 year and the business earns her KES 11,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase goods such as cooking flour, sugar,salt, margarine and and baking flour for selling to her clients inorder to meet their needs and get money to educate her children.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. 

She hope is to be financially stable and see her children educated for life.

loans.use: to purchase goods such as cooking flour, sugar,salt, margarine and and baking flour for selling to her clients inorder to meet their needs and get money to educate her children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve her M-Pesa services to clients.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 62 years old and married with six children. With three children in school, Luz works very hard to provide for them.

Luz runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, condiments, home product care and other groceries.

Luz has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, shampoo, fabric conditioner coffee, milk, vinegar, soft drinks and other groceries. 

In the future, Luz would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, condiments, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is a widowed woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Merlyn is 50 years old and has two children who are in school.

Merlyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Merlyn requested a PHP 5,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Merlyn has been in this business for four years. In the future, Merlyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 32 years old and married with four children.

Maricel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like rice, canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

Maricel has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Maricel aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like rice, canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: David Elias

texts.es: David de 28 años es hijo de un carpintero, día tras día en el taller de su padre adquirió habilidades en este arte; su aprendizaje fue basando en las técnicas enseñadas por su padre, las cuales le permitían perfeccionar diseños, estructuras y al mismo tiempo realizar reparaciones, remodelaciones y elaboración de todo tipo de muebles en madera.  Laboró en una fábrica de muebles sin embargo no ganaba lo suficiente para ofrecer bienestar a su familia, entonces decidió independizarse. Su principal desafío fue iniciar sin las herramientas de trabajo esenciales, sin embargo poco a poco fue adquiriéndolas.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en materia prima para la producción en su negocio. David es un hombre comprometido y capaz de superar obstáculos,  por eso su meta es capacitarse y obtener un certificado de aptitud profesional y  a nivel familiar continuar trabajando para ofrecerle una educación de calidad a su hija y que pueda acceder a la universidad.
texts.en:
David, 28, is the son of a carpenter. Day after day he worked in his farther's workshop, learning the skills of this art. His knowledge was based in the techniques that his father taught him, which enabled him to create new designs and structures and also to make repairs and create all types of wood furniture.

Despite his work in a furniture factory, he didn't make enough money to offer his family a decent quality of life, and so he decided to start his own business. His main challenge was starting up without all of the essential tools of the trade, but he has been able to acquire them little by little. Currently, he is asking for his first loan from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which will be used to buy the basic materials needed for his business.

David is a dedicated man, capable of overcoming obstacles, and his goal is to educate himself and get professionally certified. At the family level, his goal is to be able to offer his daughter a high-quality education so that she can go to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Divina is 43 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Divina has a general store business in the Philippines. Divina requested a PHP 30000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items such as snack foods, rice, cooking oil, noodles, coffee, bread, etc. to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Divina has been in this business for 10 years. Divina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.
