loans.use: to purchase more items such as snack foods, rice, cooking oil, noodles, coffee, bread, etc. to sell

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Marissa works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell root crops business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.  Marissa is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy more root crops to sell for her buy and sell root crops business.

Marissa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more root crops to sell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a single woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mercy is 39 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Mercy has a direct selling personal collection products business in the Philippines. Mercy requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more products like shampoo, body soap, lotion, hair conditioners, toothpaste, etc. to sell.

Mercy has been in this business for 5 years. Mercy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more products like shampoo, body soap, lotion, hair conditioners, toothpaste, etc. to sell

loans.name: Elber Joel

texts.es:
Elber, de 35 años de años, solo estudio hasta segundo grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen dos hijos los cuales están estudiando. 

Elber, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace más de 20 años, este trabajo lo aprendió con su padre, sus cultivos están cerca de su casa y el horario de trabajo es de 12 horas, pero Elber, también tiene una pequeña granja de cerdos y pollos por lo tanto el tiene diversidad de ingresos.

Elber, necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y comprar concentrado para los pollos, con estos insumos mejorar su producción. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos se preparen academicamente.
texts.en:
Elber, 35, only studied until the 2nd grade. He is married and his wife works in the home. They have two school-aged children.

Elber has been a farmer for more than 20 years, having learned the trade from his father. His fields are close to his house and he works a 12-hour day. He also has a small farm with pigs and chickens in order to diversify his income.

Elber needs a loan to buy fertilizer for his corn and concentrated feed for his chickens. These inputs will improve his production.

His dream is for his children to get a good education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his corn crop, and concentrated feed for his chickens.

loans.name: Alfredo Arnoldo

texts.es: Alfredo de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijoles desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, con las ganancias que obtiene es como ha logrado salir adelante, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes y herbicidas, para poder continuar con sus cultivos y asi tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Alfredo is 34 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and their son. He has worked growing corn and beans for several years. He sells his products in the surrounding area of the zone where he lives. He has been able to get ahead with the earnings he has obtained. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, and weed-killer to be able to continue farming and in that way have better economic income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, and weed-killer.

loans.name: Marcos Tulio

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo,  se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos desde hace 15 años, inicio con capital propio a causa del desempleo, comercializa sus productos agrícolas en los alrededores de la zona y ya tiene clientes establecidos, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas y controles de plagas para poder tener una buena cosecha y así obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
This young man's face has been hidden because he is 27 years old and lives in a high-risk area.

He has been growing basic grains for 15 years. He started using his own capital, because of a lack of employment. He sells his products around the area and has an established customer base.

He lives in his own home with his family. He is asking for a loan to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, herbicides and pest control so that he can have a good harvest and make more profit.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, herbicides and pest control.

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es: Don Juan de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, él se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos desde hace 5 años inicio con capital propio, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside y con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas y así poder continuar con su trabajo para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan, 50, lives in his own home with his wife. He has been growing basic grains for 5 years, a venture that he started using his own capital. He sells his products around the area where he lives and makes enough to cover some of the costs of his home.

He is asking for a loan to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, and herbicides so that he can continue his work and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, herbicides.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 54 years old, married to Abel and she supports five children.She has been a farmer for the last 21 years and the business earns her KES 11,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops in her farm so as to increase nutrients in the soil for a better harvest and meet client and family needs.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops in her farm so as to increase nutrients in the soil for a better harvest and meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 24 years old, married to Peris. 

He has been practicing small scale farming for the last 5 years earning KES7,000 per month. 

Benard has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to supply more milk for more income gain. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to extend his dairy farming. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for more milk production and supplies for income gain

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional stock of veterinary drugs and medication

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more metals for use in his work for more supply to earn more income.

Glenda is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Glenda is 45 years old and one of children is in school.

Glenda has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Glenda requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Glenda has been in this business for two years. In the future, Glenda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 57 years old, married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rosita has a general store business in the Philippines. Rosita requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

Rosita has been in this business for three years. In the future, Rosita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Patricia is 55 years old now.

Patricia has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Patricia requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy interior, and other maintenance for her business.

Patricia has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Patricia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy interior and other maintenance for her bicycle transport business

loans.name: Esplita

texts.en:
Esplita works hard to support five children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Esplita requested a PHP 1800 loan through NWTF to invest in a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Esplita is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to provide her children with bright light when they study at night

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 44 years old and married.

Concepcion works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, beverages, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

Concepcion has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from buy and sell rice.

Concepcion aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, beverages, junk foods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Imelda works hard to support her family.

She has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from her general store. Imelda is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell. 

Imelda has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry feeds for his chickens for high production and  supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing his crops

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for top dressing her crops for a better harvest for sale in the market so as to meet client and family needs.

Dinnah is 30 years old, married to Aristarchus and supports a family of 3 children. 

She has been practicing sewing for the last 6 years earning KES 5,000 per month. 

Dinnah has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy more material for use in making clothes for sale for more income gain. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to start poultry farming. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

Flora has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Flora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

Lilibeth has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Lilibeth aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Elsa works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Elsa is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of spices and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Elsa has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of spices and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Gemmalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Gemmalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Gemmalyn is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy fish and other supplies for her business for her fish vending business.

Gemmalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 25 years old and married with one child. Lorena works very hard to provide for them.

Lorena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, home product care and other groceries.

Lorena has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Lorena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Helen is 48 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Helen has a false teeth making business in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 17000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

Helen has been in this business for 20 years. Helen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her false teeth making business

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 45 year old hard working man with 6 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. He is a motorcyclist and at the same time earns salary. He is faced with challenges of weather changes especially rainy seasons that make roads impassible and spoil his motocycle which is a big expense to him. However, he has hopes of educating all his children to higher levels of learning. Patrick needs a loan to repair his motorcycle.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops in her farm so as to increase nutrients in the soil for a better harvest and meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 38 years old and married with one child in school. Regina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, milk, coffee noodles, etc. to sell.

Regina has been in this business for nine years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, milk, coffee and noodles to sell

loans.name: José Secundino

texts.es:
Secundino, de 27 años de edad, no sabe leer ni escribir, actualmente está acompañado, su realiza labores domesticas en su vivienda, tienen dos hijos.

Secundino, se dedica a trabajar como corralero en una hacienda ganadera desde hace 7 años, también es propietario de dos vacas y varios cerdos, además de cultivar granos básicos en 7,000 metros cuadrados de terreno.- Dichas actividades las aprendió de su padre quien le enseño el trabajo agropecuario.

Secundino, necesita el crédito para comprar una ternera, ya que con esto espera que muy pronto pueda reproducir aún más y obtener más leche para venderla a un ganadero de la zona.

Secundino, lo que más sueña es llegar a tener una vivienda propia, digna, cómoda y segura, ya que actualmente vive en una propiedad donde el dueño del inmueble es el propietario del ganado.
texts.en:
Secundino, 27 years old, does not know how to read or write. He is married and his wife carries out the domestic chores in the home. They have two children.

Secundino has worked as a ranch hand on a cattle ranch for the last 7 years. He is also the owner of two cows and several pigs. In addition, he grows basic grains on 7,000 square meters of land. He learned these businesses from his father who taught him about agricultural work and farming.

Secundino needs a loan to buy a calf, and with it hopes to soon be able to reproduce even more and obtain more milk to sell to a rancher in the zone.

Secundino dreams of having his own home that is decent, comfortable, and secure, since right now he lives on a property where the landlord of the building is the owner of the livestock.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 63 years old and married with three children. Jesusa works very hard to provide for them.

Jesusa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like personal care products, home care products and other groceries.

Jesusa has been in this business for seven years. 

In the future, Jesusa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like personal care products, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 49 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, milk, and coffee

Cecilia has borrowed and repaid 27 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, milk, and coffee

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 45 years old and married with three children. With two of her children in school, Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Jocelyn has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like beverages, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a business making and selling nipa roofing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa leaves, bamboo, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like motorcycle transport.

Genelyn dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa leaves, bamboo, etc

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 37 years old with one child in school,  Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, cigarettes, home care products and other groceries.

Josephine has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, cigarettes, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina, 32, is a married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Gina has a food vending business in the Philippines. Gina has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Gina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Fedelina works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food vending. Fedelina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of bananas to sell to customers.

Fedelina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more banana stock.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Narcisa works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell spices business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from vegetable vending. Narcisa is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more spices to sell for her buy-and-sell spices business.

Narcisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more spices to sell

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally is 46 years old and lives in a remote area of the Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of six children, and two of them are in school. She has grown cassava and cashews to support her family for fourteen years. The source of her family’s income is about 89,400 KHR per day. 

She has been with VisionFund for five cycles already and completely repaid back the loans. She is now applying for a new loan, and she will use her loan portion to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and pay for labor fees. 

She hopes to improve her business to get more income and wants to buy more farmland to expand her farming area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and pay for labor fees

loans.name: Sinan's Group

texts.en: A local resident living in Kampong Cham province, Sinan is 27 years old. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are in school and another one who is too young to attend school. For her living, she has grown cucumbers to sell as the main source of her income and fished to earn extra income for nine years. She could earn around 63,100 KHR per day. In order to add more income to support her family, she wants to apply for a new loan via VisionFund to create a new business, feeding ducks to sell. This is her second cycle with VisionFund and she is the leader in her group. To fulfill her needs, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy duck feed and build a duck cage. She hopes that her family will have better living conditions and the ability to keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy duck feed and build a duck cage

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Lorile

texts.en:
Lorile is 20 years old and single. She works very hard to provide for her needs.

Lorile runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like noodles, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Lorile has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Lorile would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like noodles, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Esther B Group

texts.fr: Antoinette est commerçante, membre de la banque villageoise «Esther B», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un cultivateur, âgée de 48 ans, mère 9 enfants dont 2 étudient, 2 mariés et 5 autres n’étudient plus faute des moyens financiers. Elle est vendeuse du lait yaourt dans un petit marché du port dans la ville depuis 6 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle va s’approvisionner en 60 litres de lait. Elle souhaite augmenter son capital, devenir fournisseur, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Antoinette is a shopkeeper and a member of the Esther B banque villageoise, a client of IMF Hekima. She is a 48-year-old married mother to nine children, two of whom are currently attending school, another two are married and the rest are not studying due to a lack of financial means. Her husband earns a living as a farmer. Antoinette has been selling yoghurt at a small port-side market in town for the past six years. She started this business with funds given to her by her husband. She wishes to purchase 60 litres of milk. She hopes to increase her capital and become a supplier, as well as be able to educate and feed her children. Finally, she would like to thank Hekima for the support they give to entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to purchase 60 litres of milk

loans.name: Noeun's Group

texts.en: Noeun, 58, is living in a rural area of the Kampong Cham province and is the mother of five children. Because of her living conditions, she can earn income via cucumber growing and has been a construction worker for ages. Her daily family income earns about 41,100 KHR per day.  Noeun has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two cycles already and completely repaid the loans. Now she wants to create a new business, feeding pigs to sell. To fulfill her needs, she is now leading a group of five members to get this new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy piglet feed and build a pig cage to support her new business. She hopes that she will have enough household supplies to use and get more income than before.

loans.use: to buy piglet feed and build a pig cage to support her new business.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Sok Eng's Group

texts.en: Sok Eng, 40, lives with family members in Kampong Cham province. She is the mother of three children and one of them is in school. She has earned income to support her family’s living via rice cropping and cassava growing for twenty years. She can make around 40,300 KHR per day. As the group leader of two, she is applying for the new fourth loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy cassava pesticide for her farm. She expects that she can get more yields and will have the ability to create a new business, growing cashews, to upgrade her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cassava pesticide for her farm.

loans.name: Pheang's Group

texts.en: A mother of two children living in Mondulkiri province, Pheang is 36 years old. To struggle her family’s hardship, she has earned income via cassava growing and selling grocery items for four years. She has been with VisionFund for one cycle already and completely paid back the past loan. Now, she is leading a group of three to apply for this new loan with VisionFund. She will manage her loan portion to buy cassava seeds for her farming. Pheang hopes her family will have a better standard of living by increasing her income with this loan portion.

loans.use: to buy cassava seeds for her farming

loans.name: Amour Divin Group

texts.fr: Nkoba est une commerçante qui est mariée a un ingénieur, membre d’un groupe de crédits «Amour Divin», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 50 ans et mère de 6 enfants scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse divers habillements dans un magasin  de la  ville depuis 8 ans. Elle va acheter des pantalons, des robes, des chemises, vestes, souliers, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite augmenter son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien  apporté aux  entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: Nkoba is a shopkeeper and a member of the Amour Divin credit group, a client of IMF Hekima. She is a 50-year-old married mother to six children, all of whom are currently attending school. Her husband earns a living as a engineer. Antoinette has been selling various clothing items out of a store in town for the past eight years. She wishes to purchase trousers, dresses, shirts, jackets and shoes. By doing this, she hopes to increase her capital, as well as be able to educate and feed her children. She would like to thank Hekima for the support they give to entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to purchase trousers, dresses, shirts, jackets and shoes

loans.name: Rukhshona

texts.ru: Рухшоне жительницы района А. Джоми 28 лет. Она молодая, добросовестная и хорошая дочь своих родителей. Она не замужем. Чтобы прокормить своих сестер и братьев, Рухшона занимается животноводством. Она очень любит животных и хорошо заботится о них. Одновременно она занимается растениеводством тоже. Рухшона очень рада, что может помочь своим родителям, у которых нет хорошего источника дохода. Рухшона хочет, увеличит поголовье своего скота, и получить хороший доход. У нее есть капитал, но не хватает дополнительно 700 USD для покупки скота. Рухшона надеется, что с вашей помощью она сможет добиться желаемого успеха.
texts.en: Rukhshona, age 28, is a resident of the A. Jomi district of Tajikistan.  She is a young, honest and kind daughter to her parents.  Rukhshona is not married.  In order to feed her brothers and sisters, she is involved in animal husbandry.  She loves animals and takes good care of them.  She is also involved in agriculture.  Rukshona is very happy to be able to help her parents who do not have a good source of income.  She wants to increase her livestock headcount and make a good income.  Although she has a small capital, she is missing 700 USD to buy livestock.  She hopes to be able to achieve her goals thanks to your support.

loans.use: to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia is 49 years old with seven children. With four children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Nemia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like cigarettes, eggs, home care products and other groceries.

Nemia has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Nemia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like cigarettes, eggs, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Perlita works hard to support her family.

She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Perlita is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her bicycle transport business.

Perlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 26 years old with three children. One of her children is in school. Raquel works very hard to provide for them.

Raquel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home care products and other groceries.

Raquel has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Raquel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
As a parent of three children, Rhodora works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rhodora is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Rhodora has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Busime Group

texts.fr: Kikandi est commerçante, présidente de la banque villageoise «Busime», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 39 ans, mère 4 enfants tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires dans un marché de la ville depuis 17 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de sa famille.Son conjoint est un agent de l'Etat. Elle va s’approvisionner en 20 sacs d’haricots. Elle souhaite augmenter son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Kikandi is a shopkeeper and a member of the Busime banque villageoise, a client of IMF Hekima. She is a 39-year-old married mother to four children, all of whom are currently attending school. Kikandi has been selling food produce at a market in town for the past 17 years. She started this business with funds given to her by her family. Her husband works as a civil servant. She wishes to purchase 20 sacks of beans. She hopes to increase her capital, as well as be able to educate and feed her children. Finally, she would like to thank Hekima for the support they give to entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sacks of beans

loans.name: Yanira Elizabeth

texts.es: Yanira de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y  verduras desde hace 21 años inicio con capital propio, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, ella esta solicitado un crédito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras  por mayor para y así podre tener mejores  ingresos económicos
texts.en:
Yanira, 39, lives in her own house with her family.  She has been selling fruit and vegetables for 21 years and started out with her own capital.  Her stand is located in the municipal market where she has many customers because of her low prices.

She is requesting a loan to buy more fruit and vegetables, wholesale, to improve her income.

loans.use: To buy wholesale fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Charilyn

texts.en:
Charilyn is 44 years old, widowed and has five children, one of whom is in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Charilyn requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fertilizers and different seeds for her farm.

Charilyn has been farming vegetables for four years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Charilyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers and different seeds for her farm

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos,  él se dedica a la venta de mariscos desde hace 3 años, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes ya que su producto es muy fresco y a buen precio, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mariscos, lonja, langostas etc. todo por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Juan, 40, lives in his own house with his life partner and their two children.  He has been selling shellfish for three years and his stand is set up in the municipal market near his home.  He has many customers because his products are very fresh and sell at a low price.  

He is requesting a loan to buy shellfish, fish, lobster, etc., wholesale, so he can continue his business and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy shellfish, fish, lobster, etc., wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm supplies such manure and fertilizer, and to hire workers.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира очень рада, что Вы помогли ей достичь своих целей. Она благодарна Вам. Замира серьезный и ответственный человек.   Муж занимается таксистом в районе. Дети находятся на заработках загранице, они уже взрослые и самостоятельные.  Замира 15 лет назад решила освоить деятельность родителей и идти по их стопам. Она сейчас  занимается растениеводством. У нее имеется не большой участок земли во дворе.  В этом году она хочет посадить урожай арбуз. И активно готовится к посеву. Замира на заемные деньги решила купить семена арбуз и минеральные удобрения. У нее не получилось собрать достаточную сумму денег для приобретения средств для посева и у нее вся надежда остается на кредит.
texts.en: Zamira is very happy and thankful for your support, as it helped her to achieve her goals.  Zamira is a serious and responsible woman.  Her husband works as a taxi driver, in the region.  Her children, who are now adult and independent, are working abroad.  Fifteen years ago, Zamira decided to take over her parents' activity and to walk in their footsteps.  Today she is involved in agriculture.  She has a small plot of land near her house.  This year, she intends to grow some watermelons and she is getting ready for the planting season.  Zamira has decided to use her loan to buy watermelon seeds and mineral fertilizers.  She was not able to gather enough money to make this purchase, so she places all hope in her loan.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and watermelon seeds.

loans.name: Wilmer Antonio

texts.es: Wilber de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos (maíz y frijol) desde hace 10 años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas,  etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Wilber, 37, lives in his own house with his life partner.  He has been growing basic grains (corn and beans) for ten years and sells his produce in communities near his place of residence.  The income he earns covers some of the household expenses.  He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, manures, fertilizers, herbicides, etc. to improve his income.

loans.use: To buy seeds, manures, fertlizers, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Jerson Arturo

texts.es:
JERSON ARTURO TIENE 20 AÑOS DE EDAD, VIVE EN CASA PROPIA, DESDE HACE MAS DE 3 AÑOS APROXIMADAMENTE. VIVE EN UNA COMUNIDAD TRANQUILA, EN EL DISTRITO DE CAYALTI, PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO, EN LA REGIÓN LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DEL PERÚ,DONDE LA GENTE SE DEDICA AL COMERCIO,GANADERIA Y AGRICULTURA.

ÉL SE DEDICA A BRINDAR SERVICIO COMO AYUDANTE DE CONSTRUCCION, EN CAYALTI Y EN DIFERENTES ANEXOS DEL MISMO,GOZANDO DE BUENAS REFERENCIAS DE PARTE DE SUS VECINOS Y CLIENTES, ES MUY LUCHADOR Y TRABAJADOR. TRABAJANDO TAMBIEN COMO PEÓN AGRÍCOLA. SOLICITA EL PRÉSTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE MADERA,HERRAMIENTAS Y OTROS GASTOS DIVERSOS, QUE LE PERMITIRÁN MEJORAR SUS SERVICIOS Y GENERAR MAYORES INGRESOS QUE LE OFREZCAN MEJORES CONDICIONES DE VIDA PARA ÉL Y SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Jerson Arturo, 20, has lived in his own house for around three years.  It is in a peaceful community in the district of Cayalti, province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque Region on the northern coast of Peru.  The local people work in commerce, livestock farming and agriculture.

Jerson works as a construction assistant in different areas of Cayalti.  He has good references from neighbors and customers.  He is a hard worker and also does farm work.  He is requesting a loan to buy wood, tools and other items to improve his services so he can generate more income and give his family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy wood, tools and other items to improve his services.

loans.name: Eleplata

texts.en:
Eleplata is an entrepreneur who owns a pharmacy, and a shop of motorcycle and bicycle spare parts. In early 2014, she joined Global Cycle Solutions, a distribution company, and became GCS micro entrepreneur. GCS introduced improved cook stoves in 2014 and she quickly noticed the large market for the stoves in her area. Many villagers still use fire wood as a source of energy that has led to deforestation and a scarcity of fuel. With these new stoves, she will be able to help women and children to save money, and time they would have spent going to try and gather firewood. 
This loan will help Eleplata to purchase stoves to sell on to other women to make their lives easier and help to stop deforestation in Tanzania.

loans.use: To buy improved charcoal cookstoves to sell in her village and improve the lives of women and children

loans.name: Upendo

texts.en:
Upendo is a mother of three and lives in Arusha, Tanzania. She engages herself in farming and livestock keeping. Her vision is to provide women with better technology to help them to grow their own communities. She has managed to impact many households who are in off grid areas by selling solar products to them. 

She recently started using "Jikokoa improved charcoal cookstove" and found it saved her, half her normal fuel bill and created much less smoke so she could cook indoors. She loved the product so much that she decided to start selling the same to her neighbors and to date she has sold over 50 stoves. With this Kiva loan, she will be able to purchase enough stoves to satisfy the growing demand and scale her business.

loans.use: To buy more improved cookstoves in order to expand her business and reach those in remote areas that use charcoal

loans.name: Nehemia

texts.en:
Nehemiah lives in Arusha in Tanzania. In 2013 he started selling solar products in his village and nearby ones. He started to see a huge demand for high quality renewable energy products and has been doing very well.
He has recently started to sell the Jikokoa, which is an improved charcoal cookstove which uses about half the amount of charcoal and generates 60% less smoke. 

He wants to see his community develop through the use of energy saving technologies, and wants families to save money on charcoal so they can spend it on new businesses or agricultural ventures.
With this Kiva loan, he will be able to purchase enough stoves to satisfy the growing demand and sell them at a profit so that he can continue to grow his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy improved charcoal cookstoves to sell in his village

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a mother of four, and she lives in Morogoro, a region in the central part of Tanzania. She is employed as a teacher by the government, but also operates as a micro entrepreneur selling improved charcoal cookstoves. The cookstoves are called the Jikokoa and use about half the amount of charcoal and creates 60% less smoke than the other clay lined ceramic cookstoves. Joyce has managed to impact more than 200 households through the selling of renewable energy products and gained an income of more than $1600.
She started selling improved cook stoves in 2014 and she has been very successful and has sold more than 100 stoves. She is faced with cash flow challenges as she gives out the stoves in two months credit, so she runs outs of stove before she has collected all debts. This loan will help Joyce to purchase more stoves to serve more customers, and ultimately help them save more on charcoal that they can spend on school fees, or other family expenses.

loans.use: To buy improved cookstoves to sell to other women

loans.name: Agness

texts.en:
Agness is from Arusha and is a mother of two boys. She has been employed by an organization called Global Cycle Solutions for two years, and through this she sells improved cookstoves to charcoal users. These Jikokoa cookstoves use about half the amount of charcoal as the standard ones most people use, and they create 60% less smoke. Agness has saved $190 per year by using the Jikokoa and she wants to be able to pass on this benefit to other women, whilst also continuing to create a viable business for herself. She has sold over 70 stoves since 2014 and has helped women to save a lot of money on fuel.
This loan will help Agness to purchase 50 stoves so that she can serve the large urban market in Tanzania. Her passion is to help women and children to improve their health by using improved cook stoves. Her mission is to sell 1000 stoves in 2015 so as to help women generate income through energy savings.

loans.use: To buy improved charcoal stoves and sell them to other women so they can save money on charcoal and start their own businesses

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 55 years old and is a single mother with 4 children, living in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She is a self-made entrepreneur.  She started her first business in 2012, making soap and distributing it to her neighbors, and later to shops and schools. In 2014, Leah started selling renewable energy products. She has had lots of success and by selling the Jikokoa cookstove, she has helped families save large amounts of money on their monthly fuel bill.

Leah wishes to improve her business and sell the Jikokoa improved charcoal cookstove and help her fellow women to improve their lives by improving their health and spending less money on charcoal.

loans.use: To buy improved charcoal cookstoves to sell to other women

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fifty sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Action De Grace Group

texts.fr: Bachungeye est commerçante, propriétaire d’une boutique remplie des divers produits manufacturés a son domicile depuis 3 ans, membre du groupe de crédits «Action de Grace», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 35 ans, mère de 4 enfants scolarisés. Elle va acheter du sel, du sucre, des biscuits, huiles, savons, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Bachungeye is a trader, owner of a small shop filled with various products that she has made at home over the last three years, and a member of the 'Action de Grace' loan group which is a customer of Hekima MFI. She is 35 years old and the mother of four children, all in school.
She will buy salt, sugar, biscuits, oils and soaps etc. Thus she hopes to grow her capital, and to educate and feed her children.
Finally, she thanks Hekima for their support of entrepreneurs without bank facilities.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, biscuits, oil, soaps etc

loans.name: Billy Group

texts.fr: Kasiba est commerçante, membre  d’une association de crédits «Billy», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 43 ans, mariée, mère 5 enfants scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse des souliers usagés sur un étalage du marché de la ville depuis 2 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Pour accroitre son activité, elle va acheter 5 ballons de souliers. Elle souhaite augmenter son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final,  elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Kasiba is a trader, and a member of the 'Billy' credit group which is a customer of Hekima MFI. She is 43 years old, married and the mother of five children, all in school.
She has sold secondhand shoes on a market stall in town for two years. She started her business with funding from her husband. In order to grow her business, she is going to buy five bundles of shoes. She hopes to grow her capital, and to educate and feed her children.
Finally, she thanks Hekima for their support of entrepreneurs without bank facilities.

loans.use: to buy five bundles of shoes.

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.es: Jose Francisco tiene la edad de 27 años, es casado, y tiene 1 hijo y su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. El quiere  sembrar cafe en su finca, por lo que quiere hacer un almacigal de cafe para que le sea mas barato.   Tiene muchos años que se dedica a su finca y a producir cafe, quiere crecer y también desea que su finca sea muy productiva. Es el segundo  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. No Ha realizado otros préstamos en una Cooperativa, pero FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. El  también tiene el deseo de brindarle a su hijo la educación necesaria  para que sea en el futuro  persona preparada y pueda enfrentar de manera más fácil la vida.
texts.en:
José Francisco is 27, has one son and a wife who are his greatest priority. He wants to plant coffee on his farm, and needs to build a coffee nursery so that he can do this more cheaply. He has been working on his farm producing coffee for many years. He wants to expand the business and make his farm more productive. 

This is the second loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had loans from cooperative banks, and FUDECOSUR offered him the loan with greater support and a much better rate of interest. 

José Francisco also wants to offer his son the necessary education so that he will be better prepared to face life in the future.

loans.use: to make a coffee nursery

loans.name: Sesilia

texts.en:
Sesilia is 24 years old and married with 1 child. 

She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. 

Sesilia needs a loan to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2015. Sesilia will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose

loans.name: Yucabeth

texts.en:
When you describe Yucabeth, it’s just the same as describing your mother because she is hardworking, polite and honest. Yucabeth lives in Nyamira, a remote area in Kenya. Nyamira is at the center of a primary banana and maize growing region. However, most farmers, like Yucabeth, prefer to keep income-generating animals on their farmland, too. 

Yucabeth started farming 35 years ago. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs and maize. She uses the income from these activities to take care of her family. 

Yucabeth is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. With more poultry on her farm, she will produce more eggs for food, hatching and selling. She will also expand her asset base to secure more loans in the future, if need be. 

The immediate impact of this loan to Yucabeth's family is that she will be able to afford her children's education expenses. She cherishes her children. She would do anything to provide them with the best environment for mental and physical growth.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Ancelma

texts.es: La señora Ancelma tiene 42 años, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, hace varios años ya que el esposo la abandono, vive con sus hijos en la ciudad de Cochabamba en una pequeña casa donde solo tiene dos habitaciones, tienen muchas incomodidades, aun así la señora Ancelma sigue luchando por sus hijos. Desde el abandono de su esposo la señora Ancelma desarrollo varias actividades, como ser comercio de juguetes, carteras y otros productos de acuerdo a la temporada, en la actualidad se dedica a la venta de un cereal cuyo nombre es Granola de trigo, compra de los productores de dicho cereal al por mayor para posteriormente vender en los mercados y tiendas de barrio con una utilidad de Bs 2 por cada unidad, en esta actividad tiene mayores utilidades por esta razón decidió comprar en grandes cantidades a un precio rebajado, por lo tanto el destino del crédito es para la compra de mercadería (granola de trigo), lo cual le ayudara a generar mayores ingresos y seguir manteniendo a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ancelma is 42 years old and single mother of 3 children. Her husband left her many years ago. She lives with her children in Cochabamba, in a small house which only has two rooms. They face many hardships, but Ancelma continues to struggle for her children.

Since her husband left, Ancelma has taken up various activities, for example the trade in toys, handbags, and other products according to the season. At the moment, she sells a cereal which is called "Wheat Granola". She buys this cereal from the producers in bulk, and afterwards sells it in the markets and food stalls of the neighborhood with a profit of 2 bolivianos per unit.

Since she makes good profits with this activity, she has decided to buy a large quantity at a reduced price. Therefore, she will use the loan to buy merchandise (Wheat Granola), and this will help her to generate a higher income and to continue to provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (Wheat Granola).

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en:
Elisapeta is a 61-year-old widow with 5 children. She has a small taxi business to earn an income. She has six years with this business. 

Elisapeta needs a loan to buy new tires, a new gear box, a taxi sign indicator, engine oil and petrol. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Elisapeta joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new tires, a new gear box, a taxi sign indicator, engine oil and petrol

loans.name: Iloa

texts.en:
Iloa is 44 years old and married with 5 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for three years. 

Iloa needs a loan to buy a taxi and more stock. Her taxi will help immensely with her re-payments while she focuses on her retail business. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a taxi and more stock. Her taxi will help immensely with her re-payments while she focuses on her retail business

loans.name: Nuuuta

texts.en:
Nuuuta is a 33-year-old mother with 1 child; she runs a small business of selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than three years to earn a living. 

Nuuuta requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank and hand gloves to help her run the business. 

She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank and hand gloves

loans.name: Uai

texts.en:
Uai is 44 years old and married with 5 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 10 years. 

Uai needs a loan to buy a brand new van to help with her shop and flea market. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2008 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a brand new van to help with her shop and flea market

loans.name: Lidia Marina

texts.es: Lidia de 30 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su dos hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz, tiene 15 años de experiencia en la actividad agrícola, gracias a su trabajo es como ella ha podido salir adelante con sus hijos, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono, herbicida, insecticidas y semillas etc. y asi seguir con su trabajo y darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lidia is 30 years old. She is single mother and lives in her own house with her two children. She works planting corn and has 15 years experience in this agricultural activity.

Thanks to her work, she has managed to get her children ahead. She is asking for a loan to buy manure, herbicides, insecticides and seeds. With this, she wants to continue her work and give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides, insecticides, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es: Jose de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos,  él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol el cliente tiene varios años de dedicarse a esa actividad agrícola y gracias a su trabajo es como ha podido salir adelante,  el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas,  entre otros insumos para poder continuar con su cosecha y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Jose is 38 and lives in his own house with his four children. He makes a living growing maize and beans. He has been doing this for many years and thanks to his work he has been able to move forward. 

He is asking for a loan to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, herbicides and other supplies so that he can continue growing his crops and make more economic income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, herbicides and other supplies

loans.name: Faavela

texts.en:
Faavela is 61 years old with 6 children. She operates a business selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. 

Faavela requested a loan to buy banana roots (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel and chemicals to assist her in running the business. 

She joined SPBD in 2012, and hopes to use her  profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana roots (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow,  hand gloves, a rake, a shovel and chemicals

loans.name: Fay

texts.en:
Fay is 22 years old with 2 children. She runs a business selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Fay requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, chemicals and a backpack sprayer to assist her in running the business. 

She joined SPBD in 2014, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, chemicals and a backpack sprayer

loans.name: Ilaisa

texts.en:
Ilaisa is a 50-year-old mother with 5 children; she runs a small business of selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than three years. 

She hopes to expand her business, but in order to do this, Ilaisa requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, hand gloves, a chainsaw and a backpack sprayer to help her run the business. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, hand gloves, a chainsaw and a backpack sprayer

loans.name: Jose Benedicto

texts.es: Jose de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, se dedica desde hace 20 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y hortalizas, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive con su esposa en casa propia, Jose está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: José is 31 years old and lives in a house that he owns with his wife and family. For 20 years José has been working in farming, growing corn and vegetables. José sells his products in the different markets near to his home. José is applying for a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilisers, anti-disease treatments and more, and to improve his land, shown in the photo, so as to continue with his work and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilisers, anti-disease treatments and more, and to improve his land.

loans.name: Cindy Paola

texts.es: Cindy desde niña sintió inclinación por la estética, su madre fue su tutora en esta profesión quien desde su salón de belleza engalanaba a sus clientes.  Hoy en día ofrece sus servicios en compañía de su mamá; cortes de cabello, cepillado, tintes, desrizado e iluminaciones y sus principales clientes son amigos, familiares, vecinos y referidos, todos los días pueden realizarse sus tratamientos en el horario de 6 a.m. hasta las 10 p.m.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de unos productos capilares necesarios para la prestación de sus servicios, cremas, exfoliantes  y tintes. Esta inversión es muy significativa para mejorar el servicio puesto que el cliente tendrá la oportunidad de escoger tratamientos de acuerdo a sus necesidades.  Cindy desea a largo plazo incrementar su clientela y así mismo continuar trabajando en esta profesión para adquirir mucha más experiencia. Su meta personal es graduarse y obtener un certificado de aptitud profesional.
texts.en:
Since she was a girl, Cindy has enjoyed everything to do with beauty. Her mother taught her this profession from her beauty salon where she took care of her customers.

Today, Cindy works as a beautician with her mother, offering hair cuts, style, colouring, straightening, and highlights. Cindy's main customers are friends, family, neighbours and referred customers. Cindy can offer her services from 6am until 10pm.

Cindy is currently applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest the loan in hair products necessary for her work, including creams, dyes and exfoliants. This investment is very important in order for Cindy to improve customer service as it will give customers more choices to meet their needs. 

In the long term, Cindy would like to increase the number of customers she has and continue working in this trade in order to gain more experience. Cindy's personal goal is to graduate and obtain a qualification in her trade.

loans.use: to buy hair products necessary for her work, including creams, dyes and exfoliants.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es: Iván  tiene la edad de 35 años, está casado   y vive con  la esposa y dos   hijos   actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de unas vacas de leche   .El espera poder obtener mas leche y queso para vender a los negocios y vecinos y engordar las crías  y venderlos con el peso ideal y  así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja
texts.en:
Iván is 35 years old and married. He lives with his wife and two children. He needs this loan in order to buy two dairy cattle. Iván hopes to gain more milk and cheese in order to sell to businesses and neighbours; he also wants to fatten up the animals and sell them at a good weight in order to earn a higher income. 

In the future, Iván hopes to provide his family with a higher quality of life, and greater financial stability. Iván also wants to expand his business.

This is Iván's first loan from FUDECOSUR. He has had no loans from state banks and this loan has been provided under better conditions and at a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es: Jose de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus padres,  el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace 20 años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, Jose está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: José is 37 years old and lives in a privately-owned house with his parents. José has been making a living growing corn and beans for 20 years. He sells his products in the area surrounding his home. José is applying for a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilisers, anti-disease treatments and more, and to improve his land, shown in the photo. He is doing this in order to continue with his work and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilisers, anti-disease treatments and more.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.pt:
O senhor Oscar é casado pai de 4 filhos, todos menores de idade, tem mais uma pessoa na sua responsabilidade que é sobrinho. Vive na casa própria ainda em construção juntos com a sua familia.
Com o valor de emprestimo vai comprar cimento,chapas de zinco blocos,area e pedra.
O seu maior sonho melhorar mais as condições de habitacionais, construir murro de vedação e progredir de carreira profissional.
Seu maior desafio e financeiro, pelo que vai pagar o credito sem entrar em mora de forma a poder se beneficiar mais e consequentemente alcançar os seu objectivos.
texts.en:
Oscar is married and the father of four children, all of them underage. One more person is under his care: his nephew. He owns a house that is still under construction, where he lives with his family.

With the requested amount, he will buy cement, zinc sheets, bricks, sand and gravel.

His biggest dream is to improve his house, build a division wall and get ahead with his professional career. 

His biggest challenge is of a financial nature, which is why he will pay back the loan without defaulting in order to be able to apply for more loans and in that way achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy cement, zinc sheets, bricks, sand and gravel.

loans.name: Jossefa

texts.pt:
O senhor jossefa é casado maritalmente, pai de  3 filhos menores de idade sendo que uma é que vai a escola. vive na casa propria não tem outras pessoas sob sua responsabilidade. Conta com ajuda da esposa para suprir as despesas de casa.
Com o dinheiro do empréstimo vai comprar fardos de redes de pesca, rolos de corda e chumbos. 
O seu sonho e esperança é terminar a sua casa, pagar escola para os seus filhos,construir uma mercearia para revender marisco.
O seu desafio é financeiro pelo que vai trabalhar para poder economizar e pagar o crédito sem entrar em mora de forma a poder se beneficiar de outros.
texts.en:
Jossefa is married and the father of three underage children. One of her daughters goes to school. He owns the house where he lives and does not maintain anyone else. His wife helps him to cover the home expenses.

With the money from the loan, he will buy bales of fishing nets, rolls of fishing line and lead.

He dreams and hopes to finish building his house, pay for his children’s school, and build a store to resell seafood.

His challenge is of a financial nature, so he will work in order to save and pay back the loan without defaulting, in order to be able to apply for more loans.

loans.use: to buy bales of fishing nets, rolls of fishing lines and lead.

loans.name: Wilber

texts.es: Wilber tiene la edad  de 47 años, está casado y vive con la esposa y dos hijos  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia .  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Wilber is 47 years old, married and lives with his two children, his biggest priority. 

Wilber plans to use this loan to buy fertilisers and fungicides, and to pay labourers to help grow coffee. Wilber will also buy some copperwood plants to replant at the start of the rainy season. This will allow him to increase plant density on his land, and to take advantage of the fertility of the soil and climate and other conditions that favour coffee growth. 

With all of these improvements to his crops, Wilber hopes to earn a little more profit and thus improve his family's living conditions. 

This is Wilber's first loan from FUDECOSUR. He has had no loans from state banks and this loan has been provided under better conditions and at a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy copperwood and supplies.

loans.name: Ana Lorena

texts.es: Ana Lorena tiene la edad  de 55 años, está casada y vive con el esposo  y un hijo actualmente. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.  Es el primer  préstamo que a recibido de FUDECOSUR. Élla no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Ana Lorena is 55 years old. She is married and currently lives with her husband and a son.

With this loan, she will buy fertilizers and fungicides, and will pay for labor to perform maintenance on her coffee plantations.

With these improvements, she hopes that her plantations will give her good profits, which would result in the improvement of her family’s living conditions. This is the first loan she receives from FUDECOSUR. She had not applied for loans from state banks before, but FUDECOSUR offered her this loan more easily and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her coffee plantations.

loans.name: Mirian Luz

texts.es: Mirian es una emprendedora mujer de 45 años de edad, residente en un barrio ubicado en la Ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, decidió iniciar su negocio de venta de accesorios y confecciones de ropa desde su casa, como una alternativa para generar ingresos y apoyar a su cónyuge con los gastos del hogar, así mismo poder ofrecerles una educación de calidad y un mejor bienestar a sus hijos.  Ella ofrece a los residentes del barrio perfumes, cremas corporales, joyería y hebillas para el cabello, así mismo sus servicios de confecciones de ropa para toda la familia con diseños a la innovadores  y sobre medida. La gran mayoría de sus clientes son amigos y referidos a quienes les ofrece de sus servicios y productos todos los días, sus ventas son generadas de contado, de este mismo modo sus compras las realizan de contado a distribuidores y comerciantes de la ciudad.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en surtir con nuevos diseños de joyería, fragancias y hebillas para el cabello.  Esta inversión es muy importante para mejorar el surtido del negocio y con ello incrementar las ventas.  Mirian desea continuar trabajando comprometida para continuar creciendo en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Mirian, 45, is an enterprising woman. She lives in a neighborhood of Cartagena de Indias. She decided to start a business selling accessories and clothes from home, as an alternative to earn an income and help her husband with the home expenses, and be able to pay for her children’s education and guarantee their well-being.

She sells perfumes, body lotions, jewelry and hair buckles to her neighbors. She also offers her sewing services, and innovative and customized clothes for the whole family. Most of her customers are friends and other people who heard about her business. She offers them her services and products every day. Her customers pay her in cash, so she also pays her suppliers in cash.

She is now applying for her first CrediKiva through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest it in buying new jewelry, fragrances and hair buckles. This investment is very important to widen the variety of products she offers, and to increase her sales. Mirian would like to continue working hard in order to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy new jewelry, fragrances and hair buckels.

loans.name: Vaiomanu

texts.en:
Vaiomanu is a Samoan woman of 33 years with five children. 

She owns and operates a business of selling cabbage, cucumber, and eggplant in her village to earn a living. 

Vaiomanu requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds (cabbage, cucumber, eggplant), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals to help her with the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds (cabbage,cucumber, eggplant), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals.

loans.name: Tumema

texts.en:
Tumema is a 41-year-old mother with two children. 

She runs a small business of providing good services to people by transportation. She has been doing this for more than two years. 

Tumema has requested a loan to buy new wheels, paint, a car seat, and air conditioning to help her maintain the good services. She hopes to use her profit to buy another taxi and expand her business in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2007.

loans.use: to buy new wheels, paint, a car seat, and air conditioning.

loans.name: Pepe

texts.en:
Pepe is a Samoan citizen. She is 56 years old and has five children. 

She owns and operates a small business of selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living. (Elei is traditional Samoan fabric printing.) She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Pepe requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint colors, paint brushes, elei designs, containers and printing machines to assist her in running the business. Pepe hopes to build a small elei shop in her village. She became a member of SPBD in 2007.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint colors, paint brushes, elei designs, containers, and  printing machines.

loans.name: Mario Jose

texts.es:
Mario José es de las personas que deciden dar todo por su familia. Al enterarse que iba a ser padre, no dudo en trabajar para que no le hiciera falta a él ni a su esposa o hijo. Ahora su hijo tiene dos años de edad, el mismo tiempo que lleva trabajando como operario. Además, este joven de 25 años de edad decidió estudiar la licenciatura en Derecho por las noches para seguir creciendo profesionalmente, de la misma forma que ayudar a los demás haciendo valer las leyes. 
Actualmente el mundo está cada vez globalizado y Mario José lo sabe, por lo que desea entrar en las personas más preparadas, razón por la que solicita un préstamo para pagar sus cursos de inglés y para comprar una computadora. De manera que tendrá mejores oportunidades laborarles sabiendo otro idioma y podrá entrar en este mundo competitivo sin ningún problema. Afortunadamente cuenta con el apoyo de su madre y de su padre quien es operario de una minera. En sus planes está convertirse en uno de los mejores abogados y estudiar una maestría.
texts.en:
Mario José is one of those who decide to give everything for their family. When he knew he would become a father, he did not hesitate to work in order to make sure his family would not lack anything. His son is two years old now, and Mario has been working since he was born as a machine operator. In addition, this 25-year-old man decided to start studying Law at night in order to continue developing professionally, and at the same time helping others by enforcing the law.

The world is getting more globalized every day, and Mario Jose is aware of that. This is why he wants to be a well-prepared person and is requesting a loan to pay for his English courses and to buy a computer. This will result in better job opportunities for him, because knowing another language will easily open some doors for him in this competitive world. Fortunately, his mother and father support him. His father works for a mining company. He plans on becoming one of the best lawyers and receiving a master’s degree.

loans.use: to pay for his English courses and buy a computer.

loans.name: Aracelly

texts.es:
En el año 2004 inicio la señora Aracelly un pequeño negocio de venta de acerolos para mujer, por necesidad económica, por apoyar a su familia, por tener una entrada de dinero que le permitirá comprar lo restante para su casa y comprar sus cosas personales de mujer sin tener que esperar nada de su marido y no solo eso este negocio ha permitido mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, sus dos hijos estudian y cuentan en el hogar con herramientas para alimentar su creatividad y conocimiento como lo es conexión a internet y todo gracias a que en su hogar están sus padres que se esfuerzan mucho pro su futuro y que tiene como sueño convertirlos en la primera generación de la familia en asistir a la universidad.


Ahora Aracelly se está preparando para el día del padre y la copa América pro ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de mercancía al por mayor, quiere tener promociones llamativas que inciten a sus clientes a comprarle para hacer crecer su negocio.

La mercancía que comprara será todo enfocado en el padre pro su fecha especial como lo son lociones, billeteras, relojes, entre otros productos.
texts.en:
In the year 2004, Aracelly opened her small business selling ladies' accessories due to economic necessity to support her family, to have a source of money that would permit her to purchase what she needs for her house and purchase her personal women's things without having to expect anything from her husband. This business allowed her to improve her family's quality of life -- her two children are students and they have a home with tools to feed their creativity and knowledge such as an internet connection -- and all this is thanks to having their parents in the house who work hard for their future and have as a dream to make them the first generation of the family to get a university education.

Now, Aracelly is preparing for Father's Day and the Copa América, for this she wants to ask for a loan to purchase merchandise in bulk, she wants to have attention-getting promotions that urge her customers to purchase something to make her business grow. 

The merchandise that she will purchase will all be focused on the father for his special day such as lotions, wallets, watches, and other products.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise focused on the father for his special day such as lotions, wallets, watches, and other products.

loans.name: Mercedes De Lourdes

texts.es: Mercedes se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y también trabaja de empleada domestica para sacar adelante  a sus hijas. Mercedes es viuda, mercedes tiene 3 hijas mayores de edad y una nieta de 5 años que esta estudiando. Mercedes solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de chanchos ya que es por medio de este negocio que se apoya en los gastos de su hogar.
