Mercedes también se dedica a tejer prendas de vestir en la lana y también a vender cosméticos por revistas, ella comenta se dedica a estas actividades  para poder sacar  adelante a sus hijas. Mercedes sigue trabajando y luchando para tener el pan de cada dia para sus hijas y nietas, aunque sus hijas si le apoyan en lo que les alcanza.
texts.en: Mercedes works raising small animals and also works as a domestic worker to get her daughters ahead. Mercedes is a widow. Mercedes has 3 adult daughters and a 5-year-old granddaughter who is a student. Mercedes asks for the loan to invest it in the purchase of pigs since it is through this business that she supports the household expenses. Mercedes also works weaving woolen clothing and also selling cosmetics from catalogs. She says that she works at these jobs to be able to get her daughters ahead. Mercedes continues working and struggling to provide the daily bread for her daughters and granddaughter, although her daughters support her in what they can.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Martha Janeth

texts.es: A sus 31 años de edad Martha esta casada, vive en el campo junto a su marido, su hijo de 3 años y sus 2 hijas de 7 años y 9 años. Martha y  su esposo trabajan de empleados en una hacienda donde cuidan ganado y ordeñan las vacas. Las 2 hijas de Martha asisten a la escuela y su niño pasa con Martha.  Esta señora se dedica a cuidar animales menores y el crédito lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de chanchos que los va a criar en cancheras que hay en la hacienda donde trabaja. La mas grande aspiración de Martha es la de que le siga yendo bien en su negocio, seguir trabajando duro y asi obtener los recursos necesarios para la alimentación y educación de sus hijas e hijo.
texts.en: At 31 years old, Martha is married, lives in the countryside with her husband, her 3-year-old son and her two daughters, ages 7 and 9. Martha and her husband work as employees on a farm where they take care of livestock and milk the cows. Martha's two daughters attend school and her son spends his days with Martha. This lady works taking care of small animals and needs the loan to invest it in the purchase of pigs which she will raise in pigsties that are at the farm where she works. Martha's greatest aspiration is that her business continues going well, to continue working hard and in this way get the necessary resources to feed and educate her daughters and son.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Faasuamalie

texts.en:
Faasuamalie is a 32-year-old mother with two children. 

She owns and operates a small business of selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living. (Elei is traditional Samoan fabric printing.)

Faasuamalie requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei designs, containers, and printing machines to help her run the business. She has been doing this for more than two years. 

She  hopes to build a small elei shop in her village in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei designs, containers, printing machines.

loans.name: Leata

texts.en:
Leata is 34 years old and has four children.

She operates a small business of selling taro and banana chips in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. 

Leata requested a loan to buy a sack of taro, bananas, vegetable oil, a fry pan, and a wooden spoon to assist her with the business. She will use her profit to expand her business and provide her family's daily needs. She joined SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy a sack of taro, bananas, vegetable oil, a fry pan, and a wooden spoon.

loans.name: Puletasi

texts.en:
Puletasi is a 25 year old mother with two children.

She has a small business of selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, cucumber) in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a  year. 

Puletasi  requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves and safety boots to help her run the business. She hopes to expand her business by using her profit in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves and safety boots.

loans.name: Ana

texts.pt:
A senhora Ana de 39 anos de idade, nasceu em Magude e é residente de Magude na casa cedida pelos pais que estão sob sua responsabilidade, solteira e mãe de 1 filho maior de idade e independente.
Com o presente financiamento de 8.000 irá comprar feijão, amendoim, óleo, sal e açucar para revender na sua banca em sua casa.
Tem como sonhos crescer no negócio e construir uma casa melhorada.
Tem como desafios a insuficiência de fundos, mas tem recorrido ao negócio e ao crédito para suprir as suas necessidades.
texts.en:
Ana is 39 years old. She was born in Magude, where she lives in a house that her parents, who are under her care, gave her. She is single and the mother of an adult and independent son.

With this loan of 8,000, she will buy beans, peanuts, vegetable oil, salt and sugar to resell in a store she runs at home.

Her dreams are to expand her business and build a better house.

Her challenge is the lack of funding, but she has her business and this loan to help her to fulfill her needs.

loans.use: to buy beans, peanuts, vegetable oil, salt and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Jhony Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo es un joven de 22 años, el tiene su negocio que es  una vulcanizadora que la tiene ubicada cerca de una gasolinera y esto hace que le vaya bien en su negocio ya que los vehículos hacen la parada cerca de ese lugar. Ricardo necesita el dinero del crédito para compra llantas y asi sacar parches o revender las llantas de segunda mano. Ricardo  comenta que esta se va a casar y que esto hace que el se haga mas responsable. El sueño de Ricardo es el de formar su hogar y vivir feliz siempre y cuando  su negocio mejore para tener los ingresos que le permitan mantener su hogar.
texts.en: Ricardo is a 22-year-old young man. He has his business which is tire repairs that he has located near a gas station and this makes it so his business goes well since the vehicles stop near this place. Ricardo needs the money from the loan to purchase tires and, so, to make patches or resell the tires second-hand. Ricardo says that he will get married and that this makes him more responsible. Ricardo's dream is to create his home and live happily provided that his business improves to have the income that will allow him to support his household.

loans.use: to purchase tires.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal LAS MARGARITAS, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba.
El socio Raul tiene 37 años de edad y es soltero, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de farmacia, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de jarabes entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Las Margaritas communal bank. The bank is located in Urubamba province.

The member is Raul, who is 37 years old and single. The member alternates his daily tasks with working at a pharmacy business. The member has had his business for a good while, which is going well thanks to the dedication that he puts into his business each day. The member wants to be able to continue working so that he can continue supporting his family.

The member asks for the loan to purchase medicinal syrups and more.

The member is grateful for the granted loan and promises to make the established payments.

loans.use: to purchase medicinal syrups and more.

loans.name: Simoa

texts.en:
Simoa is a 42-year-old mother with five children. 

She has a small business of selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, cucumber) in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a  year. 

Simoa has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves and safety boots to help her run the business. 

She hopes to expand her business by using her profit in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2009.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves and safety boots.

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en:
Elisapeta is a Samoan citizen. She is 40 years old and has seven children.

She owns and operates a business of selling taro and banana chips in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 
Elisapeta requested a loan to buy a sack of taro, bananas, a fry pan, plastic bags, vegetable oil, and a container, to help her run the business. 

She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a sack of taro, bananas, a fry pan, plastic bags, vegetable oil, and a container.

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en:
Akenese is 49 years old and has nine children. 

She operates a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She hopes to expand her business, but in order to do this, Akenese requested a loan to buy  banana roots (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, chemicals, a chainsaw, a backpack sprayer to help her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2003.

loans.use: to buy  banana roots (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, chemicals, a chainsaw, and a backpack sprayer.

loans.name: Taesolomatia

texts.en:
Taesolomatia is a 31-year-old mother with three children. She operates a small business of selling banana and taro chips in her community to earn a living. 

Taesolomatia requested a loan to buy a sack of taro, bananas, a bottle of vegetable oil, a fry pan, a wooden spoon, plastic bags, and a container to assist her with the business. 

She hopes to use her profit to expand her business. She became a member  of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a sack of taro, bananas, a bottle of vegetable oil, a fry pan, a wooden spoon, plastic bags, and a container.

loans.name: Nery

texts.es:
La socia Nery  pertenece al banco comunal SAYHUA DE CHICHUBAMBA.
La socia continua dedicándose  al trabajo como profesora del nivel primario, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose al trabajar como docente el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para  de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un vivieres para su hogar como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Nery, belongs to the Sayhua de Chichubamba communal bank group.

The member continues to work as a primary school teacher. She has been working as a teacher for a good while, which is going well thanks to the determination she puts each day into her work. The member wants to be able to continue to work so that, in this way, she can continue supporting her family.

The member asks for the loan to purchase groceries for her home such as rice, sugar, milk, and more.

The member is grateful for the loan and promises to make the payments.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for her home such as rice, sugar, milk and more.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel tiene 47 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 4 hijos, una hija de 23 años y tres varones de 26, 22 y 21 años de edad desde hace 12 años, por lo que es muy reconocido como un padre responsable. Manuel se dedica desde hace 5 años a prestar sus servicios de técnico de campo, ya que gracias a su amplia experiencia en el campo cuenta con muchos conocimientos, además para llevar el sustento a su hogar, presta sus servicios de jornalero en una finca cercana. La vivienda de Manuel es muy humilde y carece de algunos servicios, pero lo que le tiene preocupado, es el techo de su vivienda, ya que en el invierno anterior este presento filtraciones que dañaron sus pocas pertenencias, por lo que ha decidido cambiarlo, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para cambiar el techo de su vivienda y de esta manera brindar mayor protección a sus hijos y sus pertenencias.
texts.en: Manuel is 47 years old and has lived in his own house with his 4 children, a 23-year-old daughter and three sons, ages 26, 22, and 21, for the past 12 years, so he is very well-known as a responsible father. Manuel has worked for 5 years as a field technician since, thanks to his wide experience in the countryside, he has a lot of knowledge. In addition, to bring support to the household, he works as a day laborer on a nearby farm. Manuel's house is very humble and lacks some services, but what has him worried is the roof on the house, since last winter there were leaks which damaged his few possessions, so he has decided to replace it. For this, he asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, nails, and wire to replace the roof on his house and in this way offer his children and possessions better protection.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, nails, and wire to replace the roof on his house.

loans.name: Gerardo Bosco

texts.es: Gerardo Bosco tiene la edad  de 53 años, está soltero, vive solo . Con su crédito pretende comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Gerardo Bosco is 53 years old, single, and lives alone. With the loan, he plans to purchase some seedlings to do replanting at the beginning of the rainy season, with the goal of increasing the crop density in the area. With these improvements to the crops, he hopes to get a little earnings and, so, improve his living conditions and also meet some goals. This is his first loan that he has gotten from FUDECOSUR. He has never had other loans before from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase coffee seedlings.

loans.name: Pro Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al  banco comunal “Pro Desarrollo” en el distrito de Pisaq de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco.
La socia Ruth Estelmina tiene 50 años tiene 03 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez se dedica al negocio de artesania,la socia  desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Pro Desarrollo communal bank group in Pisaq district, in Calca province, in Cusco department.

The member, Ruth Estelmina, is 50 years old, has 3 children and is partnered. The member alternates her daily tasks with working at her grocery store business. The member has had her business for a good while, which is going well for her, thanks to the determination that she puts each day into her business. The member also works at a craft business. She wants to be able to continue working so that in this way she can continue supporting her family.

The member asks for the loan to purchase rice, sugar, and more.

The members, in general, are grateful for the offered opportunity and promise to make their various payment on the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a fridge so as to supply cool soft drinks to his customers for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spare parts such as tyres, wheel boosters and windscreens so as to offer better and faster transport to clients and meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Eluminada

texts.en:
Eluminada is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Eluminada is 37 years old and has four children who are in school.

Eluminada has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Eluminada requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more sea foods to sell.

Eluminada has been in this business for five years. In the future, Eluminada would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending business.

Virginia dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Máximo

texts.es: El Señor Máximo nació en puertas del cielo en el año de 1982, empezó a estudiar en la escuela de la comunidad pero solo llego hasta tercer grado, luego decidió trabajar en agricultura con su abuelos, tiene más hermanos pero él es el mayor de todos. Los abuelos de Máximo le dieron unas tierras y el con su trabajo ha comprado más terreno en las que tiene sembrado café, guineo, y siembra granos básicos. Hace 14 años tiene de estar casado y ha procreado 3 hijos. En la comunidad donde vive Máximo no hay luz eléctrica por eso solicita un préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar e instalarlo en la casa de habitación el cual será de gran beneficio para todos los miembros del hogar ya que sus hijos están estudiando y les servirá bastante para alumbrarse y hacer las tareas por las noches, también en temporada de corte de café el y su señora se tienen que levantar muy temprano para hacer la comida de los trabajadores y se tienen que estar alumbrando con foco o candela pero ya con el panel solar se podrán alumbrar y hacer las cosas de una mejor manera, Máximo comenta que estaría muy agradecido si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo para la compra de este panel solar que vendrá a ser de gran beneficio para el hogar.
texts.en: Máximo was born in Puertas del Cielo in the year 1982; he started his education in the community school but only got up to the third grade. Then he decided to work in agriculture with his grandparents. He has other siblings, but he is the oldest. Máximo's grandparents gave him some land and he, with his work, has purchased more land where he has coffee and bananas planted and grows basic grains. Fourteen years ago, he got married and he has 3 children. In the community where Máximo lives, there is no electricity, so he asks for a loan to purchase a solar power system and install it in his house which will be a great benefit for all the members for the household, since his children are students and it will help them a lot to have light to do their homework at night. Also, in the coffee-cutting season, he and his wife have to get up very early to make food for the workers and they have to be lit by a lantern and candle, but with the solar panel, they could be well-lit and make the things better. Máximo says that he will be very grateful if he is offered the opportunity of this loan to purchase this solar panel which will become a great benefit for his household. n

loans.use: to purchase a solar power system.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goods and products such as cooking flour, sugar, salt, soft drinks and baking flour for sale to clients and meet both family and client needs

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 37 years old, married to Jerusah and supports a family of 4 children. 

He has been farming for the last 16 years earning KES 8,000 per month. 

Peter has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya for improving his farming activities to get quality produce for sale in the market and subsequently better income.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to start another retail shop in the area. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: To improve his farming activities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a bull for slaughter so as to sell meat to his clients for income gain

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spare parts such as tyres, wheel boosters and windscreens so as to offer better and faster transport to clients and meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 42 years old, married to Adriano and supports a family 5 children. 

She has been practicing small scale farming for the last 18 years earning KES8,000 per month. 

Janeth has applied for her first loan of KES25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for more milk production and supply to earn more income. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to start a retail shop. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for more milk production and supply

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
This is Annabelle, a 54 year old “sari-sari” (variety) store owner who is also busy in her hog fattening venture. At the same time, she owns a tricycle for hire. She is married to Rodolfo, a 54 year old driver. They reside in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental together with their children. The couple’s inspiration to work diligently is their dream to complete their children’s education, so as to be successful in the future.

Annabelle’s income from her store varies from time to time as it is usually affected by the competition within the area. Consumers are inclined to buy from a store that has wide variety of items and merchandise. She hopes to expand her business by adding to selection of supplies in order to meet the demands of consumers. With that method, she would be able to boost her income and savings. She humbly seeks your help through PhP 20,000 loan that she will use to buy additional items for sale in her variety store. Praying that you have the kind heart to extend support to her, and eventually make her family enjoy a comfortable life that God wants for His children. It is also Annabelle’s prayer to lead her children to believe in God, because she knows that God is the center of a happy and fruitful life.

Annabelle meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional items for sale in her variety store

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Here is Julieta, a resident of Intramuros City, Philippines. Recently, she had a loan worth PHP 35,000 which she had used for her direct-selling business within their vicinity. Actually, she sustains all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. This is why, she would like to give her gratitude to those who lent her assistance previously. 

To improve sales, Julieta would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional products to sell like cosmetics, soaps, lotions, detergents and the same stuff. With PHP 25,000, she can certainly make her livelihood improve and eventually grow with the grace of God. For now, it is her desire to have people like you who will assist her in her prospect. 

In the future, Julieta hopes to give her family a more favorable kind of living and simultaneously drive her inventory into progress. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like cosmetics, soaps, lotions, detergents and the same stuffs.

loans.name: Maria Amada

texts.es: Amanda es una señora muy trabajadora, tiene 53 años de edad y esta casada, Amanda tiene 3 hijos y una hija mayores d edad, pero de ellas solo una vive aun con Amanda. Ella y su esposo se dedican a trabajar al jornal y a sembrar pequeñas huertas de productos que se dan en las tierras que ellos residen como por ejemplo las papas, Amanda también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores ya que ella comenta que trabaja en una  u otra actividad para poder sacar adelante a su familia. Amanda solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de chanchos que los va a criar en chancheras que tiene alado de su casa. Lo que Amanda espera de este negocio es mejorarlo para seguir trabajando y salir adelante con su esposo e hijo que aun los acompaña.
texts.en: Amanda is a very hard-working woman. She is 53 years old and married. Amanda has 3 sons and a daughter who are adults but, of them, only one still lives with Amanda. She and her husband work as day laborers and in planting small plots with products on the land where they live, for example, potatoes. Amanda also works raising small animals since she says that she works in one job or another to be able to get her family ahead. Amanda asks for the loan money to invest it in the purchase of pigs that she will raise in pigsties that she has by her house. What Amanda hopes from this business is to improve it to continue working and get ahead with her husband and the child who still lives with her.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta is 38 years old, a married woman and mother of four children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Shagufta has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and do a little bit of engine maintenance on his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide a better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

Shagufta gives thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: for the maintenance of her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Antehwe Group

texts.en:
The women of the Antehwe Group are, on average, 40 years old and have two children. They all live in traditional, extended families in Teshie, Ghana. The women know one another through family connections and sell smoked fish, waakye (cooked rice and beans), cooking utensil, kenkey (cooked corn paste) and fried fish.

Having repaid their previous loans correctly and fully, the group have requested a fourth loan.

Patricia (standing on the right in the photo) will use her loan to buy more fish, firewood and smoked fish to sell to customers. She will sell the fish to men and women for cash. Patricia expects to make good monthly profit which will pay for healthcare, food, clothing, school fees and be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish, firewood and smoked fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs for use in the farm for high production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a plot for storing bricks for sale so as to avoid them from being destroyed by rain

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in sheet iron, nails, wire, and wood to rebuild his roof and protect his children.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is 33 years old, a father to two kids and a faithful husband to Corazon.  A vendor, Jerry supports his family through operating a small sari-sari store in the area. Together with his wife's income, they provide for the basic necessities of the family. 

Jerry is dreaming to succeed in life in the future. But he can't do this without enough money to start up. Thus, he is requesting to loan worth PHP 50,000 to purchase larger quantities of grocery items to display and sell in his store. More products will surely have him the opportunity to acquire greater sales and save for his dream house. 

Your helping hands can change Jerry 's life today. 

He meets up with his co-fellowship** members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.
** All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of grocery items to display and sell in his store.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Hi there lenders! 

Thanks for being a part of Cristina's journey. With your previous financial support, she did established her business, resulting into a more profitable source of income. With that, she was able to supply her store more of frozen products like meat. You are such a blessing! 

For now, she's been so dedicated and passionate into cultivating her business. Though there's a fact that her everyday journey with this is not as smooth-sailing as she dreams, her perspective and will to change her family's state makes her attitude towards the goal flip. 

She's been looking forward for more opportunities to grow her inventories. Once more, she would like to ask your help. She's borrowing a 50,000 peso loan that would hand her enough quantities of frozen meats like chicken and pork and beef, hotdogs, hams, and sausages. She prays that you'll allow her with this. 

She has proven once that she's faithful in repaying. And she hopes that you trust her once again. With hope and faith, she believes that through this, she'll be able to earn well for her children's education. She wants to finish schools for future securities. 

As of today, she's active in attending a weekly fellowship that enables her to draw strength and inspiration to push towards the goal through the word of God that she studies with her colleagues. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy enough quantities of frozen meats like chicken and pork and beef, hotdogs, hams, and sausages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spare parts such as tyres, wheel boosters and windscreens so as to offer better and faster transport to clients and meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional stock of maize cereals for sale to clients in the market

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
As a way of generating income, Lorena has engaged in variety store business within her community for almost 10 years now. She is 37 years of age and blessed with four children. Her husband, Rolando, helps her in their business and they work hand-in-hand to provide for their needs.

In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

Due to financial insufficiency, Lorena wants to make her business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. For this reason, she would like to avail a loan amounting to 35,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional grocery items that are needed. Being a kind and friendly mother, she is hoping that she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

Lorena aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and make them finish their schooling. She also wants to expand her business. She prays for more strength for her family always. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items that are needed in her business.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina owns and operates a food stall. She has been managing this business for many years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. Through this, she is able to find a living for her family. 

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to increase her profit. She is requesting an amount of 
PHP 15,000 to buy products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, in larger quantities to cook for more recipes.

Agustina hopes for her business to grow bigger and better. She dreams of giving her family a good life in the future. She also prays for a harmonious life within their household. 

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, in larger quantities to cook for more recipes.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 58 years old and has four children. Two of her children are in school.

Teresita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Teresita has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 51 years old and single. Carolina works very hard to provide for her needs.

Carolina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care and other groceries.

Carolina has been in this business for 1 year. 

In the future, Carolina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 35 years old and married with four children. With four children in school, Jovelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jovelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like condiments, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Jovelyn has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Jovelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like condiments, canned goods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gogarma Village. Daniel joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Daniel suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to feed his family and children. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Daniel has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 150 bags of maize this year, Daniel can now ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia Martha pertenece al banco comunal SAYHUA DE CHICHUBAMBA, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia continua con su negocio de venta de verduras, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo zanahorias, papas entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de verduras al por mayor.
texts.en:
The member Martha belongs to the communal bank Sayhua de Chichubamba.  This bank is located in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.  

Martha continues with her business of selling vegetables.  She is grateful for the loan and promises to complete her established payments.  Martha is a responsible and diligent person.  She still sells carrots and potatoes, among other things.  In this way she gets her family ahead in life.

Martha is requesting a loan to buy wholesale vegetables.

loans.use: to buy wholesale vegetables.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 38 years old, married  from Polanco. Jocelyn remembers that her family would only rely on the low income of her husband where they only received minimum payment but no regular earnings. From her desire to help the family, she was inspired by the microfinance program extended by PMPC. 

She firmly believed that PMPC could helped her for her capital needs, she applied a loan to start her "balut" (duck egg, a Filipino exotic food) vending business. She has been in the business for 16 years now supporting their needs. Recently, Jocelyn is reapplying a loan to pay for her egg stocks and purchase of egg incubator to maintain her inventory and served her customers well. She deeply wishes to maintain her membership in good standing and live comfortably with adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to pay for her egg stocks and purchase of egg incubator to maintain her inventory and served her customers well

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a strong-willed mother for her six children. She runs a retail business with variety of dry good items like used clothing and foot-wear. To fully realize her project, she requested a loan. In the future, Susan hopes to sustain her business and wants to see all her children earn their diplomas.

loans.use: to restock her retail business of ready-to-wear clothing and dry good supplies

loans.name: Reynato

texts.en: Reynato is from Manukan, Zamboanga del Norte. He is 33 years of age. He and his partner have 3 school-age kids. This year, 2015, he joined Paglaum MPC and he appreciates the programs and services of the said co-op. From his desire to provide for the family, he engaged in selling fish in different barangays in municipality of Manukan, Zamboanga del Norte. Only his motorcycle was used as his source of transportation to reached the different barangays and sell fish. His source of income existed for 2 years now. In need of additional working capital, he requested a financial assistance from Paglaum MPC an amount of Php 8,000.00 to purchase more stocks of fish. Through this, he hopes to increase him more income for he is able to provide for the daily needs of his family and also he is happy he can support the education of his children which is his main priority of his hardship.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fish for selling

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 56 years old and currently lives with her husband and four children. She is very responsible and hardworking with her household obligations, since she has always been known to provide the best for her family. For a living, Teresita and her husband are both farmers who plant rice, corn, root crops and beans. 

Teresita wants to live in a decent house. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase light construction materials, such as plywood, planks, and roof sheets for her house. In the future, she deeply hopes to see all her children with stable financial status.

loans.use: to purchase light construction materials, such as plywood, planks, and roof sheets for her house

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa works raising pigs in Unidos, Plaridel, Philippines. This is how she makes a living and supports her family. Narcisa’s lowest point was when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to access credit to support her business. Narcisa takes her PMPC membership as seriously as she does her hog-raising business. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always be qualified for any financing needs. 

Narcisa is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for her hogs. Her loan will also help her works raising swine.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for her hogs

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 64 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 5 children now at their adult age. 
Cristina is engaged in fish vending business at the market stall for 25 years already. At present, she is also enjoying a monthly pension as a surviving spouse of her late husband. She earns approximately PHP15,000.00 each month doing this type of business activity in which the said amount is so helpful to meet their needs.  

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional “banyeras” of fishes for resale. 
Cristina has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, Cristina hopes to become a fish wholesaler in her town.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional “banyeras” of fishes

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 37 years old, married to Roseline and supports a family of 3 children. 

He has been practicing farming for the last 12 years earning KES 7,000 per month. 

Julius has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to supply to his clients inorder to educate his children with the received income.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to open a retail shop in the area. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply to his clients inorder to educate his children with the received income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of sodas for sale to his clients and meet both client and family needs

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a widowed woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Julieta is 57 years old now.

Julieta has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. Julieta requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell.

Julieta has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Julieta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, sugar, can goods, coffee, etc. to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming sugarcane.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Josephine dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like softdrinks, sugar, can goods, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Srey Pov's Group

texts.en:
Srey Pov is 33 years old and lives in a rural area of the Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of five children and three of them are in school. Because of her living conditions, she can earn income via rice farming as the main source of her income and construction worker is an additional source to earn extra income for ages. Her daily income is about 50,000KHR per day. 

Srey Pov is now leading a group of three to take the first Kiva loan via VisionFund. As the leader, she will use her loan portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income and ability to keep sending her children to school until they graduate.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 46-year-old, married woman, with 5 children. She, along with her husband (also shown in the photo), has been running a business of purchasing and selling goats. She looks after the goats and is responsible for feeding them, while her husband sells them to different markets in the city. Their business is providing them with enough income to support their family. 

However, she needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, health and clothing. In order to expand her earnings, Zubaida has availed a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR to buy more baby goats to sell to expand the business, and that will help in improving her family’s living standards

loans.use: to buy more baby goats to sell to expand the business, and that will help in improving her family’s living standards

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a 43-year-old married woman and the mother of 7 children. She is shown in the photo with her husband. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. She also looks after animals and sells them to generate an extra amount of income. For the improvement of her business, she has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.name: Sarum's Group

texts.en:
Sarum is 58-year-old and is a mother of two children who lives in a rural area of the Battambang province. The sources of her family’s income are from doing rice farming and working on other farm fee to earn extra income for eight years. Because of her struggle life, Sarum can make around 36,400KHR per day to support her family. 

She has been with VisionFund for one cycle already and completely repaid back loan. As the group leader of two, she is applying for this new Kiva loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farming. She expects her business will provide her more income, which allows her to buy more farmland to expand her farming area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farming

loans.name: Iuliana

texts.en:
Iuliana is 55 years old and has six children. For more than a year, she has operated a business selling bananas and taro in her community. 

Iuliana is requesting a loan to buy banana root seedlings and taro root seedlings, along with a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, chainsaw, and backpack sprayer to assist her to run her business. Iuliana joined SPBD in 2006 and hopes to use the profit from her loan to expand her business.

loans.use: buy banana root seedlings and taro root seedlings, along with a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, chainsaw, and backpack sprayer

loans.name: Kalala

texts.en:
Kalala is 51 years old and has three children. She joined SPBD in 2011 and runs a business selling bananas and taro in the market. 

Kalala is requesting a 2,950 WST loan to buy banana root seedlings and taro root seedlings, along with a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, and chemicals. She hopes to use the profit from her loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana root seedlings and taro root seedlings, along with a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Maletile

texts.en:
Maletile is a 29-year-old mother who has four children. She runs a business selling taro and banana in her village. Maletile became a member of SPBD in 2014.

Maletile is requesting a loan to buy banana root seedlings and taro root seedlings, along with a wheelbarrow, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chainsaw, and backpack sprayer. She hopes to use the profit from her loan to expand her business and provide for her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy banana root seedlings and taro root seedlings, along with a wheelbarrow, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chainsaw, and backpack sprayer

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria, age 62, is from Manukan, Zamboanga del Norte, in the Philippines.  She is married with 5 children.  Gloria joined PMPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the Coop. The Coop supported her by providing the capital to start her sari-sari store business. Helping the family survive, she gives her best effort to tend and display her store.

Gloria is now trying to expand her resources, she decided to engage in hog raising. She presented her project proposal to Paglaum MPC to finance the project and has applied for a loan of PHP 10,000.  This loan is intended to pay for five piglets that she can grow and sell. She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs. In addition, she wanted her business to be well known and to build a good business management for her loyal customers.  With her extra income, she wishes to live a happy and comfy life.

loans.use: to pay for five piglets that she can grow and sell

loans.name: Florecita

texts.en: Florecita has always dreamed of opening and managing her own retail store to support her needs. Florecita is married, she has four children and lives in Dapitan, in the Philippines. She applied for a loan to restock her store with basic inventory items like sugar, oil, milk and canned goods. She is now on her way to repaying the loan with her new profits and supporting her children.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic inventory items like sugar, oil, milk and canned goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for top dressing his crops

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Believing, of so many shattered dreams and broken hopes today, it's what only remains to Vilma. She still believes that it's never impossible to reach her goals. 

Vilma lives at Pasay City, Philippines. Today, she focuses on managing her small buy and sell business. She mainly offers ready-to-wear clothes for men and women mostly school uniforms. At times, it's hard for her to sustain her income, since customers barely come. But she's really hopeful that she'll be successful with this. 

Today, she asks for your helping hands for the continuation of her inventory. She would like to avail a loan worth PHP 50,000 that she will use in buying greater quantities of clothes to sell. If she gains such, it would be an advantage, since people get more attracted when there are more displayed than the usual. 

She really hopes that you can help her with this. She is doing this for her children's education, wishing they would be able to complete their studies- and her remaining hope relies in you. 

As of today, she's active in attending a weekly fellowship that enables her to draw strength and inspiration to push towards the goal through the word of God that she studies with her colleagues. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to be used in buying greater quantities of clothes to sell

loans.name: Gul  Pari

texts.en: Gul Pari is a married woman and the mother of 4 children; one of her sons is also shown in the photo; he runs a workshop of vehicle repairing. He makes enough amount of income to contribute in the family income.  For the improvement of her son’s business, Gul Pari has availed Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation. In this way her son will be able to purchase a new welding machine along with spare parts for his workshop to cater his customers’ needs, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase a new welding machine along with spare parts for her son's workshop to cater his customers’ needs

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat is a 39-year-old married woman. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been successfully running a small general store for many years. He has retained many customers over the years and makes a sufficient amount of income to contribute to the family income. Nusrat is a mother of 5 children. For the improvement of her husband's business, she has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to buy stock of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet customers’ demand time after time for increasing revenues.

loans.use: to buy stock of salts, biscuits and beverages for her husband's business to meet customers’ demand time after time for increasing revenues.

loans.name: Jingle Mary

texts.en: From Oroquieta City, Jingle Mary earns a living through her clothing sales. She sees to have enough inventory to continuously provide for her family. For her capital needs, PMPC stood by her since the start of her business. She is happy that she is able to survive the odds of business with determination and her family as her inspiration. To earn more, she applied a loan to purchase more clothing inventories and other items to sell. Jingle Mary hopes to live comfortably with her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing inventory and other items to sell

loans.name: Felister

texts.en:
Felister is 39 years old, married to Cornelius and supports a family with 4 children. 

She has been operating in her retail shop for the last 12 years earning KES 12,000 per month. 

Felister has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy more retail stock like sugar, salt, cooking oil, baking flour and maize flour for sale inorder to realize more income gain. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to start a retail shop. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more retail stock like sugar, salt, cooking oil, baking flour and maize flour for sale inorder to realize more income gain

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more timber to make furniture for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply more milk for more income gain

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy lives in Intramuros, Manila, a place well-known for its high and thick walls preserved since the period where the country was colonized by foreign inhabitants for hundred years.  

There is nothing she dreams but to help her family. This is why, she's very been into her business to earn and save money. She is operating a sari-sari store and recently, she was granted a loan worth PHP 15,000 that she used to improve the enterprise. 

To help her grow the business, she needs additional financial assistance. It would be better if you let her avail a loan worth PHP 40,000 that she will utilize in buying more merchandise products to sell. 
Thank you in advance for your generosity and heartfelt concern for people like her. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to be utilized in buying more merchandise products to sell.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is age 60, the mother of five children, and lives with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son is a greengrocer by profession, and he has sold fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. He offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the income generated from this vegetable shop. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family have suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs, so he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales of the vegetables.

Therefore, Farzanahas requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her son can buy excess seasonal vegetables. Farzana thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy seasonal vegetable for her son's greengrocery shop.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is a smallholder farmer from the Kitale area of Kenya. He lives with his wife and three children. He owns a 1/2 acre piece of land on hilly terrain in Kapchero. Titus uses his land to grow maize and he also keeps a bull. He runs a small local food shop as a side business and his main source of income is maze and profits from selling food.

Titus is requesting a loan to buy a dairy cow. Unlike bulls, investing in dairy cows has immediate return. Titus plans to sell the milk produced by his cow daily. He will use the income from his loan to repay his debt and build up his savings for future investments. Titus and his family all stand to benefit from his investment to improve their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel owns a 1.5 acre piece of land along a rough slope in Lelwak village, found in North Rift Kenya. On the farm, he has 2 dairy cows, 6 heads of poultry, 1 sheep and 200 trees. His biggest challenge is his farm's steep contour and rocky soil. Presently, he can hardly grow crops and add more animals. He needs to buy or rent land on a level plain field if he is to grow his business. 

Samwel is seeking a KES 30,000 loan to rent more land. With more space on a level field, Samwel plans to increase the number of animals he keeps and to plant food crops for his family's nutrition and surplus for sale. 
The benefits of this investment will trickle down to his family which is made up of him, his wife and 4 children aged between 9 and 21 years old. His role as a husband and as a father is to provide for the family and your loan will help him do just that.

loans.use: to rent land so as to increase his animal count

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Emmy would be characterized by her neighbours and customers as an amiable and charismatic woman.Listening to Emmy referring to the different breeds of dairy cows on her compound, one would mistake her for an Agricultural Extension Officer. Emmy, from Bomet, a remote town in Kenya, is an active and progressive farmer in her locality. She has a handsome husband and together they live on a small piece of land. Traditionally, her primary source of income has been eggs, crops, a personal business, and she has been practicing farming for the past 22 years. Having done farming for such a long time she has gained so much experience that she is always ranked the best farmer in her village. Demand for dairy milk has been high and Emmy wants to take advantage of the market. 

Therefore, she is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow. Dairy farming is another profitable agricultural venture in Kenya and Emmy has already identified the breed of dairy cow that she wants. Emmy always says that, “To become a successful dairy farmer, one does not need to be a livestock expert. All one needs is passion, information, and keenness to learn from the successful farmers.”  Marketing of the dairy milk and dairy products will not be a challenge, because she will sell the milk directly to the market and also to big dairy processing firms. Through the loan, Emmy will not only benefit from milk, but will also benefit from manure (cow dung) that will be used in improving the fertility of her farm, thus saving money that would have been spent buying fertilizer. 

Emmy has been facing challenges in accessing finances, but feels relieved knowing that institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, are there to make her dream come true. Emmy chose Juhudi Kilimo because the interest rate on their loan is low and is on a reducing basis. Emmy underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and during the training season she learned that saving is a continuous process in many micro finance institutions. Through accumulated profits Emmy plans to permanently improve her living conditions, and to secure the future of her school-aged children by paying tuition fees for them. She plans that through increased income, she will be able to buy more dairy cows and build a bio-gas digester, and hence save costs incurred in buying fuel.

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of cow

loans.name: Rifat

texts.en:
Rifat is the age of 49, living with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her husband owns an electrician shop in which he sells electrical goods and provides services for repairing electrical components, such as ceiling fans, washing machines and troubleshoots the underground electrical supply. He sells electrical components as well over his shop such as bulb, switches, sockets etc. 
He wants to buy new inventories for his shop but does not have cash in hand to buy new inventory. Therefore, Rifat has requested a Kiva loan from kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can be empower to buy his desired inventory. 

Rifat thanks to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy electrical goods for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en: Leonor has a mango farm in Aloran. This is her primary source of income for her family. Leonor makes it a point to have good land preparation to have maximum yield and good income. Recently, she needed money to pay for labor costs for preparing her land to plant other crops. She asked Paglaum MPC for the loan. Leonor wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply mangoes to fruit stands and other agricultural products in neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs for preparing her land to plant other crops

loans.name: Aristarchus

texts.en:
Aristarchus is 54 years old, married and supports a family of 7 children. 

He has been practicing farming for the last 27 years earning KES 14,000 per month.

Aristarchus has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy farm inputs like fortified fertilizer and cereal seedlings for use for more income gain. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to open a call center in the area. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fortified fertilizer and cereal seedlings

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie has been into this business of operating tricycles for a very long time (16 years and counting). She has experienced a lot of ups and downs that made her strong enough in facing life trials. And thank God that Kiva and CCT have been parts of this years-long journey. 

Recently, she was given a chance to have a loan amounting PHP 24,000 that she used for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Today, she comes to you again with the same reason. This time, she asks for PHP 20,000. She hopes that you'll help her again with her request. 

Tessie hopes to have a successful future far beyond their life today. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Jerusah

texts.en:
Jerusah is 27 years old, married to Peter and supports a family of 2 children. 

She has been practicing farming for the last 7 years earning KES 9,000 per month. 

Jerusah has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy certified seeds for planting for high production and supply for more income gain. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to start poultry farming. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds for planting for high production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Geline

texts.en:
Geline works hard to support her family. Geline is widowed and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Geline requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell like egg plant, beans and other vegetable.

Geline has been in this business for 43 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell like egg plant, pichay, beans and other vegetable

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 51 years old, with one child. Leah works very hard to provide for them.

Leah runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, personal product care, and other groceries.

Leah has been in this business for 32 years. 

In the future, Leah would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, personal product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rent land to expand his farm

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 34 years old and married with five children. With four children in school, Leah works very hard to provide for them.

Leah runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

Leah has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Leah would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites works hard to support her family. Marites is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Marites has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a 29 year old farmer from the Kenyenya area of Kenya. She practises crop and dairy farming to earn a decent living. She enjoys farming and she hopes to grow the business. 
Cecilia is seeking a KES 41600 loan to purchase a dairy cow. She has enough space and other resources to accommodate an additional cow in her farm. Cecilia projects that with the Kiva financed cow, her milk revenue will increase by 60%. 
Income generated from this investment will be used to service the loan and meet the basic needs of Cecilia's family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase her milk production and sales

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Lydiah, a 26 year old smallholder farmer from Magenche village in Kenya. Lydia enjoys dairy farming because it provides her family with milk for consumption and sale. She started looking after dairy animals at a tender age. Now that she has her own, it all feels natural to her, like it was destined to be.  
Lydiah is  seeking a loan to purchase another dairy cow. Having another cow will significantly boost her enterprise's milk production and her family income. 
Lydiah hopes that this new investment will go a long way to grow the business and pull her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase milk production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk to his customers using his motorcycle for more income gain

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified seeds for use for high production and supply to so as to earn more income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs for use in the farm for high production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 40 years old, married to Kennedy and supports a family 6 children. 

She has been practicing farming for the last 15 years earning KES 8,000 per month. 

Esther has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy certified maize seedlings for planting for high harvest and supply for more income gain. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to start a retail shop. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy certified maize seedlings for planting for high harvest and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install the roofing on his new bar-cafe that he will open in town

loans.name: Daphine

texts.en:
Daphine is 23 years old  with no child and she supports 4 family members. 

She has been a nurse for 1 year and the business earns her KES 8,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase medicine and syringes for her medical practices so as to enable her meet client needs.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate herself. 

She hope is to be financially stable and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase medicine and syringes for her medical practices so as to enable her meet client needs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To use for refurbishing his cafe so as to attract more customers.

loans.name: Mujeres Responsables Group

texts.es:
El G.S MUJERES RESPONSABLES  está conformado por doce integrantes once mujeres y un hombre,  madres responsables con quince hijos bajo su responsabilidad, son originarios de  Malpaisillo lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente, se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Todos tienen diferentes actividades económicas, los cuales se ayudan entre sí para sacar adelante sus negocios.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Pastora  y tiene por actividad económica la venta de cosmético, en su casa de habitación y de forma ambulante, el negocio consiste en vender productos como: vanidades, labiales, rubor, corrector de ojeras, bases, desmaquilla doras, lápiz de ojos, delineadores, crema de cuerpos, body, etc. Ella dedica a su negocio unas  ocho horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. Actividad que la desempeña desde hace cinco años, y que poco a poco ha venido creciendo su clientela y sus ingresos. El objetivo es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de cosmético para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Mujeres Responsables agradecen la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos  recursos para salir adelante con sus negocios, y darles una vida digna a sus familias.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Responsables" (Responsible Women) Group is made up of 12 members: 11 women and one man. They are responsible mothers with 15 children under their responsibility. They are natives of Malpaisillo, a place that is located in the western zone. They are known for being hard working, responsible, with personal desires to get ahead. All of them have different economic activities which help each other get ahead.

Thanks to her desire to succeed, the coordinator is Pastora and her work is selling cosmetics from her house and on foot. The business consists of selling products like lipsticks, blush, concealer, foundation, makeup remover, eye makeup, eyeliner, body cream, etc. She is dedicated to her business eight hours a day offering her products, work she has performed for five years and gradually she has been growing her customers and income. The objective is to invest in working capital and to stock her business by purchasing cosmetics to cover her customer's demand and in the not too distant future obtain better income. "Mujeres Responsables" are thankful for the help the Kiva investors provide to people of scarce resources to succeed with their businesses and to give a dignified life to their families.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of cosmetics like  lipsticks, blush, concealer, foundation, makeup remover, eye makeup, eyeliner, body cream, etc.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 26 years old and lives in Kapsowar, Kenya. She is a smallholder farmer, growing a wide variety of crops on her farm. She earns additional income transporting goods with her motorcycle. 

Mercy requested a loan, which she will use to buy farm inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, and for labor needed to grow more crops on her farm. The income from the motorcycle will be used to clear initial loan repayments until the crops are ready. The biggest impact of this loan to Mercy's family will be improved food and financial stability. Her plan is to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like bread, coffee, milk, etc. to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

Ofelia dreams that one day She will be able to save money to expand her business

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like bread, coffee, milk, etc. to sell

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 29 years old and married with three children, two children are still in school, Marites works very hard to provide for them.

Marites runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles etc.

Marites has been in this business for 3 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles etc

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like sugar, flour, young coconut etc for her food vending business.

Tessie has been in this business for 10 years. Tessie earns more income from farming sugarcane.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like sugar, flour, young coconut etc

loans.name: Hazell Walescka

texts.es:
Hazell una joven de veintiún años de edad, ha descubierto su vocación por el mundo de la belleza y el  estilismo, estudio una carrera técnica  en belleza, luego solicito un primer préstamo con Kiva y MiCrédito para montar su propio negocio, un salón de belleza, que ha logrado sacar adelante con el apoyo de su madre, que nunca deja de alentarle para que sea la mejor en lo que hace.

En estos momentos esta joven emprendedora solicita de nuevo un préstamo de Kiva junto MiCrédito esta vez para abastecerse de productos de belleza y además comprar joyas que pueda ofertar en su salón de belleza, esto le permitirá hacer crecer su negocio y captar más clientes. Lo que ella más quiere es crecer como empresaria, ser una mujer exitosa e independiente.
texts.en:
21-year-old Hazell is a young woman who discovered her vocation: working in the beauty and styling world. She graduated as a Beauty Technician and then requested her first loan with Kiva and MiCrédito to start her own business: a beauty salon. Her mother has helped her to get ahead with her business, and never quits motivating her so that she becomes better at what she does.

Right now, this young woman is requesting a new loan from Kiva and MiCrédito. This time, she will buy beauty products and jewelry to offer at her salon. This will help her to expand her business and attract more customers. What she wants is to grow as an entrepreneur and become a successful and independent woman.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres De Confianza Group

texts.es:
La Asociación comunal Mujeres de confianza  está conformada por  nueve integrantes madres  solteras, responsables de veinte hijos, menores de edad, los cuales están estudiando. Son originarias del  Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región, se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación persona.
