Todas tienen diferentes actividades económicas,  y se ayudan mutuamente paras sacar adelantes sus negocios. Lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar pero se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
En la actualidad la coordinadora es Inocencia y tiene por actividad económica la venta y crianza  de cerdos en su casa de habitación,  y por encargo, tiene diez años de dedicarse a esta actividad, motivada por  la necesidad de generar un ingreso para la manutención  de su familia el negocio consiste en comprar cerdos en pie para el engorde y posteriormente la venta  a clientes fijos y eventuales, clientes que se dedica al destace de cerdos para la elaboración de comida como nacatamales, charrasca, morongas, manteca de cerdos, chicharrón, adobado. La rutina de trabajo de esta mujer es trabajar unas  ocho horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto ya que depende económicamente de su trabajo. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de un lote de cerdos.  Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Mujeres de Confianza agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres de Confianza [Women of Confidence] is made up of nine members, single mothers responsible for twenty children of minor age who are in school. They are from El Sauce, located in the northern zone of the region. They are hard-working, responsible and eager for personal growth. All have different businesses and help each other mutually to get their businesses up and running. Unfortunately, they were unable to study, but saw themselves in the need to work to help with household expenses.

Currently, the coordinator is Inocencia and her business is the sale and breeding of pigs at the house where she lives. She has done this work for ten years, motivated by the necessity to generate income to support her family. Her business consists of buying live pigs to fatten and later sell to both regular and casual customers, who make a living selecting pigs for the production of foods such as nacatamales, charrasca, morongas, pork lard, pork rind and tanned hides.

This woman’s business routine is to work about eight hours a day selling her products. It is work that she carries out with great pleasure, as she is financially dependent on her work. The objective of this loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her business by buying and selling a batch of pigs. This way, she will be able to improve her earnings in the not-too-distant future.

Mujeres de Confianza is thankful for the help of the investors that Kiva provides to people with limited resources and countries as poor as Nicaragua, so that they have decent work.

loans.use: to buy a batch of live pigs for breeding and selling.

loans.name: Welinda

texts.en:
Welinda works hard to support her family. Welinda is widowed and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Welinda requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell like egg plant, beans and other vegetables.

Welinda has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell like egg plant, beans and other vegetables

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 68 years old and married with ten children.

Lilia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home product care and other groceries.

Lilia has borrowed and paid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 27 years and also earns an income from coconut wine vending.

Lilia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home product care and ther groceries

loans.name: Osoro

texts.en:
Osoro is a hard working 49 year old woman from Kenyenya area of Kenya. The main source of her income is milk. Osoro enjoys dairying above any other income-generating activity she is involved in. She owns 2 high breed Frisian cows that produce enough milk for her family consumption and surplus for sale. 
Osoro has one problem that she wishes to tackle with the help of your loan. There is nothing like tap water system in Magenhe village where she comes from. She relies on pails to fetch and store water for domestic and agricultural use.

Osoro is seeking a loan to buy a water tank. The tank will hold the same volume of water as at least 50 buckets. This investment will ensure continuous supply of water on Osoro's farm. Rain water will be harvested to fill the tank. 
The impact of this loan is not only to Osoro's family but also a step forward for the community in Magenhe village to start adopting best water management practices.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to collect rain water for both domestic and farm use

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a fun and lively smallholder farmer from Kachibora village in Kitale, Kenya. Susan is married and has 5 children between 2 and 21 years. She supports her husband to provide for their family by engaging in dairy farming herself. She has 3 fully grown cows that are productive by the local standards. 

She is seeking a loan to construct a cowshed for her animals.  Susan believes that among other things, a proper housing for animals has a positive influence on the animal's ability to utilize their capacity for growth, development and production. She is optimistic that her animals will grow healthier and more productive after the construction of a cowshed. 

Improved animal health and productivity is win for her family and their livelihood.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed for the proper housing of her cows and thus improve milk yield

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina works hard to support her family. Valentina is widow and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Valentina has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Valentina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, 27, runs a rural enterprise in Lelwak village which is found in North rift Kenya. She has 2 cows, 13 heads of poultry, a sheep and over 100 trees on her farm. She makes income from selling farm produce such as milk, eggs and meat. Being a single mother is tough and the experience has pushed Rose to endeavour for more for her 5 year old child. 

She recently ventured into cereal trade business with the hope of increasing her income. 
Cereal business is tricky like all other business. To make significant returns, Rose needs to lay out capital to purchase a stock of cereal grains. She would then break the bulk and brand the commodity before selling at the market. 

To get the ball rolling, she needs to overcome her biggest challenge, inadequate capital. It is for that reason that Rose is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to buy a stock of cereal grains.
Once this business takes off, there is no limit on how far Rose will go. Farming has limited growth in terms of scaling but the cereal trade is Rose's ticket. Income generated from this venture will be used for loan repayment and business growth.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 26 year old smallholder farmer from the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. She is married and has 1 child who is 3 years old. Irene has only been farming for 3 years but she has 2 cows, 5 heads of poultry, 3 goats and over 180 trees. She also has a garden that grows tea and vegetables. 
Irene's intention is to grow more crops this season. However, she will need to do a lot of tools and labour to prepare the ground for planting. 

She is seeking a small loan of KES 20,0000 to buy farm implements.  Using traditional old tools would not only make the work harder and time consuming for her but also compromise the quality which would be reflected in the final harvest. Therefore, this loan means a great deal to her because the tools will make her work fast and efficiently. The modern implements are also advanced and durable. The tools will serve her for this season and many more seasons to come.

loans.use: to buy new farm implements to be able to work more efficiently on land preparation

loans.name: Ardiana

texts.en:
This is Ardiana, a 45-year-old, married, rural mother of two. Her children are 20 and 17 years old. 

The reason why she needs this loan is that her husband, whose profession is welding, needs some materials and tools for the practice. Adriana herself does agriculture to make a living; more specifically, she sells the fruits to wholesale buyers from the orchards she planted about seven years ago, such as 30 citrus trees, 100 grapevines, 10 pear trees and 12 plum trees. The monthly income from this activity is roughly $175, along with $700 from the welding activity of her husband. 

“I love what I have been doing, but sometimes [it] is difficult because one of my legs is not in her full function, and I’ve got to drag it most of the times,” said Ardiana to the loan officer.

loans.use: to pay for some material and tools needed in her husband's welding profession

loans.name: Bukurije

texts.en:
Bukurije is an Egyptian Albanian lady who is in her early 60s and is the mother of three. She wants to buy two dairy cows. She lives in a rural village, unlike most people from her vulnerable community, who have been located mostly in the suburban areas. 

For the past ten years, she has been doing agriculture for a living, making and selling brooms made of straw that she grows on the land she owns. Between October and November, when the straw is ready, she makes approximately 2,500 brooms.

She decided to buy two cows in order to increase her family’s income. “Selling milk is far more profitable than selling brooms. And of course is more work, but I can handle it,” said Bukurije (or “beautiful” in English).

Bukurije is seen in the photograph holding some straw. Further in the background is her granddaughter, who was too shy to come to the front of the picture.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 59 years old and married with six children. With two children in school, Lina works very hard to provide for them.

Lina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, personal product care, canned goods, and other groceries.

Lina has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Lina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, personal product care, canned goods, and other groceries

loans.name: Lenah

texts.en:
Speaking with Aileen, it becomes obvious that she is a very hardworking and helpful woman, and that everything she does is for her family's benefit and wellbeing. She lives in a humble home in the town of Nkubu, along with a handsome husband and their four angelic looking children. She has always strived to give them a decent life and a good education. She has been doing agriculture for 26 years now. She makes money selling produce from her farm, including milk, eggs, and crops. She enjoys plowing her farm and watering her plants. Crop diseases pose a big challenge for her and also poor productivity. 

Aileen is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. With the loan, she plans to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer, which will help increase soil fertility and productivity on her farm. Increased productivity will allow her to improve her quality of life and living standards. Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, she has learned about the culture of saving and she plans to use the increased income to improve her farming. This loan will go a long way in changing the life of Aileen and her family.

loans.use: to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Rose, one of the most hardworking and dedicated women on planet earth. She is based in Rareti, a remote village in the Nyamira area of Kenya. She is happily married. She blessed with two lovely children. For the past 10 years she has been engaging in mixed farming and through selling milk and a variety of food crops she has earned a decent income. Like many farmers in her village, she also plants trees on her farm to complement the region's natural forests. Although Rose makes profits selling her farm produce at the market, the biggest challenge she faces is lack of water to irrigate her farm and water for home consumption. Rose comes from an area where there is no water connection and she is always forced to walk for a long distance for this “precious commodity”. 

Being 29 years of age, she faces challenges carrying water on her back. Rose is seeking a loan to buy a water tank and water pipes. Most of the farmers in Kenya depend on rain fed agriculture but Rose wants to change that notion and start irrigation farming. Through the loan she intends to harvest rain water which always goes to waste and store it in the tanks. She intends to buy pipes that will be used to pump water from the river directly to her farm. With your loan Rose will be saved the trouble of walking a long distance in search of water and she will have enough water for home consumption. Irrigating her farm will boast productivity since water is an important requirement in the germination of crops.

Rose is very excited about this project and hopes her dream will be achieved through the loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders. Increased productivity means increased income and this will translate to improved living standards. She will use the additional income to improve and secure the future of her children. Rose’s hope for the future is to live a fulfilling life.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank to store rain water and water pipes and pump

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Marietta works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell eggs business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Marietta is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to buy more eggs to sell for her buy and sell eggs business.

Marietta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more eggs to sell

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 30-year-old woman with a great future ahead of her. She is a mother who has been running a small-scale mixed farm in Kenya for 10 years. Her primary income sources are maize, vegetables, and profits from a small-time personal business. 

Caroline is seeking a loan to purchase modern farming implements. She realized that she is working increasingly longer and harder on her farm. The work women in the area are currently doing on the farm was previously done by men. They have been forced to take over as their husbands migrate to find wage labour in urban areas. Therefore, the tools women use are of great importance for improving productivity and yields and reducing time and physical effort. There are health implications as well in using poor traditional tools. The increased income from the use of better tools will help her meet business-related expenses. When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?" Caroline replied, "I will be able to educate my children."

loans.use: To buy new farm implements to improve efficiency on her farm

loans.name: Drande

texts.en:
Drande, a 43-year-old villager from the northern part of Albania, is a married mother of two in their late teens.  

She has been photographed in front of some concrete platform meant to be the foundation for a new family house. Currently, they live under a difficult situation in an outdated house with a leaking roof and old doors and windows that allow all the cold to come inside. She did not want to be photographed in the old house because she felt uncomfortable to be seen living under such conditions. 

Drande keeps livestock for a living; she’s got four cows, from which she sells about 30 liters of raw milk a day for nine months a year, and also four calves a year. In addition to this, she sells 12 piglets a year because she’s got a sow.

The loan she is requesting from you will be used to start building the house.

loans.use: to start building a house, as the living conditions of her family are extremely poor

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles, a youthful 38-year-old farmer from Ikonge, a remote village in the Nyamira area of Kenya, is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. He is a role model, a mentor, and an inspiration to many young farmers in his village because of his resilience despite personal challenges and his passion to support his family as a primary source of income. The living conditions in the Nyamira area are very tough and one needs to have tough skin in order to survive. Charles has always shown the resilience to beat all odds. Because of the hardcore poverty in his village, Charles started practicing mixed farming and has been doing it for the past 16 years. Charles's sources of income are from producing vegetables, tea, and eggs. These products are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market, which is a problem for Charles. The Nyamira area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market. That is why Charles is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. With the motorbike he will deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits because the products will still be fresh. Charles is very determined to succeed, and because he is very disciplined with finances, he plans to accumulate profits to provide a secure future for himself and for his parents. Charles's dream is to provide a secure future for his family. Through your loan you will help him realize his dream.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Diturije

texts.en:
Diturije has planted about 670 apple trees in the 9 dynym agriculture land that her family owns. She also plants beans and wheat in large quantities in the other 7 dynyms.  The clientele for her products are wholesale buyers. “As far as the apple fruit is concerned, they are sold very easily to neighbor countries; this is what we were told from the buyers. We’ve got two types of tasty and juicy apples, Gold and Starkinga.  The reason why we need this loan now is that we must build a place, like a warehouse to store the apples until we sell them. We hope that lenders will consider lending to us,” said Diturije to the loan officer.
  
Diturije is being photographed with Lulezim, her husband in front of the house. They are both in late 40s and parents of two children in their early 20s.

loans.use: to build a warehouse where she can store large quantities of apples from 670 trees, which are then exported to other countries

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter, 36, is a hard worker and always says, “I eat from my sweat.” He is based in Kadongo, a rural village in Nyamira, Kenya. He has been blessed with a family of four and has been practicing farming for the past thirteen years. His primary source of income has been milk and crops. Most of the small holder farmers in Kadongo village own approximately half an acre per household, and this has made them work extra hard to fully utilize their farms. Peter has been practicing mixed farming, and he enjoys the income he gets, but he has been facing challenges delivering his products to the market. Kadongo village is a very remote area, and the roads are in pathetic condition. This has hampered Peter from making timely delivery of products to the market while still fresh. Peter sells vegetables, milk, and tomatoes, which are very perishable and require quick delivery to fetch a high price. Peter is seeking a loan to buy a motorbike that will help him deliver his products to the market in a timely way so he can overcome the challenge of facing losses. Through the loan he will deliver the products timely to the market, and this means he will never suffer losses, which will translate into an immediate increase in profits. Peter plans to employ someone who will help him on the farm and deliver products to his large client base. Profits from the loan will be used to comfortably repay the loan fully and invest in a solid foundation for his children.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Leta

texts.en:
Leta is a young mother with one child. She is 22 years old and runs a business selling vegetables (eggplant, cabbage) at the market to earn a living. 

She hopes to gain more profit to expand her business, but in order to do this, Leta requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel and hand gloves to assist her to run the business. 

She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves.

loans.name: Peres

texts.en:
Peres is a veteran with much experience in the fields. She is humble and simple. She is a passionate, small-scale dairy farmer based in Lessos village. She stays with her husband, with whom she is blessed with six children. 

Subsistence farming is very common in Lessos. Peres is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. You might be wondering, "Why a dairy cow?" Five years ago, Juhudi Kilimo ventured into the market with the sole aim of changing farmers' perspective towards farming. Through giving out loans for acquiring income-generating assets, farmers carry out farming with the aim of making big returns in order to repay the loan and make a profit. 

After servicing the first loan, they get the logic and seek another loan, usually a higher amount, to do bigger projects and make more money for themselves. In this model, farmers, like Peres, start by planning and choosing a farming enterprise that will enable them to earn enough profit to repay the loan and use the extra amount. The farmer must also keep the market in mind when making these decisions. 

Peres identified dairy farming. In order to engage in that, she needs your loan, which she is going to invest so that she can make more money. She is going for a good quality animal. Her money from this investment will enable her to earn more income and pull her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marivic is 28 years old and has two children who are in school.

Marivic has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Marivic requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell.

Marivic has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a 53-year-old, enterprising, humble, and hardworking farmer. She is from Nyamira, Kenya, an area known because it’s the “bread basket of Nyanza region of Kenya.” Monica is a proud mother of two lovely children, whom she really loves and adores and will do anything within her power to comfortably care for. Monica has been practicing farming for the last twenty years. Through farming she has been able to earn a decent and honest income and comfortably provide the basic needs for her family. Monica practices mixed crop and dairy farming. Through these two farming activities, she always puts food on the table for her family. Although Monica has been making profits by selling vegetables and milk to the nearby markets and neighbors, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious mother. She has been facing a challenge of transporting her produce to the market and the timely delivery of products. Monica sells perishable products, and she does not have proper storage facilities. Therefore, she needs to make sure that the products reach the market on time. Because of poor feeder roads and the transport network in her area, this is a challenge she has faced. That is why she is seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. The motorbike will help her transport her products to the market. As a result of this loan, Monica will be able to timely deliver her products. She will earn more profit by selling fresher products at a higher price. Monica's dream is to secure the future of her children and to improve her living conditions. Through improved profits, Monica is sure that her dream will be achieved. She will also have a positive impact in her society through creating employment because she intends to employ someone to ride the motorbike. Monica is patiently waiting for your kindness so that she can realize her dream.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to help in timely delivery of products to the market

loans.name: Sapini

texts.en:
Sapini is a strong mother who runs a business selling taro and bananas at the market with the assistance of her 9 children. 

She is 59 years old and hopes to expand her business, but in order to do this, Sapini requested a loan to buy to buy a wheelbarrow, a backpack sprayer, a chainsaw, taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), chemicals, hand gloves and a rain coat to help her run the business. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, a backpack sprayer, a chainsaw, taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings), chemicals, hand gloves and a rain coat.

loans.name: Toeaso

texts.en:
Toeaso is a Samoan citizen. She is 54 years old and has 7 children. 

She runs a business selling taro and banana at the market to earn a living. Toeaso requested a loan to buy a chainsaw, a backpack sprayer, chemicals, taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings) to help her run the business. 

She joined SPBD in 2015, and hopes to expand her business using her profit in the future.

loans.use: to buy a chainsaw, a backpack sprayer, chemicals, taro roots (seedlings), banana roots (seedlings).

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is a smallholder farmer from Kaptumo village found in the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. She owns a 1 acre piece of land that she uses to grow food crops such as maize and vegetables. Her main income sources are crop produce and salary. Her future plan is to expand her farm business so that she no longer has to rely on being employed.
 
Sally is seeking a loan of KES 20,000 to rent land. The land she is fully planned for and thus cannot be used to grow any more crops. With your loan, however, Sally can rent 2 more acres that she can use to plant more food crops this season. 
Her diligence is evident in the fact that she ploughs her entire plot of land using a hoe, by herself. She strongly feels that she can do more once she can secure more land. Income she makes from your loan investment will be used to service the loan, grow the business and to meet her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to rent more land so that she can plant more crops and become self-employed

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen is a single lady. She is 20 years old and runs a business selling pancakes, vegetables, and fruit at the market to earn a living. She hopes to expand her business using her profit. In order to expand her business, Maureen requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, and vegetable seeds. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive is 19 years old and has no children. She owns and operates a small business selling elei (Samoan dyed fabric) printed materials at the market to earn a living. Olive requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei designs, and containers to assist her in running the business. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei designs, and containers

loans.name: Vaituloto

texts.en: Vaituloto is 19 years old and has no children. She runs a business selling taro and banana chips in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Vaituloto requested a loan to buy a sack of taro, bananas, a frying pan, plastic bags, and vegetable oil to help her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of taro, bananas, a frying pan, plastic bags, and vegetable oil

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith has a strong conviction in her mind that in order to succeed, she must work extra hard and always stay strong and positive in the face of any adversities that may arise. Judith is a 43-year-old farmer from Kibiricha village where she practices dairy farming. Judith and her husband are celebrating their 20th anniversary this year! The couple is blessed with 3 children. 

Judith's main source of income is milk. She co-owns a four acre land that they use to keep three dairy cows. Recently, one of her cows delivered a calf. Judith is afraid that the upcoming rainy season will be harsh on her calf who does not have a shelter. She is appealing to Kiva lenders to lend her a loan to construct shelter for her animals. Your investment will help Judith build a pen that will provide a comfortable and conducive environment for the proper development of her calf and that of future calves.

loans.use: to construct a pen for her calf

loans.name: El Ocotal 2 Group

texts.es: Felipe, tiene 46 años de edad, esta casado, tiene un hijo, reside en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Don Felipe se dedica a la agricultura principalmente al café, lleva aproximadamente 15 años de producir café y venderlo a los intermediarios de la zona. Ha obtenido cuatro prestamos anteriores para mantener sus cultivos activos, actualmente solicita otro en forma grupal, con el cual va comprar abonos y fertilizantes para aplicarle a su finca y cultivar mas plantas de café para aumentar su producción y venta. Su meta es seguir cultivando para tener trabajo e ingresos. El grupo al que pertenece se llama El Ocotal 2, integrado por tres personas que se dedican al cultivo de café en la misma zona, Solicitan un préstamo por 18,000 Lempiras en total para comprar abonos y fertilizar sus fincas. Los integrantes son los siguientes: en la foto está Felipe, Alejandro y José a la derecha.
texts.en:
Felipe is 46 years old, married, has a son and lives in a village of the municipality of Gracias, Lempira. Felipe works farming mainly coffee which he has been doing for about 15 years. He sells his product to middlemen in the area. He has had four previous loans to keep his growing active. Currently he is requesting another in a group. He will use it to buy manure and fertilizer for his farm and cultivate more coffee plants to increase his production and sell. His goal is to continue planting in order to have work and income.

The group he belongs to is called El Ocotal 2 and is made up of three people who grow coffee in the same area. They are requesting a loan for 18,000 HNL in total to buy manure and fertilizer for their farms. The members as they appear in the photo are Felipe, Alejandro and José on the right.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer for his farm and cultivate more coffee plants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm implements

loans.name: Nikoll

texts.en: Nikoll's son has been suffering from some severe illness and he's been scheduled to see health specialists soon. This is the reason why Nikoll is seeking your compassion this time; to pay for his son's medical expenses.

loans.use: to pay for his son's medical evaluation

loans.name: Rossy

texts.en:
Rossy started farming 20 years ago when she was 26 years old. Up to date,she enjoys farming because it enable her to provide food for her family. 
Rossy's farm has 3 dairy cows. 
She is seeking a loan to buy the fourth dairy cow. Having another cow will boost her milk production levels and strengthen her asset base once she completes the last loan repayment. 
Your loan investment is likely to meet Rossy's short term and long term goals. Her dream is to run a successful dairy farm that generates enough income to make her family comfortable.

loans.use: to buy a 4th dairy cow to boost milk yields and profits

loans.name: Ziphora

texts.en:
Regardless of the great impact that agriculture has on the Kenyan economy, micro-finance institutions (MFIs) shy away from lending to smallholder farmers. Juhudi Kilimo is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Kenyan farmers. 

Meet Ziphora, an ever-smiling, hardworking, and honest mother who is 48 years of age. She hails from the Nandihills area of Kenya. She is the proud mother of eight lovely children. She loves and treasures her children and will go the extra mile to make sure that they are comfortable. 

Ziphora’s primary source of income has come from selling milk, crop farming, and poultry farming. Through these ventures, she has been able to earn a decent income. She is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for 21 years, and throughout, she has never regretted going into farming. 

Although this humble mum has been making profits, not everything has been “a bed of roses." She faces financial challenges, and because the Nandihills area has proven a ready market for cereals, she is kindly seeking a loan to buy cereals for resale to thus improve her income. 

Ziphora’s upbringing was challenging, and she has faced many economic problems. Still, this ever-smiling mum has been making great improvements, and she believes that through your loan, she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life. 

Through Juhudi Kilimo, Ziphora has received training, and she has proven to be honest and disciplined with finances. She intends to fully repay the loan with the profits from her business. Ziphora is quite visionary and — with her accumulated profits — hopes she will be able to open a large cereal-selling shop that will boost her income and turn her life around.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale

loans.name: Andoneta

texts.en:
This is Andoneta, photographed in front of her family house. She is poor and is seeking from you a loan of an amount of 100,000 Albanian Lek so that she can improve the sanitation in her home. 

“People nowadays have a toilet inside the house even in the villages, yet we don’t have one. Ours is a very primitive one far from home, it’s just built with cardboard and straw, that’s it…” said Andoneta to the loan officer who interviewed her. 

Andoneta is 52 years old and married with two children who have chosen agriculture and livestock to earn a living for her family. She plants and sells wheat, beans and corn and has apple orchards from which she sells apple fruits to wholesale buyers. Her husband works in a nearby gas station for a pay of $250/month.

loans.use: to improve sanitation in their family home.

loans.name: Lusia

texts.en:
Lusia is a 56-year-old, married woman with six children. She makes and sells well cooked taro, bananas and breadfruit in her community to earn a living. She has six years of experience with this business. 

Lusia needs a loan to buy five large pots, a heavy-duty gas oven and a car for easy access to her business. She plans to use her profits to renovate her home and also pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Lusia has been a member of SPBD since 2007.

loans.use: to buy five large pots, a heavy-duty gas oven and a car for easy access to her business

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a 28-year-old married woman with four children. She makes and sells mince pies in her community to earn a living. She has five years of experience with this business. 

Jacinta needs a loan to buy bags of flour, cooking oil, baking trays, butter, a new stove and mince. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Jacinta has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, cooking oil, baking trays, butter, a new stove and mince to make mince pies

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Jared. He is a super incredible farmer! He certainly ranks among the top successful smallholder farmers on Juhudi Kilimo's client list. Born in 1986 into a humble family, Jared’s upbringing was difficult. He attended school and cleared secondary, after which he got into mixed farming 5 years ago. He also married a beautiful and loving wife. Together, they are blessed with 2 children. 

Jared practices farming on a 3-acre farm that is owned by the family in the village of Makairo. On the farm, he grows tea, vegetables, beans and maize. He also keeps more than two highly productive dairy cows for milk production. The 29-year-old farmer sells his produce in bulk to the nearby market. His key clients are his neighbours and local people. He is a member of Omwaro Group, a group formed to help members, who are smallholder farmers, to save and use the savings to access loans from financial institutions. 

Jared is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to build a greenhouse. He needs greenhouse technology to continuously improve the productivity, profitability and sustainability of his major farming systems. A greenhouse will provide a favorable environment for his plants. It will also protect the plants from adverse climatic conditions such as wind, cold, precipitation, excessive radiation, extreme temperature, insects and diseases. With your lending, Jared will have a year-round production of crops and off-season production of vegetable and fruits. He will also save on the use of natural resources such as water. Water requirement of crops is very limited and easy to control with this technology. 

Jared has a great credit history. In 2013, he took a KES 90,000 loan and successfully serviced it. This will be his second loan with Juhudi Kilimo. After successfully clearing the previous loans, he stated that this loan will change his life. Profits from this investment will be be plowed back into the business to fuel further growth. There still remains so much space on his land for future growth. If there ever was an opportunity to invest a $25 loan in someone's future, it is here! You won't regret it!

loans.use: To build a green house for increased diversity on his farm

loans.name: Leuta

texts.en:
Leuta is 63 years old and married with eight children.
 
She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years. 

Leuta needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Leuta will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade

loans.name: Maupulu

texts.en:
Maupulu is 44 years old and married with two children. She makes and sells fine mats, Samoan earrings and printed material in her community. 

Maupulu needs a loan to buy a variety of pandanus leaves, wood paint, brushes, nails, a machete and carving tools. 

In the future, Maupulu hopes to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a variety of pandanus leaves, wood paint, brushes, nails, a machete and carving tools

loans.name: Lenah

texts.en:
The young generation in Kenya struggle to make their way in the world because of unemployment and lack of capital. This is true for Lenah, who is based in the Kitale area of Kenya and is the mother of two lovely children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the past decade. She has managed to earn a decent income. Her primary sources of income are crop farming, dairy farming and personal business, and through these ventures she has been able to make ends meet. 

Lenah and her family live in the Kitale area of Kenya, an area that is very fertile and has good weather patterns that support farming activities. Lenah is very enterprising, and through farming she has been able to support her family, although she has been facing challenges. That is why she is seeking a loan to buy farm implements such as fertilizers and seeds that will assist her to produce more. 

With the loan, Lenah will be able to completely turn around her life because the production level on her farm will increase, and this means more income. Through the loan, she will be able to assure her family of improved living standards, and she is confident that the new profits will allow her to comfortably repay the loan. Lenah intends to purchase more land through savings that she will make, and this will assure her family of a brighter future.

loans.use: To buy farm implements such as seedlings and fertilizers for the improvement of her farm

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Hello world, meet an inspirational smallholder farmer by the name Magdalene. Born in 1986 in the Nandi region of Kenya, Magdalene has grown up to be a very hardworking and enterprising woman. Her upbringing was not easy but at least she managed to finish her secondary education. She is currently running a 3 acre mixed farm in Kilibwoni village with the unwavering contribution of her dear handsome husband. She keeps dairy cattle that give her milk to sell. 

Magdalene is seeking a loan to purchase land. 12 years ago she ventured into farming, she has been relying on her husband's farm to run the agribusiness, and still will. However, the business has grown and all the space is totally utilized. With the loan investment, she will acquire additional land to facilitate the growth of her business. Her financial discipline led her to join Kapkorio Group (made up of farmers who save together and use the savings to access and guarantee loans of each member). Returns from the investment will go toward loan repayment, setting up the new land and food for her family. She will also use the money to meet all the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase land to grow her farming business

loans.name: Enverije

texts.en:
Enverije wants to invest in livestock since she has none and therefore, their family most of the time lacks fresh dairy products. So far she's been doing agriculture planting and selling fresh products. With the goats that she plans on adding with your loan, she wants to sell homemade goat cheese and baby goats as well. 
Kindly note that the persons in the photograph are as follows: Enverije, her husband, Tahir; their son, Leonard and his wife, Nertila along with their two beautiful children.

loans.use: To buy goats in order to expand her small scale farming activities and provide milk for the family and make cheese for sale

loans.name: Tasileta

texts.en:
Tasileta is a 48-year-old woman who is married with seven children. She runs a small tailoring business in her community. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Tasileta has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors and material. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors and material

loans.name: Moeysha

texts.en: Moeysha is 29 years old and single with no children. He makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for one year. Moeysha has requested a loan to buy fabric paint, materials, a cutter, brushes and wooden carved designs. He plans to use his profits to pay for his family’s weekly expenses. He joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric paint, materials, a cutter, brushes and wooden carved designs.

loans.name: Epe

texts.en: Epe is a 47-year-old, married woman with three children. She makes and sells ice-cakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Epe needs a loan to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, Chinese candy and foam cups. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Epe has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, Chinese candy and foam cups.

loans.name: Asomaliu

texts.en:
Asomaliu is 52 years old and married with two children. She owns and operates a small flea market selling veggies to earn an income. She has been doing this for one year. 

Asomaliu needs a loan to buy veggie seeds, chemicals, fertilizer, a spade, a tiller and plastic bags. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and help with the expansion of her business. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2015 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy veggie seeds, chemicals, fertilizer, a spade, a tiller and plastic bags

loans.name: Seleisa

texts.en:
Seleisa is 42 years old and married with six children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for four years. 

Seleisa needs a loan to buy sacks of rice, drinks, cigarettes, snacks, shoes, frozen goods and bags of flour. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, drinks, cigarettes, snacks, shoes, frozen goods and bags of flour

loans.name: Pio

texts.en:
Pio is 37 years old and single with no children. He owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. He has been doing this for 22 years. 

Pio needs a loan to buy two large freezers, snacks, noodles, a new display fridge, cooking oil, cigarettes and frozen goods. 

He hopes to use the profits to pay for the family's weekly expenses. He became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for the business.

loans.use: to buy two large freezers, snacks, noodles, a new display fridge, cooking oil, cigarettes and frozen goods

loans.name: Pulemau

texts.en:
Pulemau is 51 years old and married with four children. She makes and sells elei printed (fabric) material to earn a living and has been doing this for one year. 

Pulemau has requested a loan to buy new paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs and gloves. 

She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs and gloves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bigger griddle, pork crackling, chicken, cheese, tomatoes, beans, and cabbage, etc.

loans.name: Kujtim

texts.en:
Kujtim bought a few goats previously with the loan he received from you and now he wants to do the same thing and add some more goats. 

"I plan on expanding this activity; goat cheese is very much in demand among Albanians, thus, no matter how much of that cheese you make, you are certain that it will be sold. My other two sons who didn't chose to get any higher education, will join me too in the livestock stream," said Kujtim to the branch assistant during the disbursing process.

loans.use: to buy more goats.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin has a dairy cow for the moment and wants to add another one with your financial help. 

In addition to this purchase, he wants to make some repairs to the animals' stable.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and repair his animals' existing stable.

loans.name: Pal

texts.en:
Pal is in the picture with his grandson. 

In 2010 Pal was involved in a car accident that left him with a dysfunctional nose. He has been scheduled for surgery and this is why he is seeking the loan from you.

loans.use: to pay for surgery to repair his nose which was left almost dysfunctional after a car accident in 2010.

loans.name: Taumaia

texts.en:
Taumaia is 51 years old and married with five children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for four years. 

Taumaia needs a loan to buy two new wheelbarrows, an axe, a chainsaw, chemicals, new boots and overalls, fertilizer and machetes. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Taumaia will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy two new wheelbarrows, an axe, a chainsaw, chemicals, new boots and overalls, fertilizer and machetes

loans.name: Taealio

texts.en:
Taealio is 31 years old. With her partner, she has 4 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. 

Taealio has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, frying pan and other things.

She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Taealio hopes to start a new business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil and other things.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is a smallholder dairy and poultry farmer dying to get her hands on the horticultural market. She is the mother of six and has been doing crop farming too but for subsistence purposes. She also grows vegetables, a bit of maize and grass for her cow. She is seeking a loan to grow vegetables on a bigger scale for commercial gains. 

The demand for horticultural products such as fruits and vegetables has grown steadily in Kenya in recent years. As much as they have become one of the top traded agricultural products, there is still plenty of room to expand. Damaris is very excited to start commercialization of her crops. She will rely on other sources of income to make initial installments of the loan but in no time, the horticultural farm will start pumping in income. The profits will be ploughed back into the business to fuel growth. Her increased income will uplift the living standards of her family. Lenders if there is someone that you should invest your money in then that person is Damaris!

loans.use: to expand her horticulture farm for increased vegetable production and sales

loans.name: Lindita

texts.en:
Lindita owns a dairy farm and lately she hasn’t been able to meet the demands of all of her clients for dairy products. Thus, with the loan that she is requesting from you she wants to buy milk in large quantities and then make cheese, butter and cottage cheese. 

In addition to this activity, she also makes and sells to food markets homemade traditional noodles called “petka” and dried phyllo pastries used for pies called ‘lakror’ locally. She is seen in the picture making them. 

“My husband helps in the dairy making, yet not in the phyllo making. That is my domain and I enjoy it. Almost every female household in our region enjoys making phyllo and also pies,” said Lindita smiling.

loans.use: to buy milk so she can meet the demand of her clients for dairy products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheeting, nails, wire, and wood and to pay for the labor to fix her house.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo,  se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace 5 años, también trabaja como jornalero y albañil, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hija, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono, herbicida, insecticidas, semillas, controles de plagas, etc. para continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo e ingresos.
texts.en:
This young man's face has been pixelated because he is 22 years old and lives in a high-risk area.  

He has been growing corn for the past 5 years.  He also works as a day laborer and bricklayer.  From the income he gets from such jobs he is able to resolve some of  his household expenses.  

This young man lives in his own house with his life partner and his daughter.

He is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, seeds, pest control, etc. to continue his crops since that is his only source of work and income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, seeds, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single mother of 2 and she relies on farming as an economic activity to sustain her family. She started farming a decade ago when she was 26 years old. Now, she has a 1 acre land, 5 goats, 40 heads of poultry and hundreds of soft wood trees.
  
Mary would like to increase the quantity of poultry products from her farm. She is seeking financial assistance in form of a loan investment to purchase of a brood of hens. Chicken products such as eggs and meat are on high demand in the country; Mary wants to take advantage of the market forces by supplying more. 
Returns from this expansion will be used to clear her loan debt and to grow the business. Noticeable improvements in her family's livelihood will occur as a result of this investment.

loans.use: to buy poultry to expand her farming activity for better profit

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Irine, a farmer who practices agriculture with a difference, employing youthful energy, enthusiasm and knowledge attained through agricultural training and business studies to develop her agriculture business. Irine has been practicing farming for the last 20 years on her small plot, where she does mixed farming. She enjoys farming so much, and every day she wakes up to go to the farm and improve her life. Through farming, she has been able to take care of her large family and provide the basic needs to them. Having the traits of a go-getter, Irene has always dreamed big. 

She has a vision of owning a large cereal-selling shop. That is why she is seeking a loan of KES 40,000 to start a cereal-selling shop and make her dream come true. With your loan, Irine will be able to improve her income levels and be able to comfortably take care of her family. Irine’s projections are that by the end of the first year, she would be able to start another cereal-selling shop, which means more income and improved living conditions. Through the profits generated from the business, she would be able to repay the loan and provide a secure future for her children and family.

loans.use: To buy cereals in order to open a cereals shop

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet, 31, is a smallholder farmer from Kericho, which is Kenya's largest tea producing region. Mixed farming is widely practised in Kericho: Farmers prefer to have a dairy farming running alongside tea farming because the two complement each other. 

Although Janet is dairy farmer, she is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs so that she can have a mixed farm. One important advantage that farmers have when running a mixed farm is that income from one activity, dairy for example, is regular and can keep their families afloat as they await for harvest season to reap from the other source. 
The impact this loan will have on Janet's livelihood is growth and product diversification. Increased income from this investment will enable her to meet her families basic and financial needs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs in order to have a mixed farm for safer income levels

loans.name: Myslim

texts.en:
At the moment Myslim has three dairy cows from which he sells about 20 liters of raw milk a day; he also owns some agricultural land and has also rented from others some more where he plants onions, beans and wheat.

The loan that he is requesting from you this time, will be used to prepare the land for planting to ensure a successful season later

loans.use: to prepare the land for planting for a successful harvest later

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm implements to diversify his farm in to horticulture

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana, 50, is a smallholder mixed farmer from Kapsowar area of Kenya. Kapsowar has a high altitude which makes maize crop farming a thriving business. Juliana's main income source is milk and maize. She enjoys dairy farming because it provides a regular source of income. She also enjoys crop farming but it is a riskier bet. 

Juliana is seeking a loan of KES 30,000 to buy quality certified seeds for planting. Even though quality seeds cost more, and the sellers target big farmers, Juliana is stretching herself by paying more for them because she sees the value in planting quality seeds that have gone through vigorous testing. The impact of this loan will be reflected in the ability of the seeds to produce normal seedlings under adverse growing conditions. These seeds are likely to survive Kapsowar's harsh weather that has seen acres of crops fail in the past. 

Having a successful crop farm is a step forward for Juliana's family towards food and financial security.

loans.use: to buy seedlings for improved results leading to a better income

loans.name: Jorge  Geronimo

texts.es: Jorge de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas,  etc. y así poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge is 55 years old and lives in his own home with his life partner.  

He has been growing  corn and beans for several years, and sells his products in the surrounding areas where he resides.  From the income that he obtains from his sales he is able to resolve some household expenses.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of seeds, manure/compost, fertilizers, herbicides, etc. so that he can continue with his work which will generate good profits and hence a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure/compost, fertilizers, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Deep ravines define the Nyamira area of Kenya. Kiva lenders meet Dinah who is based in Nyamira and is a proud mother of 5 cute looking children. Her primary sources of income are poultry and some side hustle business that she does to supplement the meager income she earns from farming. Dinah aspires to keep increasing her income and improving the quality of life her family is leading. Small-scale farming is a way of life in Africa full of challenges and equally full of huge opportunities. 

Dinah has set out to venture into poultry farming, which is one of the most profitable industries in Kenya due to the high demand from hotels and restaurants. For Dinah, this is a very wonderful opportunity. The poultry business is something that has been breathing within her for some time. The business is easy to establish; chickens are unproblematic to rear on small plots; poultry are well-adapted and more resistant to local pests and diseases; the business is vital for future food security, leading towards self-employment and self-reliance.

loans.use: to purchase poultry in order to expand in to a profitable side of local farming

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Self-driven, honest and hardworking are just but a few of the good qualities of Margaret a smallholder farmer from the Nyamira area of Kenya. This region has harsh weather patterns, and poultry farming is the only profitable business venture. Margaret is happily married and blessed with Four children. For the past 14 years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been selling eggs and crop farming. She passionately loves poultry farming. 

When asked what is most enjoyable about farming, her reply was “selling eggs.” Her biggest challenge is the lack of funds to increase her poultry farming. She is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Margaret is a member of Omosocho seito self-help group, and through the group, she has received training on financial management and saving. Through the loan, she will sell eggs to the local market and to her neighbors, hence improving her living conditions and getting out of the poverty situation she is in currently. Profits from the loan will be used in repaying the loan and increasing her business.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry to expand on egg and chicken production

loans.name: Romain

texts.es:
Él tiene 32 años de edad. vive en casa propia de material rustico, con su conyuge y sus dos menores hijos en su poder de 5 y 1 año de edad de los cuales el mayor cursa estudios de nivel inicial en el colegio del caserío de ilucan,que pertenece al distrito de Callayuc, provincia de Cajamarca, Región Cajamarca, Sierra Norte del Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica el cliente es a la cría y venta de ganado vacuno,con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años.Él cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales en su comunidad. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizara en comprar de animales menores para su engorde y posterior venta . De esta manera lo ayudara a la mejora de sus ingreso y calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Romain is 32 years old. He lives in his own house made of rustic materials with his spouse and his two children who are under his care, aged 5 and 1 year old. The oldest goes to the first year of school in the village of Ilucan, which belongs to the district of Callayuc, Cajamarca province, Cajamarca region, in the North Andes of Peru.

The business he works in is raising and selling cattle. With 10 years experience in the field he has very good references both personal and work from his community. The loan that will be awarded him will be used to buy small animals to fatten and later sell. Doing this will help him to increase his income and his quality of living and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy small animals to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Aamir Haider

texts.es: Aamir es un socio antiguo. Actualmente esta convalidando sus cursos técnicos en una universidad. El ahora es un universitario en Ingeniería de sistemas ya que para el es muy importante la informática porque hoy en día todo es en base a la tecnología. Ademas de ya trabajar y estudiar en sus ratos libres practica deportes con sus amigos. El solicito el préstamo para pagar sus pensiones de la universidad. Se siente muy agradecido con los socios de Kiva y con todas las personas que lo ayudan a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Aamir is a former borrower. Currently, he is validating his technical courses at a university. He is now a college student in Computer Engineering as to him, computing is very important because nowadays everything is based on technology. Besides already working and studying, he plays sports with friends in his spare time. 

He requested the loan to pay his college tuition. He feels very grateful to Kiva partners and to all people that help him meet his goals.

loans.use: to pay diploma fees at his institute.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Honest, hardworking and humble are some of the few traits that describe Jeniffer a small-holder farmer in Nkubu, a rural town in the central region of Kenya. For the past 35 years of her life, Jeniffer has been doing mixed farming. This has worked out well for her. She has been able to provide a decent living for her family. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops. 

Jeniffer is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow and construct a dairy shed. This will provide shelter for her favorite animal. The thing she enjoys most about dairy farming is selling milk. However, in order for a dairy cow to be more productive, the farmer needs to be good at dairy management. Your loan will help Jeniffer construct a cowshed that will help very much with dairy management. The additional cow will help in increasing the volume of milk. The shelter will enable her to prepare food rations and feed the cow. The shed will ensure that the cow is always in a clean and hygienic environment. Your loan will bring untold benefits to Jeniffer. She is projecting a significant increase in milk production. The extra money will go to loan repayment and her grandchildren's education. Her dream is for her grandchildren to live a better life, with basic needs fulfilled.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow and to construct a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 54-year-old woman from the Nkubu area of Kenya. She has been married to her husband for thirty-four years and they have seven children. Her youngest child is eighteen years old and the eldest is thirty-five years old. Janet has been a farmer since she got married. She operates her farm on a small piece of land under her husband's name, where she raises dairy animals and poultry and grows crops. 

Janet is seeking a loan of KES 20,000 to pay for modern farm implements. With modern tools, Janet will work more efficiently. She expects to see major improvements in the quality and quantity of her yield.

loans.use: to buy farm implements for improved farm management

loans.name: Griselda

texts.en: Griselda wants to add supplies to her aesthetics/beauty salon with the loan that she is requesting from you.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her aesthetics/beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cereals for resale

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima De Conchacalla Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SANTA ROSA DE LIMA DE CONCHACALLA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Ricardina, la socia tiene 56 años de edad tiene 4 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a su   negocio de crianza de animales menores, la socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, la socia vende a sus animalitos en las distintas ferias y clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y alimentos para sus animales.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de construcción, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ganadería, agricultura y negocio de venta de chicha.
Las personas que salen con la cara tapada no pertenecen al banco comunal.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “SANTA ROSA DE LIMA DE CONCHACALLA” communal bank which is located in the district of Anta, belonging to the province of Anta and Cusco department.

Ricardina is 56 years old, is in a common-law relationship and has four children. She combines her daily activities with working at her business raising small animals. She is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this loan and promises to comply with the payment of her installments on time.

She sells small animals in the different markets and to clients who request them. She wants to continue to work so she can continue to support her family. Ricardina is requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs and feed for her animals.

The other members work selling animals, have a construction business, a grocery store, raise cattle, farm and sell chicha (corn beer). The people with their faces blanked out do not belong to the communal bank.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and feed for her animals.

loans.name: Chepkirui

texts.en:
Irene is a 26-year-old single mother of one child. Five years ago, she started farming to provide food and income for her family. Today, she uses her family's 4-acre farm to do dairy and poultry farming. She has two dairy cows and 10 head of poultry. 

To grow her business and gain more loyal customers, Irene is seeking a loan of KES 10,000 which she will use to buy 20 chickens. 

As her child is growing up, their family's needs and expenses keep increasing. She is requesting a loan to buy more poultry to increase the income she makes from selling poultry products.  
 
Irene hopes to grow her farm business in the future in order to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a 26-year-old single mother of two children. Fifteen years ago, she started farming to help her parents produce food for her family. Her mother owns a 5-acre piece of land in Megun village in North Rift province of Kenya where she is farming today. Her main source of income is poultry products such as eggs and meat.  

Stella is seeking a KES 30,000 loan to buy poultry by the end of this month. She will spend KES 20,000 on brooding chickens and KES 10,000 to buy feed. As her children are growing up, their family needs are increasing. Stella is requesting a loan to buy more poultry to increase the income she makes from selling poultry products. 
  
Stella hopes to grow her farm business in the future in order to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Humble and hardworking – that’s Agnes. She is a real fighter of a woman who has dedicated a large part of her life to caring for her children. Her primary sources of income are milk, vegetables and farming. She has been married for 26 years and as a result she has a very strong bond with her husband and three children. Agnes practices mixed farming, which offers her multiple sources of income. 

Agnes is seeking a loan to purchase a water pump. Her two and a quarter acre farm is comprised of two dairy cows and 10 heads of poultry. The problem she is facing due to the remoteness of her home is lack of a tap water system. She is kindly seeking for a loan to buy water pipes and a water pump.
With your loan investment, Agnes will be able to pump water in huge volumes from the well in a much easier and much faster manner compared to the method of fetching buckets. The water pump and pipes will also clear the way for the introduction of irrigation technology in the future when she is ready to invest in that technique. The impact of your loan will be evident in the greener crops and healthier animals henceforth. Improving Agnes's farm business will definitely bring a positive change in her family life as well.

loans.use: to buy a water pump and water pipes, to be able to pump water from her well to her house and cowsheds

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 48 years old and married. He lives with his wife and four children in Kiboroa village in Kenya where he practices dairy and poultry farming to earn a living.  

Michael is seeking a loan of KES 45,000 to do poultry farming. He realizes that if he is to take his poultry farm to greater heights, he needs external financing. He intends to use this loan to buy traditional breeds of chicken that are adapted to local conditions. Your investment will enable him to take advantage of the growing demand for poultry products in the Kitale market. 

Michael will use the income that he hopes to earn from poultry farming to look after his family’s well-being and their children’s education. He also wants to continue investing in poultry.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a smallholder farmer from Kapsaret area of Kenya. He's been doing dairy and crop farming for many years. His main income source is milk. Every year, Geoffrey sets a goal for his business. This year, his goal is to overcome a challenge that he has been facing for so many years... transportation.
Geoffrey is seeking a loan to buy an affordable motorcycle for farm transportation. Your loan will enable Geoffrey to buy a motorcycle which will be used to ferry farm produce from his farm to the market. The motorcycle will provide an elegant solution to Geoffrey's transportation problems because it is affordable, easy to ride, durable, and fast! 

Geoffrey's family will feel the most impact of the loan since having a motorcycle will not only improve their business operations but also earn them additional income from offering transportation services to the public. Money saved and generated from this investment will pay the loan and meet the basic needs of Geoffrey's family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to take farm produce quickly to market

loans.name: Dios De Pacto Group

texts.es:
La  asociación comunal Dios de pacto está conformada por once integrantes diez mujeres y un hombre, padres y madres responsable de sus familias, con  veinte hijos los cuales están bajo su responsabilidad, son originarios de  Telica, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente de la región,  se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables con ganas de superación personal,  todos tiene diferentes actividades económicas la cual es el medio para sacar adelante a sus familias, y brindarles mejores oportunidades de vida y condiciones a sus hijos.
En la actualidad gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Erika y tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa de segunda mano, como: pantalones de vestir jeans, faldas, vestidos, blusas, shores, bolsos, ropa de niño, ropa de cama, ropa interior, zapatos etc. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, su rutina de trabajo diario es de unas ocho horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos, actividad  que la desempeña con mucho gusto ya que ella es el sostén de sus hijos,  y es su medio de vida para proporcionales las condiciones y estabilidad económica que ellos necesitan.  El objetivo es invertiré en capital de trabajo para surtir su inventario y satisfacer la demanda de los clientes. Asociación comunal Dios de Pacto agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The community association Dios de Pacto [Covenant of God] is comprised of eleven members:  ten women and one man.  They are responsible parents that look out for their families, and with [a total of] twenty children who are under their care. 

They originate from Telica, a place that is located in the western region  and is characterized by responsible workers eager for self-improvement.  Everyone has different economic activities which they use as the means to raise their families, and provide better life opportunities and conditions for their children.

Currently, thanks to her desire to succeed , the group's coordinator  is Erika.  Her economic activity is the sale of second hand clothing such as jeans, dress pants, skirts, dresses, blouses, shorts, handbags, children's clothing, bedding, underwear, shoes etc. 

Her business is located in her home.  Her daily work routine includes offering her products for about eight hours daily; an activity that she works at with pleasure.  Since she is the only support to her children, this is the means to her livelihood which enables her to provide the conditions and financial stability that they need. 

Her goal is to invest in working capital to stock up her inventory and meet customer demands.  

Dios de Pacto community association is grateful to Kiva lenders for the assistance that they provide, to people with low resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua, so as to be able to attain a means to dignified work.

loans.use: to purchase second hand clothing such as dress pants, jeans, skirts, dresses, blouses, shorts, handbags, children's clothing, bedding, underwear.

loans.name: Margena

texts.en:
Margena, a 39-year-old mother of three young children needs your financial help to make some very basic yet very important improvements to their family house. “The windows and doors are about 40 years old and made of wood.  After all these years and under such weather conditions, of course they would be destroyed. The roof tiles also are broken and all the rain water comes inside. This, entire make the house extremely cold and impossible to live in and especially for my children who are still young,” said Margena. 
Agriculture/livestock that she’s been doing has been the only source of income for the family; she plants and sells red peppers, beans, fodder, corn, oats and red beets. She also has two dairy cows, forty sheep and a horse.

loans.use: to make basic yet very important replacements of windows and roof tiles to their home where three young children live

loans.name: Agriphine

texts.en:
Agriphine is a hardworking lady from Niganga village who is involved in dairy farming. Her work brings home an important source of income. Agriphine is married and has three children. The children help her with the work. 

Agriphine applied for a loan because she needs to grow her dairy farm. She will buy an additional cow with the borrowed money. The cow financed by Kiva lenders will increase the quantity of milk she takes to the market and boost her monthly income.  

Agriphine needs more income to take care of her increasing family expenses and that is why this loan is important to her.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a smallholder farmer in a rural village near Meru town, Kenya. He is married and has 2 children. 20 years ago, after completing his secondary education, Patrick started farming. His income sources include milk, bananas and transportation fees. Besides farming, he owns a motorcycle which he uses to both transport his produce to the market and ferry goods and passengers at a fee. 

Patrick is a appealing to Kiva lenders to help him with a loan which will enable him to afford a chaff cutter machine. Feed management is at the top of his mind when it comes to dairy farming. He constructed a feed store right above his dairy unit to ensure that feeds can be easily made available to his cows by anyone, including children, at all times. 

With your loan, Patrick will easily process feed for his animals at minimal cost. Having a chaff cutting machine will also enable him to prepare a good feed-mixture that will meet nutritional needs of the animals. From your loan investment, Patrick is optimistic that milk production will increase significantly. Increase in income will help him meet his family's basic needs and pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy a chaff cutter to improve feeding to his dairy heard

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Riungu

texts.en:
Riungu and his family live in a rural home in Ganga village in Kenya. His wife and five children enjoy dairy farming for it provides a decent livelihood and income for them. 

Riungu started dairy farming 30 years ago and now he has six dairy cows, a 10-acre horticultural farm, and about 5 head of poultry. He sells raw milk at a small local market called Ciakanyinga and uses the income to cover domestic and business expenses.
