Through hard work and sacrifices, he has been able to grow his dairy farm over the years. He is seeking a loan to further grow his business. The borrowed money will be used to buy an additional dairy cow which will reproduce calves and produce more milk for him to sell.
 
Your loan investment will help Riungu grow his business, and income from the dairy farm will help him to elevate the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 57 years old, widowed, and has five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Salome runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like condiments, biscuits, canned goods, home care products, and groceries.

Salome has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like condiments, biscuits, canned goods, home care products, and groceries

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard looks young but he is a 47-year-old smallholder farmer from Nkubu area of Kenya who is strong and hardworking. He is married and he has 3 children between 5 and 20 years of age. 
Leonard started farming 20 years ago. Today, he owns a 1.5 acre farm which has 30 trees, a maize garden, a banana garden, 3 dairy cows, 15 heads of poultry, 2 goats and 2 sheep. His main income sources are banana and milk. To improve efficiency, Leonard also uses MPESA services, which is a mobile banking solution used by almost everyone with a phone in Kenya.
 
Leonard is seeking a loan to pay for farm inputs involved in planting of more banana trees. The money will be spent on labour, fertilizer and miscellaneous expenses. He will also count on help from his family to work faster and cut on costs. Income from milk will be used to make initial loan payments until he starts harvesting banana fruits. 
Through this investment, Leonard wants to flourish his farm business and improve financial status of his family.

loans.use: to pay for growing of more banana trees

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
Hillary and his family live in a rural home in Sibaiyan village in Kenya. His parents and nine siblings enjoy dairy farming because to them it is a livelihood and a source of income. He started farming seven years ago and now he has two cows and 12 head of poultry, 10 goats, and a tea farm. He sells raw milk, his regular income source, at the local market and uses the income to cover domestic and business expenses.  

Through hard work and sacrifices, Hillary has been able to grow his dairy farm over the years. He is seeking a loan to further grow his business. The borrowed money will be used to buy an additional dairy cow which will reproduce calves and produce more milk for him to sell. 

Your loan investment will help Hillary grow his business, and income from the dairy farm will help him to elevate the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Maritim

texts.en:
Maritim and his family live in a rural home in Ndarawetta village in Kenya. His wife and three children enjoy dairy farming as a livelihood and a source of income. Maritim started dairy farming five years ago and now he has five productive dairy cows. He sells raw milk at Bomet market and uses the income to cover domestic and business expenses.  

Through hard work and sacrifices, Maritim has been able to grow his dairy farm over the years. He is seeking a loan to further grow his business. The borrowed money will be used to buy an additional dairy cow which will reproduce calves and produce more milk for him to sell. 

Your loan investment will help Maritim grow his business and income from the dairy farm will help him to elevate the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Paulin

texts.en: Paulin wants to build a hay barn to improve the feeding of his livestock and your loan will help him achieve this goal. He is a married father of three young children; 12-year-old twins and a 7-year-old. The activity he’s been pursuing along with his wife, to earn an income for their family is agriculture/livestock.  He’s got three cows and in addition to selling the three calves a year, he also sells approximately 32 liters of raw milk/day during their milk production months, about nine months.  Added to this, Paulin has four saws and he sells about 40 piglets a year and from the two goats he has, he makes cheese for the family. “Sometimes I feel this is hard on my wife, since she has to care about cooking and cleaning as well. And livestock is not easy at all,” said Paulin praising his wife.

loans.use: to build a hay barn to improve his farm and feeding for his livestock

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 24 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol y maicillo, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años y aprendió este trabajo con ayuda de su padre, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono, herbicida, insecticidas, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The young man, whose face has been pixelated because he's 24 years old and lives in a high-risk area, earns a living growing corn, beans, and sorghum.  He has worked this job for several years, having learned it with his father's help.  He lives in his own home with his family.

He's requesting a loan to buy soil amendments, herbicide, insecticide, fertilizer,  and pest control, and to improve the land shown in the photograph.  He'll be able to keep working and earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments, herbicide, insecticide, fertilizer, and pest controls, and to improve his plot of land

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al  banco comunal “MARIA AUXILIADORA” ,el banco está ubicado en el departamento del Cusco.
La socia Esther  tiene 52 años tiene 04 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
El socio que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
Esther belongs to the communal banking group "Mary Our Helper."  The bank is located in the department of Cusco.  Esther is 52 years old and has 4 children.  She lives with her life partner.  She runs a grocery business and has been in the field for many years. Things are going well thanks to the efforts she puts in each day.  She wants to continue working in order to continue supporting her family.

She is asking for a loan in order to purchase rice, sugar and other items.  

The other group members are thankful for the opportunity that is being offered and promise to comply with the loan agreement terms.  The group member who appears on the attached picture requested permission to arrive late to the communal banking meeting because of work obligations.

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar among other items in order to supply her grocery store.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat and his family live in a rural home in Machoge Masaba in the western part of Kenya. His love of nature inspired him to start tree farming on his only plot of land. He runs other small side-businesses to make ends meet because tree farming is not an activity that would provide him with a regular source of income. 

Josphat is seeking a loan to start dairy farming. The borrowed money will be used to buy a dairy cow which will produce milk for him to sell on a daily basis.
 
Your loan investment will help Josphat to start dairy farming which will provide him with a new livelihood and regular income. He will also have enough time to look after his trees because dairy farming is not so involving.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Cristian Favian

texts.es: Cristian tiene 35 años es soltero vive solo se dedica a vender ropa y tiene un bar solicita el crédito para comprar mercaderia en Ventanas y una mesa de villar para adecuar su bar para atender mejor a sus clientes, su sueño es tener una discoteka grande con todos los servicios para ser la mejor y asi tener buenos ingresos, en su tiempo libre le gusta jugar pelota.
texts.en:
Cristian, 35, is single and lives alone. He makes a living selling clothes and he owns a bar. 

He is requesting a loan to buy merchandise in windows and a billiards table for his bar to better serve his customers. 

His dream is to have a big nightclub offering all services to make it the best so that he will generate a good income. 

In his free time he enjoys playing soccer.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in windows and a billiards table

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Aida is 54 years old and has five children who are in school.

Aida has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell.

Aida has been in this business for five years. In the future, Aida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Alice is 52 years old and one of her children is in school.

Alice has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Alice requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and do maintenance for her business.

Alice has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and do  maintenance for her business

loans.name: Hon

texts.en:
Hon is 39 years old and married with seven children in her care. She works for a small pure drinking water factory and resides in a community in Kampong Chhnang province in Cambodia. Her husband is a 42-year-old construction foreman. One of her seven children also works in the pure drinking water factory, one works in a hotel, and four attend school. Together, they can make around $25 each day. 

Hon’s present wooden house is old, so she is now applying for a loan to buy construction materials to build a new house. This loan will help her have enough money to build a house to provide her family with good living conditions. In the future, she is going to run a business selling groceries and support her children to go through high school, and if possible, university.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a new house

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials and spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transportation business.

Lolita has been in this business for 10 years. Lolita earns additional income from direct selling Avon products.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel is 27 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Annabel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home care products and other groceries.

Annabel has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, coffee, junk foods, condiments, shampoo, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home care product s and other groceries

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is a married woman with 11 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Carolina is 53 years old and has six children who are in school.

Carolina has a buy-and-sell corn business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy corn and other supplies for her business.

Carolina has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy corn and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy liquors, rice, sugar, vegetable oil, milk, etc

loans.name: Tirta Kusuma Group

texts.en:
Several months have passed and the Tirta Kusuma group was able to pay off on time. In the journey of its businesses, the group members are progressing quite rapidly. They can raise pigs and farm in a good way so that they get a satisfactory result. Because they got a satisfactory result, some members of the group got enough money for saving. Their activities are monitored by the loan officer for their achievements and serve as an example for other farmers. 

I Gusti Nyoman sold all of her piglets and earned enough profit after deducting other costs. From the profit, she can fullfill her family's daily needs and save. She and all the members of the Tirta Kusuma send their greetings to all lenders, Kiva and MUK.

Because the prices of feed, fertilizer and seeds are high, the Tirta Kusuma group proposes a new loan. Each member gets 2,000,000 IDR. The loan will be used to buy super quality piglets, feed, fertilizer, farming tools and corn seed.

I Gusti Nyoman will use the loan to buy two superior piglets, farming tools and corn seeds. To reduce costs, she still gives mixed feeds. She hopes the pigs will grow healthy and not be attacked by disease, and that the garden produces a maximum result. If she earns enough savings to raise capital, she will raise the pigs with her own capital.

loans.use: to buy two superior piglets, farming tools and corn seeds

loans.name: Dios Con Nosotros. Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACIÓN COMUNAL DIOS CON NOSOTROS  ESTA CONFORMADA POR NUEVE INTEGRANTES, DOS HOMBRES Y SIETE MUJERES, PADRES DE FAMILIAS RESPONSABLES CON QUINCE HIJOS, BAJO SU RESPONSABILIDAD, SON ORIGINARIOS DE MALPAISILLO, LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA NORTE DE LA REGIÓN, SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORES, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL. EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN DÍA A DÍA PARA SACAR ADELANTE A SUS FAMILIAS, Y BRINDARLES MEJORES OPORTUNIDADES DE VIDA.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA CORDINADORA ES  ANA LUCIA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA UNA FRITANGA EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN, LA RUTINA DE TRABAJO ES DE UNA DOCE HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS COMIDA COMO. GALLO PINTO, TACOS, ENCHILADAS, MADUROS, TAJADAS, CARNE ASADA, ETC. ACTIVIDAD QUE LA DESEMPEÑA DESDE LA 5: PM HASTA 12 : PM EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO CON LA COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES, PARA LA PREPARACIÓN DE LA COMIDA.  DIOS CON NOSOTROS AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A  PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The nine members of the Dios Con Nosotros community bank, two men and seven women, are parents of fifteen children.  They live in Malpaisillo, in the north of the country.  The group's members are hard-working and responsible, determined to overcome the obstacles they face.  They struggle from day to day to support their families and provide for them as best they can.
Ana Lucia is the leader of the group.  She operates a prepared food business from a space in her house.  She normally works twelve hours a day, making and selling gallo pinto, tacos, enchiladas, carne asada and other prepared foods.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy the supplies she needs to carry on her business.  
The members of the Dios Con Nosotros community bank are grateful to Kiva lenders for supporting their businesses.  Your loans help people with few resources in Nicaragua and other poor countries make decent livings.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her prepared food sales business.

loans.name: Dimple

texts.en:
Dimple is 26 years old and married with three children.

Dimple works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like personal care products, canned goods, and other groceries.

Dimple has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Dimple aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like personal care products, canned goods, and other groceries

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 55 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Elena is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Elena has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: I Putu

texts.en:
With good planing and good management, I Putu can harvest his rice field with a satisfactory profit. After deducting his costs and splitting the profit with the owner of the land, he can reach his target. I Putu feels very happy that he can fullfill the needs of his family and set aside some money for savings.

I Putu requested another loan, which he will use to purchase all the needs for his rice field business (paddy seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide, rent a tractor, and pay the laborers) and also buy some cacaos from a farmer. He wants to try a new business as a cacao buyer and seller. With 1 kg of cacao, he can earn a profit from 1,000-2,000 IDR. I Putu hopes the plan can run smoothly. His dream is to renovate his house and have enough savings to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to purchase all the needs for his rice field business (paddy seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide, rent a tractor, and pay the laborers) and some cacaos

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAYHUA DE CHICHUBAMBA, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Justina tiene 48 años de edad  es soltera y tiene 04 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de elaboración de tortas, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de harina, huevos, azúcar entre otros.
texts.en:
Our member, Justina, belongs to the SAYHUA DE CHICHUBAMBA community bank in Urubamba province.  She is 48-years old, single and the mother of 4 children.  She operates a food business, making and selling cakes.  She has operated the business for some years and says that it is successful because she has worked hard every day to make it successful.  The business, she adds, is her sole means of supporting her family.  
Justina is applying for a loan that she will use to buy the supplies she needs--flour, eggs, sugar, etc.--to carry on her business.  She is grateful for your help and committed to repaying your loans in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her cake sales business.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional sack of feed.

She supplements this income with earnings from her fishing.

Arlene dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to purchase an additional sack of feed

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Julie works hard to support her family.

She has a pension house rental business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store.  Julie is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for the maintenance of her pension house for her  business.

Julie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for the maintenance of her pension house

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 35 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Jovelyn has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from fishing.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Lazarus

texts.en:
Lazarus is a married man with 2 children. He describes himself as determined and focused. 

Lazarus operates a retail business where he sells phones and phones accessories. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. Lazarus' business is located in a busy area, and he has all types of customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of different varieties of phones to satisfy the demands of his customers. 

Lazarus will use the 70,000 KES loan to buy more stock of mobile phones. His business goal is to start selling laptops within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved living standards. 

This is Lazarus' third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to take care of his family, and start his laptop selling business.

loans.use: buy more stock of mobile phones

loans.name: Von

texts.en:
Von, 18 years old, is a single rice farmer who lives with his widowed father, 47 years old, and three other siblings in a village in the province of Kampong Chhnang, Cambodia. 

He has cultivated rice since 2010. Two of his siblings work in a garment factory, and the youngest one is in school. Together, the family can make around USD $12 a day. 

Von would like a Kiva loan through Kredit MFI because he is lacking the finances to buy a cow for plowing and breeding for more calves. With the loan, he will be able to afford a cow for rice farming. In the future, he is going to buy more cows to fatten.

loans.use: to buy a cow for plowing and breeding for more calves

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAYHUA DE CHICHUBAMBA, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Beatriz tiene 44 años de edad  y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de venta de flores, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de flores entre otros.
texts.en:
Our member, Beatriz, is a member of the SAYHUA DE CHICHUBAMBA community bank in Urubamba province.  She is 44-years old and single.  She operates a business selling flowers.  She has operated the business for some years and says that it is successful because she has worked hard every day to make it successful.  The business, she adds, is her sole means of supporting her family.
Beatriz is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her business with more flowers.  She is grateful for your help and committed to repaying your loans in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to stock her flower sales business.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAYHUA DE CHICHUBAMBA, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Eusebia tiene 47 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de venta de flores, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de flores entre otros.
texts.en:
Our member, Eusebia, belongs to the SAYHUA DE CHICHUBAMBA community bank in Urubamba province.  She is 47-years old, single, and the mother of 2 children.  She operates a business selling flowers.  The business is successful, she says, because she has worked hard every day to make it successful.  The business, she adds, is her sole means of supporting her family.
Eusebia is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her flower sales business.  She is grateful for your help and committed to repaying your loans in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to stock her flower sales business.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of two children, Elisa works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling spices. Elisa is borrowing 8,000 PHP  through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable vending business.

Elisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma a  51-year-old widowed mother of four children, two of whom are in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. The operator of a bicycle transport business in the Philippines for 10 years now, she has requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and other needed materials.

In the future, Elma would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 56 years old and married with eight children. With one child in school, Elsa works very hard to provide for them.

Elsa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like beverages, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

Elsa has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, biscuits, soap, shampoo, candies and other groceries. 

In the future, Elsa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like beverages, condiments, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 100 lengths of pagne (brightly colored African print cloth)

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a transport business where she owns a motorcycle for transporting customers from one place to another. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area fit for business and her primary customers are the general public. 

Sarah describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 95,000 loan to service and do maintenance on her motorcycle. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to service and do maintenance on her motorcycle

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco comunal LAS MARGARITAS, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba.
La socia Sandra tiene 32 años de edad es casada y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a trabajar en un hotel, la socia  lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de sabanas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Our member, Sandra, belong to the LAS MARGARITAS community bank in Urubamba province.  She is 32-years old, married, and the mother of 2 children.  She has operated a hotel business for some years and says that it is successful because she has worked hard every day to make it successful.  She wants to continue the business because it is her means of helping her family.
Sandra is applying for a loan that she will use to buy the sheets, etc. that she needs to carry on her business.  She is grateful for your help and committed to repaying your loans in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her hotel business.

loans.name: G.s. Sagrado Corazón De Jesus Group

texts.es:
El G.S  Sagrado Corazón de Jesús  está conformado por tres integrantes madres responsables de familia con siete hijos bajo su responsabilidad, son originarias de Nagarote, lugar que se caracteriza por su artesanía, y comida típica como quesillo, tiste,  se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre les gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos,  en la actualidad luchan para sacar adelante a sus familias y brindarles las oportunidades que ellas no tuvieron
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Nellys y  tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, detergentes. Aceites, frutas, jugos, hielos, etc. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El  objetivo del crédito es invertir en la compra de productos comestibles para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, y que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  G.S Sagrado Corazón de Jesús agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Sagrado Corazón de Jesús [Sacred Heart of Jesus] communal bank is comprised of three members who are responsible mothers of families with seven children under their responsibility. They are from Nagarote, a place known for its handicrafts and typical foods such as quesillo [fresh cheese] and tiste [a drink made of toasted corn, cacao, peppers and cloves]. 

They are known for being hardworking, responsible people with a desire for personal growth. In their free time, they like to enjoy the company of their children. They are currently struggling to raise their families and offer them opportunities that they did not have, thanks to their desire to get ahead. 

The coordinator is Nellys, whose business is a grocery store. It's a small store that sells food products such as: rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, oils, fruits, juices, ice, etc. She works in her business 12 hours a day offering her products. 

The goal of the loan is to invest in the purchase of food products in order to satisfy her clients' demand, and in the near future to be able to have higher income. The Sagrado Corazón de Jesús communal bank is thankful for the help of Kiva investors who allow people with meager resources and poor countries like Nicaragua to have a dignified way to earn a living.

loans.use: to invest in a grocery store with products such as: rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, oils, fruits, juices, ice, etc.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 56 years old and has ten children. Elsa is married and has two children who are in school.

Elsa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Elsa has been in this business for one year now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elsa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Las Flores Al Progreso Group

texts.es: Betty es una mujer luchadora de 44 años de edad,madre de dos hijos ya profesionales, socia del grupo Las Flores al progreso, grupo conformado por 6 socias unidas y responsables donde lleva 2 años de buena relación ya que todos los socios se conocen bien,Betty se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y a la venta de objetos para el hogar como ropa, sábanas,colchas,cubrecamas y demás.Betty es una mujer que ha salido adelante siempre, lleva más de 10 años dedicandose a lo mismo,le gusta el rubro del negocio por que tiene contacto con la gente directamente,Betty a sabido salir de los obstáculos que se le han presentado en el trayecto de su vida,como al inicio daba crédito a personas cercanas,algunos no le pagaban o demoraban mucho en hacerlo,pero eso le enseñó a no ser tan confiada,Betty solicitó el préstamo que le otorgó Edaprospo para la compra de mercadería ya que con el tiempo piensa en poner un stand cerca a su casa para la venta de sus productos. Betty agradece mucho la ayuda prestada de los inversionistas Kiva y dice no defraudarlos. Betty es la sra que está sentada al lado izquierdo de la foto, polo manga larga blanco, pantalon y chaleco negro.
texts.en:
Betty is a 44 year old woman and a fighter. She is the mother of two children, both now professionals. She is a member of the "Las Flores Al Progreso" group which is made up of six united and responsible members. They have had two years of good relations as they know each other well.

Betty works selling beauty products and articles for the home like clothing, sheets, quilts, bed covers and others. Betty is a woman who has always got ahead. She has been doing this work for more than 10 years. She likes the business as she has direct contact with people.

Betty has been able to get around the obstacles that she has come across in the course of her life. For example giving credit to people who were close to her. Some of them didn't pay or were very tardy in paying and this taught her not to be so trusting.

Betty is requesting this loan that Edaprospo will award her to buy merchandise as over time she is thinking of putting a stand near her house to sell her products. Betty is very grateful for the support provided by the Kiva lenders and says she won't let them down. Betty is seated to the left of the photo wearing a white, long sleeved shirt, pants and a black vest.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like sheets, blankets, quilts, bed covers and others.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Don francisco es un hombre trabajador y con ganas de superarse es por ello que gracias a su esmero y con el apoyo del crédito él pudo comprar sus materiales de herrería y gracias a Dios ahora cuenta con más clientes y sus ingresos han mejorado, Don Francisco nuevamente solicita un préstamo porque ve la necesidad de contar con un terreno donde el pueda cultivar y garantizar otro ingreso, pues el ahora quiere aprovechar la oportunidad  para poder  comprar una cuerda terreno para cultivo, porque el piensa mejor sus ingresos cultivando café o banano pues afortunadamente las tierras donde el vive produce café y banano de buena calidad. Él tiene las esperanzas de conseguir el crédito para poder realizar su compra y seguir superándose ahora ya realizado cultivo y ya no solo dedicarse a la herrería.
texts.en: Francisco is a hardworking man who is eager to succeed. Thanks to his dedication, and with the support of credit, he was able to buy materials for his blacksmith business. Thanks to God, he now has more customers and his income has improved. Francisco is applying for a loan again because he sees the need for a land where he can farm and ensure other income,  that's why, he now wants to take the opportunity to buy a plot of land for crops. He thinks to improve his income by growing coffee or bananas because fortunately the land where he lives produces good quality of coffee and bananas. He has hopes of getting credit to make his purchase and to continue progressing further, now with farming, and not only with the blacksmithing works.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land for crops

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 30 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She raise pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years.

Analie requested a loan from NWTF for 29,500 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en: Judy is a single mother of one child. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, bread, sugar and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more sugar, bread, flour, milk, soap and other household items. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: buy more sugar, bread, flour, milk, soap and other household items

loans.name: Marther

texts.en: Marther is a married mother of seven children. She describes herself as competent. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be bad weather. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy a cow. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 30 years old, married and has one child who is in school.

Analyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Analyn requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Analyn has been in this business for nine years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 55-year-old married mother of eight children, four in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Erlinda has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for two years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Charlene

texts.en:
Charlene is 25 years old and married with three children, one in school.

Charlene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Charlene has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Charlene aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma supports her two children through her food-vending business. She requested a loan to buy coconut leaves and sacks of rice for her puso (rice specially wrapped in coconut leaves) business. She is now on her way to repaying the loan with her new profits.

loans.use: To buy coconut leaves and sacks of rice for her puso business

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Rebecca Linda

texts.en:
Rebecca Linda is 62 years old and single.  

Rebecca Linda is in the agricultural business, farming ornamental plants in the Philippines. Rebecca Linda requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other supplies for her business.

Rebecca Linda has been farming ornamental plants for two years now,and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Rebecca Linda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is a widowed, 54-year-old mother of three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Hilda has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. Hilda requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Hilda has been in this business for 18 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Marry Chan

texts.en:
Marry Chan is 27 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Marry Chan has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from pig raising.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie owns and manages an internet cafe shop in Sta Maria, Tangub City, Philippines. This has been doing well for five years, supporting the needs of the family. Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase an additional computer set for her business. This will help her to continuously sustain the needs of her family, especially her children's education. She wants to expand her business and would be happier to have a commercial building in the city.

loans.use: to purchase an additional computer set for her business

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.en: Nilufar is a hard-working woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1977. She is divorced, has one son and is living with her family. She has been a farmer for almost 17 years, raising livestock to sell in the market. Over the years, she has learned key aspects of her business  She has a dream to enlarge her livestock farm. She is planning to open a dairy processing factory in the future. Recently, her son has been sick and needs surgery. Nilufar appealed to IMON, asking for a loan to do the surgery in a medical clinic. She hopes to be supported and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to pay for her son's surgery in a medical clinic

loans.name: Maria Ysabel

texts.es:
María Ysabel tiene 39 años de edad, soltera, con 1 hijo a su cargo, vive en casa propia, domicilio en el distrito de Oyotun, que pertenece a la Provincia de Chiclayo, en la región Lambayeque, de la Costa Noste del Perú. Es una zona rural que se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales, comercio, entre otra actividades.

Ella se dedica a brindar servicios de ayudante de cocina en restaurant como mesera, hace mas de 3 años,contando con buenas referencias dentro de su comunidad, solicita préstamo para la compra de mercadería como ropa,entre otros, los mismos que serían vendidos en la próxima feria del Distrito de Oyotún; esto con la finalidad de generar un ingreso adicional a los que ya percibe en su actual centro de labores. Esto le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
María Ysabel is 39 years old, single, and has a son under her care. She owns the house where she lives in the Oyotún district, Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region of the northern coast of Peru. This is a rural area, and locals work raising and selling animals, in commerce, and in other activities.

She has been working as a kitchen assistant and waitress for more than three years. She has good references from locals.

She is requesting a loan to buy products such as clothes, and sell them at the upcoming fair of the Oyotún district. This will help her to earn an extra income, besides the one she earns from her current job. This will help her to improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy products such as clothes, and sell them at the upcoming District's fair

loans.name: Leberato

texts.en: Leberato is from Tangub. He is a very responsible father when it comes to the welfare of his family, since he has always been known to provide the best for his family. He is earning a living in his retailing business. Leberato wants to live in a house with good roofing and durable walling, so he decided to borrow an amount after he learned that he can access financial assistance from PMPC. His loan is intended to purchase light construction materials such as plywood, sticks and roof sheets for his house. Leberato smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life and providing his family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase light construction materials such as plywood, sticks and roof sheets for his house

location.town: Tangub-Lorenzo Tan, Tangub City, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is 44 years old and married with five children.

Irma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home care products and other groceries.

Irma has borrowed and paid back two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from rice vending.

Irma aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a hard-working woman entrepreneur with five children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods and personal care products.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like pig raising.

Violeta dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods and personal care products.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Nelly requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy vegetables like pichay, cabbage, potato, carrot, etc. to sell in her food stall.

Nelly has been in this business for 20 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables like pichay, cabbage, potato, carrot, etc. to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Daisy is 52 years old and has one child who is in school.

Daisy has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Daisy requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Daisy has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Daisy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Felecitas

texts.en:
Felecitas is 58 years old and married with two children.

Felecitas works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

Felecitas has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Felecitas aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Janice is 30 years old and has four children who are in school.

Janice has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Janice requested a PHP 6500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Janice has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Janice would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Kevin Guillermo

texts.es: A sus 18 años de edad Guillermo es un joven trabajador,  desde hace un año atrás que se dedica al comercio de gorras, la madre de Guillermo es comerciante de toda la vida y les ha enseñado a sus hijos a trabajar en esta actividad, Guillermo vive con su madre y sus 3 hermanos. Guillermo solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de gorras para venderlas de manera ambulante, Guillermo tiene la aspiración de seguir trabajando y llegar a ser un buen comerciante y además le gustaría a futuro poder poner  un almacén de gorras.
texts.en: At 18 Guillermo is a young worker. He has been making his living selling caps for a year. Guillermo's mother has been a business woman all her life and has taught her children to do the same work. Guillermo lives with his mother and 3 siblings. Guillermo is requesting this loan money to invest it by buying caps to sell on the street. Guillermo hopes to continue working and become a good businessman and he would also like to be able to open a cap store in the future.

loans.use: to buy hats.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida  lives in Puntod, Plaridel and supports her four children by rice farming and raising hogs. She has successfully repaid her whole loan, which she used to buy loads of sand, gravel, and cement, and jalousies for windows. She wants her children to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work she has had to endure.

loans.use: to buy loads of sand, gravel, and cement, and jalousies for windows

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is married and is from Tangub, Philippines. She manages her fishing activities and owns a fishing boat with her husband. She hired two fishermen to work for her. She personally sells the catch from her fishing boat in nearby municipalities. Since she became a member of Paglaum MPC, she has been a member in good standing for almost two years. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to PHP 10,000 to buy fish nets, foam and other fishing accessories. As much as possible, she has to have all the needed fishing accessories to maximize chances of a good catch. She already has floaters to help guard her fish cages. She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors so she can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where she will fetch higher prices. In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales. She wishes to see her family enjoy good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, foam and other fishing accessories.

loans.name: Arona

texts.en: Arona makes a living through her retailing business. She runs a snack vending business in Pagadian and earns a promising income to support her family. She signed up her membership with PMPC to gain access to capitalization. She wants to increase her inventory. Now, she availed herself of a loan to purchase more stock for her snack vending business. Arona hopes to sustain her business and dreams of sending all her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her snack vending businesss.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a Kiva borrower. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and shoes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in an area with plenty of customers and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low working capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes and shoes. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is managing her eatery business in Ozamiz. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. This has been doing well supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and will also accept catering for added income. Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be more happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business

loans.name: Ceferena

texts.en:
Ceferena is a strong-willed mother for her four children. She runs a retail business with a variety of books, learning materials, school and office supplies to sell. To fully realize her project, she requested a loan. 

In the future, Ceferena hopes to sustain her business and wants to see all of those in her family enjoy good living conditions.

loans.use: to restock her retail business with a variety of books, learning materials, school and office supplies to sell

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 23 years old and single, and has one child.

Rowena is in the agricultural business of poultry in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her chickens.

Rowena has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her chickens

loans.name: Donna

texts.en:
Donna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Donna has been in this business for 5 years. She earns more income from fishing.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 42 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Estrella is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Estrella has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Alba Alicia

texts.es: Alba tiene 37 años de edad, ella se quedo viuda y tiene 3 hijos, de las edades de 6, 8 y 11 años de edad. Alba es una señora muy trabajadora que desde que era muy jovencita se dedica a la comercialización de chompas, chalecos, bufandas y mas prendas de vestir sobre todo con estampados muy llamativos para los ganaderos, ya que los estampados son de animales. Alba solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercadería en ropa para comercializarla de manera ambulante por pedidos y en las ferias de ropa. Alba tiene la aspiración de seguir trabajando y que le vaya muy bien en su negocio para que no le haga falta lo mas indispensable para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alba is 37 years old. She is a widow and has 3 children, who are 6, 8, and 11 years old. Alba is a very hard-working woman, who—since a young age—has been dedicated to selling sweaters, vests, scarves, and other garments with very flashy designs for the ranchers, since the designs are of animals. 

Alba requests the loan from the loan to invest in buying clothing merchandise to sell as a street vendor, by orders, and in clothing fairs. 

Alba aspires to continue working and for her business to go well, so that she does not lack anything needed for her children.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Chandana

texts.en:
Thirty-eight-year old Chandana lives in Chuakhola village in Falakata of the Alipurduar district of West Bengal. She stays with her husband and three children (one daughter and two sons). Her sons are engaged with some different work, and her daughter reads in grade 9.  Her husband runs a home-based poultry farm business, and Chandana also helps her husband in this business. 

They buy chicks, and after two months when they mature as broilers (chicken), they sell them to the meat shop at profitable rates. This is the main source of income for the family. Out of their small income, they are maintaining their family in a very pitiable condition. Now, they are very much confident in this business and acquainted themselves with the market situation. They want to expand their business. 

So Chandana took a loan from Kiva through BJS for the development of their existing business and better livelihood.

From the loan, she wishes to purchase more chicks, chicks’ fodder and medicine, and pay for the other business-related costs. Both she and her husband will mutually develop their business and meet their social needs.

Chandana is very much happy and thankful to her lenders for their financial help.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and other necessary things for the poultry farm business.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jovelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Jovelyn is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her bicycle transport business.

Jovelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy L. Bel (a line of perfume) merchandise for her store and pay for other recently acquired stock

loans.name: Franklin Anibal

texts.es: A sus 26 años de edad Anibal es un joven soltero que se dedica desde hace 5 años atrás a  trabajar de chofer y también comenta que desde hace un año atrás se dedica a la comercialización de zapatos, Anibal solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de zapatos para comercializarlos de manera ambulante ofreciendo su producto, Anibal espera que su negocio mejore y que de esta manera  pueda salir adelante trabajando como un joven de bien.
texts.en:
Franklin Anibal, 26, is a young, single man who has been making a living working as a driver for the past five years. He mentions that for the past year he has also been selling shoes. 

Anibal is requesting a loan to buy shoes, so he can sell his product as a street vendor.

Anibal hopes his business improves so that he can get ahead and work like a good young man.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Felix Alberto

texts.es:
Félix se dedica a la agricultura, siendo esta su fuente principal de ingresos, dicha actividad económica la realiza hace mas de 10 años, el cuenta con dos manzanas de tierra aptas para la siembra, contando también con su sistema de riego.
Don Félix siembra maíz, frijoles, cebollas y repollo, y cuenta con toda la experiencia necesaria para la buena explotación de su tierra, Félix está muy agradecido por el apoyo del credito anterior, ya que le fue otorgado en el momento precioso, y compro los insumos que necesitaba antes que comenzaran las lluvias y esto le ayudo en tener una buena cosecha de maíz.
Don Félix ahora solicita el apoyo del crédito para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, semilla mejorada y foliares para tener una excelente cosecha este año y así poder ofrecer un producto de buena calidad.
Don Félix sueña con poder tener una tienda de insumos en su comunidad porque así el podría producirlos y venderlos a un mejor precio.


Honduras Mayo 2015
texts.en:
Felix is dedicated to agriculture, which is his main source of income. He has been doing this work for more than 10 years. He has two blocks of land used for the harvest, and that land also has an irrigation system.

Felix grows corn, beans, onions, and cabbage. He has all of the experience necessary to use his land well. Felix is very thankful for the support from his previous loan, since it was offered at a valuable time; he bought supplies that were needed before the rains began. This helped him in having a good corn harvest.

Felix now requests the support of a loan to buy manure, fertilizers, improved seeds, and foliage to have an excellent harvest this year. This will allow him to offer a good quality product. 

Felix dreams of being able to have a supply store in his community, because this would allow him to produce goods and sell them at a better price. 

Honduras, May 2015

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, improved seeds, and foliage for his land.

loans.name: Holliness

texts.en:
Holliness is a Kiva borrower. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. Her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low working capital. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to have a large tailoring shop within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Don Alberto es un hombre de 40 años de edad, él se encuentra muy satisfecho por el apoyo que tuvo con el crédito pues gracias a ello puedo comprar sus semillas de papa y obtuvo muy buena cosecha, afortunadamente los pudo vender a un buen precio y le dejo una buena ganancia  por lo que pudo remodelar su casa, Don Alberto cuenta que el antes cultivaba muy poco pero ahora su cultivo ha incrementado, Don Alberto espera seguir contando con su apoyo con este nuevo préstamo que está solicitando que lo utilizara para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de papa.
Don Alberto sueña con mejorar sus ingresos para poder construir una casa de terraza para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alberto is a 40-year-old man. He is very satisfied with the support that he got from his previous loan; thanks to that loan, he was able to buy potato seeds and have a good harvest. Fortunately, he was able to sell his products at a good price, and this left him with a good earnings with which he could remodel his house. Alberto says that before he grew very little, but now, his crop has increased. 

Alberto hopes to continue relying on your support with this new loan, which he is requesting to buy seeds and fertilizers for her potato crop.

Alberta dreams of improving his income so that he can build a house with a terrace to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is married and has two children. She works hard to support her family. She operates a direct selling business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years.

Sonia requested a loan from NWTF for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more products such as soap and perfume to sell. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase soap, perfume, and other products

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en:
Genevieve is single with one child. For the past ten years she has had a manicure and pedicure service in the Philippines in order to support her family.

Genevieve has applied for a 5000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy more cosmetics for her business. She is working to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics for her nail care business

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Estelita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Estelita is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of groceries to sell for her general store business.

Estilita has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 24 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Janet is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Janet has been farming vegetables for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 32 years old and has five children. Judith is married and has five children who are in school.

Judith is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Judith has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Judith has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Judith would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: El Arbolito Group

texts.es:
Mavila es la presidenta del grupo El arbolito, grupo de 7 socios muy unidos y solidarios,Mavila tiene 53 años de edad, madre soltera que sola ha sabido sacar a sus dos hijos adelante, ahora ya mayores uno de 32 y de 30 años de edad, son profesionales trabajan y son independientes.
Mavila trabaja como vendedora ambulante en la venta de yogurt,gaseosas,y lo que se presenta en época de estación,lleva mas de 20 años en este rubro,trabaja desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde de martes a domingo,lo que mas le gusta es estar en contacto directo con la gente.sus principales clientes son amas de casa y vende mas o menos de 10 a 20 personas dirias,el préstamo que solicitó lo va a invertir en mercadería como  en la compra de yogurt,leche,gaseosas y demás,y mas adelante poder abrir su propio local. agradece a Kiva por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mavila is the president of the 7-member El Arbolito group. They are a very united and committed  group.  She is 53 years old and has single handledly raised her two children who are now 32 and 30. They have professional jobs and live independently.

Manvla sells yoghurt and soft drinks in the nearby streets, a job she's had for more than 20 years. She starts work at 9am and goes until 6pm from Tuesday to Sunday. She most enjoys the direct contact she has with her main customers who are housewives. In a single day she sells to between 10 and 20 people.

The loan she is seeking is to buy yoghurt, milk, soft drinks etc. In the future she would like to have her own fixed premises. She is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy products such as yoghurt and milk for her business

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo engages in fishing. He catches and sells fish to the local community.  He is a 61 year old married man with six grown children from Talibon, Bohol. He has been engaged in fishing for more than 20 years.  
 
Alfredo now needs funds to improve his fishing livelihood. 

He is asking for a loan to buy diesel engine.  This is very effective in the progress of his fishing livelihood. It could help improve his catch and sell more fish. His income will improve because of this. Therefore, Alfredo could pay his obligations and expand his fishing business.

He is determined to improve his business for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy diesel engine.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Retailing helped Judith provide for the family. She has a store that sells various food commodities and grocery items. Judith also engages in tuba (coconut wine) and banana vending for additional earnings. She applied for a loan to purchase store inventory items and pay for additional containers of tuba (coconut wine) for retail and bananas for sale. She finds the retailing business easy and simple because all she needs to do is to display and tend her store for her buyers.

loans.use: to purchase store inventory items and pay for additional containers of tuba (coconut wine) for retail and bananas for sale.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en: Bernadeth is 43 years old, married, and has five children. She lives in Migcanaway, Tangub City. Bernadeth operates a fishing business and owns fish cages. She earns a meager income each month doing this type of work, supporting the needs of her family, especially the education of her children, two of whom are now in college to obtain a degree. Bernadeth requested a loan for 35,000 PHP, which she will use to repair her fishing boat and maintain other fishing equipment to improve and expand her fishing business. In the future, she hopes to concrete her house and see all her children have stable jobs.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat and maintain other fishing equipment to improve and expand her fishing business

loans.name: Walter

texts.en: Walter is a single man. He describes himself to be competent. He operates a tailoring business where he makes clothes. His business is located in a marketable place and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock of tailoring materials. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable business. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en: Rosario is juggling a business and supervising the renovation of their home. She hopes to live comfortably in a house with good roofing supported by her loan of PHP 30,000. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record.

loans.use: to buy plywood, sand, gravel and wood for house repair.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a Kiva borrower. She operates a retail business, where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area with potential for business growth and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low working capital. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of clothes. This will enable her increase sales hence increase her profits. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her life.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothes.

loans.name: Esmerita

texts.en:
Esmerita is 62 years old and married with one child. For the past five years she has run her sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines. She sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, cookies, soap, shampoo, snack foods, candies and other groceries.

Esmerita has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy more stock for her shop. She always works with the idea in mind to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her sari-sari

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 37 years old and married with six children, who are in school. Leah works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of canned goods, noodles, soap and coffee to sell.  Leah has been in this business for three years.

In the future Leah would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of canned goods, noodles, soap and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman, 46 years old with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Mary Ann has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables like carrots, cabbage, potatoes, garlic, sweet potatoes, onions, etc. to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables like carrots, cabbage, potatoes, garlic, sweet potatoes, onions, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Marjorie Dayana

texts.es: Dayana es una joven de 21 años de edad, ella es madre soltera, su hijo tiene 2 años. Dayana se dedica a la comercialización de cosméticos de revista, Dayana sobre todo le va bien en la venta de perfumes, Dayana solicita e dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos, Dayana espera que le siga yendo bien en su negocio para que mejoren sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos para  cubrir todas sus necesidades diarias de pago de arriendo, alimentación, salud y mas.
texts.en:
Dayana is a 21 year-old young woman. She is a single mother, and her son is 2 years old. Dayana sells cosmetics from magazines, and does especially well with perfume sales. 

She is requesting to loan to invest in the purchase of cosmetics. Dayana hopes that things continue to go well in her business so that her sales will improve and as a result her income, which is needed to cover the daily expenses of rent, food, health and more.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 32 years old and has three children who are in school.

Janet has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Janet has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida hoped for good fortune when she joined the microfinance group Paglaum MPC, a Kiva field partner. She decided to give it a try after she learned she could request financial assistance for her pig business. Zenaida has maintained her membership in good standing with no record of defaults. All of her loans were repaid in a timely manner.

Recently Zenaida requested a 7,000 PHP loan to buy more piglets for her to raise and sell. She looks to her family for support and effective management of her venture. Providing her family a safe and decent life is important to her. She hopes to repair her house someday as well.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Jesus Albeiro

texts.es: Albeiro tiene 34 años de edad, el se dedica a trabajar de albañil, es músico aficionado, cría animales menores y a veces se va al jornal de trabajos de agricultura. Albeiro es un joven soltero que tiene nacionalidad colombiana y en la actualidad vive en Ecuador y comenta que le está yendo muy bien, Albeiro solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de pollos que los tiene en en corrales pequeños en la casa donde vive y paga arriendo. La aspiración de Albeiro es que no le haga falta el trabajo, comprar mas pollos readecuar los pequeños galpones y asi quedarse viviendo en Ecuador.
texts.en:
Albeiro is 34 years old and works as a builder; he is a big fan of music. Albeiro raises small animals and sometimes works as a farm labourer. Albeiro is a single young man; he is Colombian but currently lives in Ecuador. He says that life in Ecuador is going well for him.

Albeiro is applying for a loan in order to buy more chickens to keep in the small coops at the house that he rents. Albeiro always wants to have work and wants to have more chickens. He would also like to do up his small coops and continue living in Ecuador.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Miriam Oliva

texts.es: Oliva tiene 39 años de edad, ella es separada del que fue su esposo, Oliva tiene un hijo de 17 años y una hija de 15 años. Oliva vive en una casa por la que paga arriendo y allí tiene espacio para criar pollos, Oliva solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en compra de pollos, Oliva espera poder mejorar su negocio, criar los pollos en los galpones y asi lograr que su negocio sea mas productivo ya que tiene la responsabilidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Oliva is 39 years old and separated. She has one son, 17 years old, and a daughter, 15 years old. Oliva rents her house and there has a space for raising chickens.

Oliva is applying for this loan in order to buy chickens. Oliva hopes to improve her business and raise her chickens in coops. She wants her business to be more productive as she is responsible for helping her children to move forward in life.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en: Edgar is 33 years old and works in the construction industry. He specializes in plumbing, electricity and maintenance services. He has been in this line of work for more than 15 years. Edgar is asking for a loan to buy some machine tools necessary for his job. He says that his goal is to start a maintenance company and become independent.
